loans.name: Mustafa Farid

texts.en:
This is Mustafa Farid, son of P. M.. He is 35 years old. He lives in Kabul Afghanistan. He lives in a family of 8 members. His brother is engaged and now he wants him to get married. But with the money they have, it is not possible for them to pay for all the expenses of the wedding. That is why he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani to solve his problem and to have an organized and good wedding.

He would like to thank the Kiva lenders a lot because of their great support in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For wedding expenses

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es: Angela es casada, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, trabaja para el MINED como profesora de primariaen El Centro Escolar Pablo Hurtado de Juigalpa, todos los dias Angela se levanta muy temprano a alistar a sus niños para luego trasladarse a su trabajo como docente; el marido labora como electricista residencial el que la apoya con sus compromisos y el sostenimiento familiar, esta solicitando su 2do credito para construir una habitacion para sus hijos, pues carecen de ella, y si el credito lo permite repellar la casa para reforzar las paredes, su mayor sueño es alcanzar mejorar su vivenda de forma digna para asi tener mejres condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Angela is married and has two school-age children. She works for the Ministry of Education (MINED) as an elementary school teacher at the Pablo Hurtado Scholastic Center in Juigalpa. Every day Angela wakes up early so that she can take her children to school and proceed to her teaching job. Her husband works as a residential electrician in order to support the family commitments.

Angela is requesting her second loan in order to build a room for her children. She will also have her house plastered in order to reinforce the walls. Her dream is to complete these improvements so that she can have a dignified home that provides her family with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room & plaster the walls of the house

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, de 41 años, es un hombre muy sincero y trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Ana de 39 años y lo que más desea es tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para cumplir con su labor, él es uno de los pocos panaderos de su localidad, es por eso que su negocio es muy concurrido. Los panes que él prepara son muy sabrosos y nutritivos, ya que pone mucho empeño en elaborarlos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hornear los panes, ya que se esmera mucho en que salgan bien, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse en la madrugada para preparar la masa. 
Para el futuro, espera hacer crecer su negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Pedro con MFP y se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido, ya que sabe que le será de mucha ayuda para hacer progresar su negocio. Con los dos mil soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para elaborar una mayor cantidad de panes.
texts.en:
Pedro, who is 41 years old, is a sincere and hard-working man. He lives in his own house along with his wife, Ana, who is 39. What he wishes for most is to have a better quality of life. Every day, he wakes up early in order to accomplish all his work. He is one of a few bakers in his area. As a result, his business is busy. The breads that he prepares are very delicious and nutritious since he puts a lot of effort into making them. What he likes most about his job is baking the breads since it takes a lot of work for them to come out well. He has 11 years experience with this activity and he considers getting up at dawn to prepare the dough the most difficult part. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and improve his income. This is Pedro's first loan with MFP and he feels happy to obtain it knowing it will help advance his business. With the two thousand soles that he's requested, he will purchase more ingredients to make a greater quantity of bread.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Theresa works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She trades in utensils. She buys from Accra and hawks to sell in her community. She travels to sell as well. Theresa has been in business for over ten years and wants to increase her stock. It is her desire to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy more utensils to sell.

loans.name: Trifon Andres

texts.es:
El Sr. Trifon, tiene un tranporte que lo trabaja en el sindicato de trufis ATL, que hacen la ruta del centro de la ciudad a los diversos lugares de la zona sur, su esposa la Sra. Simona, trabaja de empleada del Hogar en la zona Los Pinos, tienen cinco hijos, de los cuales los dos mayores ya trabajan independientemente y los otros tres en edad escolar.

El trabajo con Emprender desde el año 2003 en el grupo solidario Aguilas, a la fecha tambien trabaja cuando le requieren en el manejo de volqueta para la construcción de los puentes trillizos, él con su familia viven en la casa de un pariente a manera de cuidadores, donde se encuentran ya más de seis años.						
						
Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Trifon works in public transportation; he owns a trufi (minibus) and he is a member of the ATL organization (in Bolivia, public transport vehicles are privately-owned and organized into routes by various union organizations.) He drives a route from the center of the city to diverse locations in the southern part of the city. His wife, Simona, is a housekeeper in the Los Pinos neighborhood. They have 5 children; 2 of them are adults and work independently and the others are school-aged. He began working with Emprender in the year 2003 in the Aguilas group. Since that date he has also worked as needed as a dump truck driver for the construction of the "Bridge of Triplets" (a major public construction project in La Paz.) He has lived with his family in a house owned by a relative for 6 years, where they serve as caretakers. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided in granting him this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tires and to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Waheeda Farid Group

texts.en:
This is the Waheeda Farid Group. This group is made up of four members: M. Ajmal, Ahmad Jawed, Farida ,and Waheeda. 

Ajmal, who is in the middle in the photograph, is the leader of the Waheeda Farid Group. He is a 30-year-old married man with two children. He wants a loan for his wife's tailoring business. With this loan, his wife wants to buy cloth and other things for her business. 

The second member of this group is Ahmad Jawed. He wants a loan for his brother who has a retail shop. With this loan, he wants to buy more food for his shop. 

Farida wants a loan for her brother who has a stationary shop. With this loan, he wants to buy notebooks, pens, and writing paper. 

The last member, Waheeda, wants a loan for her husband who has a flower shop. With this loan, he wants to buy more flowers and other things for his shop. 

They have requested a group of loan 40000 Afghani. They would like to say "lots of thanks" to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy cloth for his wife's tailoring business

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El señor Celso N. Solís es casado con hijos mayores, domiciliado en la compañía Almada de Caacupe. 
 El señor Celso es un hombre muy trabajador y tiene tres actividades es agricultor y ahora tiene plantación de poroto y maní y también tiene una olería(lugar donde se fabrica ladrillo). 
Solicita el crédito para  la compra y almacenamiento de  arcilla para la olería
  Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por el apoyo obtenido por que gracias al crédito puede producir mas ladrillos y aprovechar que ahora tiene buen precio en el mercado y también incrementara sus ingresos  a su unidad familiar
texts.en:
Mr. Celso N. Solís is married, has grown children and lives in the Almada de Caacupe village. Celso is a hardworking man: he is a farmer, he plants beans and peanuts, and he runs an "olería," a place where bricks are made from clay. He is asking for a loan to buy and store more clay for the olería. He thanks Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya for the support it has given him; thanks to this loan he will be able to produce more bricks and -- since the market is good for construction right now -- he will increase his family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clay to make bricks

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata S. est une yoffoise de 46 ans. Elle habite plus précisément  dans le quartier de Layenne. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de l’u-Imcec  à Yoff depuis décembre  2002. Elle est mariée et mère  de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 15 et 19 ans. C’est une commerçante  vendeuse d’aliment de bétail  céréales  et d’autres produits divers utilises par les tradipraticiens. Elle évolue dans ce secteur depuis  2005. A cause du fait qu’elle n’ait pas réussi dans ses études, elle a choisi cette activité par passion et pour ne pas rester inactive. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs destine a l’achat de mil, mais, blé, d’aliment de moutons et de cheval pour renforcer son activité. Ses bénéfices  réalisés lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins personnels et d’améliorer le cadre de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Aminata S. is a 46-year-old woman from Yoff.  She lives in the Layenne district to be more precise.  She has a been a member of the lending group U-IMCEC in Yoff since December 2002.  She is married and the mother of two children, who range from 15 to 19 years of age.  Aminata is a merchant who sells grain, livestock feed, and various other items used by traditional practitioners.  She has been advancing in this sector since 2005.  Due to the fact she was unsuccessful in school, she chose this business out of passion and to be active. Aminata is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs destined for buying millet, corn, wheat, and feed for sheep and horses in order to bolster her business.  Her profits enable her to satisfy her personnel needs and to improve her family's living conditions. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her funds

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en:
Wassim has owned a car repair shop for the past fifteen years and specializes in repairing bodywork in addition to painting. He started working in this occupation when he was quite young and, due to his long experience, he was able to make a good number of customers over the years.

Wassim has already taken a loan from Kiva and he's pleased with his decision to take a loan via Ameen. He has repaid on-time and he has even repaid the full loan amount earlier than his scheduled end date.

Today, Wassim is requesting a new loan of $2,000 to buy new tools needed for his business in order to increase his business productivity.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his business

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah is a single mother. She owns a two-room house where she lives with seven people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. She takes care of additional family members. The family gets three meals per day. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Hadjah owns a stall in Ndeeba market selling bananas. She works seven days per week. She would like to purchase more bunches of bananas with the Ush. 800,000 loan from MCDT. She rents the space for her business at 15000/= per month. She has been running the business for many years.  She has at least 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people both at retail and at wholesale.  Her greatest challenges are the rainy season and seasonality, because she works from an open place. Hadjah has worked with MCDT for a long time and chose the organization because it was easy to join. Hadjah aspires to go directly to farmers to buy bananas.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Shally

texts.en:
Shally D. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Shally is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Shally owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling candles in the local community. Shally has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Shally joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Shally has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Shally is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Shally from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, particularly candles

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO” de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 59 años.  Actualmente, vive en la ciudad de Calca. 

Su principal actividad económica es vender comida en el mercado modelo de Calca. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella requiere el préstamo para la educación de sus hijos.

Andrea se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.   (En la fotografía la socia esta acompañada de su hija Marivel).
texts.en:
Andrea belongs to the commercial bank "Valle Sagrado" (Sacred Valley), which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. She is 59 years old, and currently lives in the city of Calca. Her main economic activity is selling food in the Mercado Modelo in Calca. She has had this business now for 10 years, and it is going very well. She needs a loan to pay for the education of her children. Andrea is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule. (In the photograph she is accompanied by her daughter, Marivel.)

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for the education of her children

loans.name: Nurjamal's Group

texts.en:
All four of this loan group are determined to work hard to succeed in life, because they believe that success must be earned.

Z. Nurjamal leads the group. She is 35 years old and has three children. Her husband provides for the family by doing odd jobs. Nurjamal helps her husband by raising cattle and selling milk. She sees herself as his right hand and assistant in providing for their children. She also believes that her business has a big future, but needs time and financial support, and has applied for a loan to buy some goats. 

Nurjamal’s partners in this loan group are:

K. Akylai, 40, who is married and has five children. Her husband is a shepherd, and together they raise livestock and farm. They will use their portion of this loan to work their field. 

A. Erkayim, 37, is divorced and has a four-year-old son. She makes a living raising livestock which she inherited from her parents. She has a stable income of $140 a month and hopes to use this loan to buy some sheep. 

T. Mubarahan, 47, is married and has five children. Her husband works as a guard in a local school while she raises livestock, sells milk and farms a piece of land. She needs a loan to buy fuel to use to work in her field.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and watch a video about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team, which is called Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to help four people expand their small businesses

loans.name: Qoriccoyllor Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICCOYLLOR”; Nuestros socios viven en el distrito de Huanchac provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el Sr Americo,  él socio  es secretario del grupo comunal y él se dedica a las construcciones civiles siendo el maestro de obras, Nuestro socio tiene a su cargo personal de trabajo otros obreros que él los contrA. para trabajar en diferentes construcciones y una vez que le pagan a él este les paga a sus operarios obreros, el socio solicita el préstamo para iniciar algunos trabajos y contratar personal. Nuestros otros socios se dedican al servicio de taxis, comerciantes minoristas, trabajadores en construcción.
  
Los socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “Qoriccoyllor” Communal Bank. They live in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sr. Americo, who serves as the Communal Bank secretary. He works in civil construction as a master builder. Americo is in charge of a staff of workers hired for different construction projects and is responsible for paying them. He is requesting a loan so that he can start some new projects and hire the necessary labor. The other members of the group provide taxi services, operate small businesses, or work in construction.

The members appreciate and value the support that has been provided to them. Therefore, they promises to complete their payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire workers needed to start new construction projects

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en:
N. Umedjon is 25 years old and is married. He owns a shop in which he sells spare moped engine parts, a business he has been running for the last 7 years. The income he earns allows him to support his family including his parents too. To meet his customers’ constantly growing demand, Umedjon would like to increase his shop’s capacity. The profits from these sales will allow him to continue to improve his living conditions. The loan will greatly improve Umedjon’s income and his family's living standards.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing car spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old unmarried man from Lebanon. He is living with his family. This young entrepreneur is an experienced men's hairdresser.  He has almost five years of experience in this occupation. He also works with his brother to help their father who works as a farmer with a small income for the household. He opened his barbershop in 2007. 

With this loan request from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. he is planning to expand his business by purchasing hairdressing supplies such as wax, gel, etc. to attract more and serve a bigger range of clients.

loans.use: To purchase hairdressing supplies.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en:
Edilberto is a 47-year-old father of four who lives in Los Chiles, located in the Northern region of Costa Rica. Edilberto lives with his wife and two daughters. Like many member of the Los Chiles community, Edilberto is a farmer. He dedicates his time to the planting and harvesting of various subsistence crops including chili peppers. Edilberto is always busy. He organizes his day so that in the morning he wakes up early, eats breakfast and then tends to his chickens. At night, when he has finished working in the fields, he puts in a few more hours at the corner store, which is a part of his house. 

This loan will be used to finance the production of Habanero chili peppers.  Specifically, Edilberto will use this money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, tools, pesticides, and other materials/ingredients necessary to the production of chili peppers. All labor and transportation tasks will be carried out by Edilberto and his family. Edilberto dedicates part of his time as a hired hand on a nearby farm. He worries about the coming harvesting season and hopes that he will be successful this year.  Edilberto´s goal is to maintain stability in his family, achieve higher production rates, improve his economic situation and offer a better standard of living to his family. A major difficulty and limitation for Edilberto has been his lack of working capital. He hopes to use this loan effectively to improve life on the farm for everyone.

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or, PROPICA is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Los Chiles, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA, represents a unique opportunity to Edilberto, his family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Edilberto wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. He wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and nutrients for the production of chili peppers.

loans.name: Mario Ivan

texts.es:
Mario de 45 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada de un estero salado) el tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Mario comenzó vendiendo arroz, bebidas y otros víveres para poder mantener a sus dos hijos y esposa que le ayuda en el negocio. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm. Vende bebidas, granes y otros vives. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas y granos para mejorar y surtir su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande y surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Mario is 45 years old. He lives along the Perimetral Highway of Guayaquil (a periurban area that is situated near a salt marsh). He runs a small store out of the back of his home. He started out by selling rice, drinks, and other supplies to earn money to support his two children and wife who also helps with the business. He works from 6 in the morning to 9 at night. He sells drinks, grains, and other items. Mario plans to use the loan to buy more drinks and grains to better stock his store. He would like to see his business grow and offer more products in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy drinks and grains

loans.name: Ork

texts.en:
Mr. Ork S. is an older man whose wife appears in the photograph. He is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses from which he earns a living. Another earner is his wife, who works planting crops on their own farmland. They have three teenage kids, two of whom are employed and another one is a secondary student.

Ork S. has requested a loan for his wife use to buy fertilizer to improve her crops that are not growing well.

loans.use: To enable his wife to buy fertilizer to improve her crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of slippers

loans.name: Ditalala Plus Group

texts.en:
Nathalie is the leader of a community bank named “Ditalala Plus”, which is composed of 18 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through microfinance institution, HOPE RDC, with the goal of developing their businesses.
Nathalie, 39, is married and has three children aged between seven and ten years old, two of whom attend school. Nathalie sells beans, peanuts and eggs. She started her business in 2009. She has worked with determination and good management in order to achieve her goal of opening a large bean facility in her locality. With her next loan she intends to purchase a sack of peanuts and miscellaneous goods to increase the inventory of her business. Currently, she earns a profit of $77 each week.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of peanuts and miscellaneous goods for resale

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
Ellas son el grupo Las Margaritas conformado por cinco mujeres que luchan diariamente por brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos para que puedan salir adelante. Actualmente radican en la comunidad de Tlapala a las orillas de Chalco, su municipio es conocido como: “La tierra del Mariachi” porque ahí eso es como una profesión. El grupo se basa en amistad y lealtad entre si, es por eso que cada integrante se siente muy bien formando parte de Las Margaritas. 

Ella es Esperanza A. Gómez tiene 27 años de edad, su familia esta integrada por su esposo quien trabaja de albañil y su hija de dos años. Comenzó con sus ventas hace seis meses, ya que su esposos había sufrido un pequeño accidente en su trabajo, motivo por el cual no podía llevar un sustento a su hogar asi que E. decidió ayudar a su esposo y comenzó con la elaboración de postres en su comunidad, actualmente se ha hecho de su clientela a base de esfuerzos, incluso hay gente que le hace pedidos especiales para algunos eventos infantiles y eso es muy confortable para ella, con el crédito que le llego piensa invertirlo en la compra de vasos, moldes, cucharas, y tener un poco mas de ganancias, “La verdad estoy muy contenta de haber iniciado con esta actividad y que Kiva nos apoye” dice Esperanza.

Sus planes son poder tomar un curso de pastelería e irse inovando en los postres y asi poder abrir un local y seguir repartiéndole a la gente. 

Los demás integrantes son: 
Angélica F. Hernández (Venta de abarrotes y cremería)
Candelaria B. García (Venta de Jarciaría)
María E. L. (Venta de Abarrotes )
Ana Karen T. L. (Venta de Cosméticos por Catalogo)
texts.en:
The Las Margaritas group is made up of five women.They fight daily to offer a better future to their children, so they can improve their lives. At the moment, they live in the Tlapala community, near the Chalco lake. It is known as “the land of the Mariachi” because it’s seen as a profession here. The group is based on friendship and loyalty between them; for this reason, each member feels like an important part of the group.

Esperanza A. Gómez is 27 years old. Her family is made up of her husband who works as a construction worker and her two year old daughter. She started her sales six months ago, after her husband had a small accident at work. He was unable to support the household and so E. decided to help her husband. She started to make desserts in her community. Now, she has customers which include those who make special requests for children's events.This is very comfortable for her. With this loan, she is thinking about investing in the purchase of glasses, baking pans, spoons and to have have a little more profit. Esperanza says “ The truth is that I am very happy to start with this business and that Kiva is supporting us.”

Her plans are to take a baking course and make new desserts. Then, she can open a store and continue to share her desserts with everyone. The other members are: Angélica F. Hernández (grocery and dairy sales) Candelaria B. García (Jarciaría sales) María E. L. ( grocery sales) Ana Karen T. L. ( catalog cosmetics sales)

loans.use: to buy glasses, plates, spoons, gelatin, milk, etc.

loans.name: Nancy Fabiola

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy es socia del banco comunal Fe y Alegría, vive por el sector de Medio Ejido en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de sus calles, su centro histórico, su gente que es amable, cordial y aun mantienen sus tradiciones, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

Doña Nancy tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 13 y 7 años de edad,  sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su ultima hija está estudiando en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un camión. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora Nancy es comerciante de ropa, vende los días miércoles y lleva en el negocio  5 años, el resto de días se dedica al cuidado de su familia aprovechando el tiempo para vender cosméticos por catalogo y este negocio también lo tiene hace 4 años.
 
Es el octavo crédito que realiza la banca comunal y le han servido mucho para incrementar su mercadería, su nuevo crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de más ropa para la navidad.
 
Su sueño es viajar a New York.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Fe y Alegría communal bank. She lives in the Medio Ejido area in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for the beauty of its streets, its historical center, its friendly, cordial people who still keep their traditions, and its variety of food. 

Nancy is 38 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children, 15,13 and 7. Her first two children go to high school and the youngest daughter goes to an elementary school in the city. Her husband is a driver and works driving a truck. She doesn't own her own home and they rent.  
 
Nancy is a clothing merchant. She sells on Wednesdays and has had the business for 5 years. The rest of the time she takes care of her family and uses the time to sell cosmetics via catalog and she has had this business also for 4 years.  
 
This is the eighth loan with the communal and it has helped them a lot to increase their merchandise. The new loan will be used to invest in purchasing more clothing for Christmas.  
 
Her dream is to travel to New York.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a 42-year-old member of Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, registered under the Lady Lee group. The group members support each other by guaranteeing each other's loans and sharing business ideas. Judith joined this group of entrepreneurs as a businesswoman who sells mainly clothes. She has been running her business for five and a half years, and also runs a grocery business to generate extra income. Judith hopes to improve her standard of living in the future. She has requested 20,000 KES to buy clothes, shoes and bedsheets.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes and bedsheets

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Carlos Alberto; el tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, el vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y fideos, el socio atiende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, el socio quiere mejorar y ampliar la tienda de abarrotes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar y galletas al por mayor.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Alberto is a member of the communal bank “Los Lideres” [The Leaders] which is in Cusco District, Province of Cusco in the Department of Cusco.  

He is 35 years old and lives with his common-law wife and their two children. His time is divided between his daily activities and working at his grocery store. He works from 5:00am until 10:00pm selling staples like rice, sugar and pasta. 

He would like to improve and enlarge his store and requests the loan to buy produce like rice, sugar and crackers wholesale. He would like to thank the people who will contribute to his dream and he has committed himself to pay the loan back in a timely manner.

loans.use: The member requests the loan to buy produce wholesale like rice, sugar, crackers

loans.name: Florebelle

texts.en:
Florebelle B. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 24 years old. Florebelle is separated from her spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Florebelle owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling animal feed & farm-related products in the local community. Florebelle has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Florebelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florebelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Florebelle is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional feed products. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Florebelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed products

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Arlyn S. is 39 years of age and married. She is a resident of Bocator, Tangub City. She is blessed with children all of whom are now adults. Her husband Dionesio is presently engaged in fishing and earning an average income of at least P300.00 a week. She joined PAGLAUM MPC this year because she is very interested in their products and services. PAGLAUM MPC is one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao, and was awarded Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the COOP-LGU Partnership Award of 2006.  She is requesting the amount of P3,000.00 for her 1st loan. This loan will be used to add capital to their existing fish vending business. The couple has strong determination that someday their business will be successful.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fish for her business

loans.name: Sevda

texts.ru:
Sevda B. 47 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 5 detey, 3 iz kotorix uchatsya v kolledje a dva ix kotorix uchatsya v shkole. Sevda jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi. 

Sevda uje 12 let kak rabotayet uchitelniccey. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye qde ona zanimayetsya so svoimi uchenikami tak kak ix stanovitsya bolshe i ona zanimayetsya qruppami.
texts.en:
Sevda B. is 47 years old.  She is married and has five children.  Three of her children go to college while the other two go to school.  Sevda lives in the Absheron region with her husband and children.

Sevda has been a teacher for twelve years.  She needs 2000 AZN to expand her classroom since the students she teaches as a group are growing up.

loans.use: To expand her classroom

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila B. is from the village of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Mila is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Mila owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mila is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Mila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey A. is thirty-two years old, married to Rodah and the father of two children. He runs a retail shop in Soysambu on the outskirts of Kitale town. He has been in this business for five years now and he gets a monthly income of about $125.

This will be Geofrey's first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use the entire loan to buy stock for his business, buying rice, sugar, cooking fat, etc. With the income he is going to get, he plans to save some money in the bank and to buy more items for his retail shop. 

In the future, Geofrey wants to expand his business and also become independent.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking fat, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La Sra. Yolanda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin. Es Conviviente, tiene 48 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 1 que aún depende de ella.

Yolanda es una mujer que se siente con muchas ganas de trabajar. Se  dedica a la venta de abarrotes, negocio que se ubica en su misma casa en un espacio amplio y acondicionado, donde a diario atiende a sus clientes. Actualmente continua con el mismo negocio, es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes que a diario acuden a su negocio a comprar.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, galletas de todos los sabores, golosinas en diferentes variedades, shampoo en diferentes marcas,  bebidas gasificadas de diferentes tamaños y marcas, y productos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Yolanda se siente una mujer realizada, con más ganas de salir siempre adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su pequeño negocio, tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Yolanda belongs to the "Los Eucaliptos” (Eucalyptus Trees) community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martin province and department.  She is 48 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children, 1 of whom is still dependent.

Yolanda is a woman who has a great desire to work.  Her business is selling groceries and it is located in her home in a large space adapted for the purpose.  This is where she serves her customers.  Yolanda is currently continuing in this business.  She is very well known and liked by her customers who come to her business every day to buy from her.

Yolanda will use this loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles to buy bags of rice and sugar, different flavored cookies, different types of candy, different brands of shampoo, different sizes and brands of soda, and personal care products, in order to continue providing a good service to her customers.

Yolanda feels fulfilled but still has a desire to get ahead.  She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her, and other women like her, to set up their small businesses.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and sugar, different flavored cookies, different varieties of candy, different brands of shampoo, different sizes and brands of soda, and personal care products

loans.name: Phang

texts.en: Phang S. has been weaving baskets at home for many years in Kompong Chhnang province. She and her husband work together from home making baskets, and her regular clients come directly to their house to buy them. In order to increase her income, Phang S. has applied for a loan to buy several piglets for feeding, which she will sell when they are big enough.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married to a businessman with seven children, three are in school and four have graduated from school. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. For the past 25 years, she has operated a food stall selling business at a nearby school, selling to children going to school. Saumu faces a major challenge of seasonality. There is a high demand during school days and it is low during the holiday season. 

Saumu dreams of expanding her business to generate more income and educate her children. With the Kshs 10,000 she is requesting, she wants to pay school fees for her child. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia O. is 48 years old, widowed, and has three children.  They live in Trinidad, Bohol. She earns a living through farming and food vending. She tills the land where she plants and harvests rice. She also cooks rice cakes and other delicacies, which she sells to the people in her community. Virginia is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers and ingredients such as sugar and flour. She hopes to be able to sustain her children's education. She also wants to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and ingredients such as sugar and flour

loans.name: Njiru

texts.en:
Njiru is a farmer in Muranga area of Central Kenya. He has been in the farming business for over ten years, producing tea which goes to Kenya Tea Development Authority, and milk which he supplies to Brookside Dairies. He has two farmhands and fully relies on farming for his family upkeep. His three children are aged between 1 and 12.

Njiru has made a request for 63,600 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He is optimistic that a better breed of dairy cow will generate more income and help lift his family's living standard. He is also focusing on increasing the number of his dairy cows to five.

Njiru says the Juhudi Kilimo agricultural loans will enable very many farmers to improve their farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Agbogan Dela Akossiwa

texts.fr:
madame kossi agbogan dela akossiwa est une commerçante spécialisée dans la vente de chaussures, tissus et de bijoux.
elle capitalise une expérience de 4 ans dans le domaine.elle s'approvisionne pour la plupart du temps au Togo.ainsi elle sollicite ce montant pour augmenter son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Mrs. Kossi Agbogan dela Akossiwa is a retailer specialized in the trade of shoes, fabrics and jewelry.
She is capitalizing on four years of experience in this domain. Most of the time, she gets her supplies from Togo. Therefore she is requesting this loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase more stock (shoes, material, jewellery) from Togo for resale

loans.name: Kroch

texts.en:
Mrs. Kroch has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and usually generates an income of $2.50 per day. Her husband works with her in the farm field, in addition to his job as a construction worker.  Mrs. Kroch also raises piglets behind her house to earn extra income. 

Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Mrs. Kroch and her family, she has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale.  Mrs. Kroch has two children, one is single and the other one is married.

loans.use: buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is a married woman with three children. She plans to fund their education through the income that her loan provides.

Jeanette is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. Jeanette has been growing rice for eight years. Jeanette earns 4,300 Philippines pesos per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, Jeanette hopes to buy a bigger farm to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Githinji

texts.en:
Githinji is  37 years old, married and a father of five children. He has been selling clothes in Mombasa’s Mshomoroni estate for the last eight years and has been doing well. 

This loan marks Githinji's first borrowing from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more clothing stock to sell. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and for his family's upkeep. Githinji’s dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing stock

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Annaliza has a retail shop that sells detergents, cleaning agents & snacks. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional products from PERSONAL CARE.

Annaliza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Annaliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products from PERSONAL CARE.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a clothing-sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more inventory for her business. Leah has been in this business for 5 years and earns additional income from food vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Filena De La Cruz

texts.es:
Doña Filena, desde hace nueve años, vende ropa nueva, cosmetico y utensilios escolares, negocio con el cual, ha logrado apoyar a sus hijos, y a su esposo con los gastos basico de agua y luz. Su esposo labora como cadete de su propio taxi, en donde junto han logrado un techo digno para sus hijos.
Filena comenzo  con dinero propio, y luego para invertir mas, lo hace atraves del prestamo en Afodenic, en donde ha crecido en inventario, y captacion de cliente.
En la venta de ropa, trabaja con creditos de quincena y tiene muchos pedidos, es por eso con este nuevo financiamiento sera para la compra de ropa, cosmeticos y utensilios escolares en variedad, tambien comprara una paca de ropa de cama, ya que son bonita y accesibles de precios, en el cual quiere probar como le va, con esta nueva inversion.con el proposito de obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
For 9 years, Filena has sold clothes, cosmetics and school supplies, a business that has allowed her to support her children and her husband and pay for basic needs like water and electricity. Her husband works as a driver in his own taxi, and together they have provided a worthy home for their children. Filena started with her own money, and later invested more through Afrodenic, which has increased her inventory and customer base.

For clothing sales, she works with 15 day credits and has a lot of orders, so this new loan will be used to buy clothing, cosmetics and various school supplies. She will also buy a bundle of bed sheets because they are pretty and affordable and she wants to see how this new investment will go, with the possibility of obtaining more income.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, school supplies and a pack of bed sheets to increase her sales.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old and married to Remerico who is a local farmer . They live in Dalaoig, Alcala, Cagayan. The couple was blessed with four children and all are attending school. Gemma and Remerico plant and harvest rice for future sale. 

As farmers working in the Philippines, they usually earn about P 50,000 each crop season (May and November). Profits earned go to school fees and sundry needs at home like daily meals and electric bills. 

Gemma is now requesting a loan of P 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and moluscicides (chemicals used to kill snails) used in farming. She hopes that her crop will produce more yield to increase her profits.

In the future, Gemma hopes to earn consistent profits to continuously send her children to school and earn a degree to have a brighter future someday.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and moluscicides used in farming.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 37 year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children, of whom two are in school. He has been operating an entertainment service for the last 5 years. Previously he was employed by someone else. He wants, in the next 5 years, to have opened up a music shop. His dream is to excel in the music industry.

He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a video camera. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he is now more business-minded.

loans.use: to buy a video camera

loans.name: Campo Verde Group

texts.es:
La señora Mari Cleidy, es casada con el señor  Francisco Javier y con quien procreo  un hijo de la edad de   dos meses y vive en un lugar muy bonito  en donde celebran la fiesta de la virgen de candelaria el 2 de febrero.

    Ella  es ama de casa y es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en fundación realidad y es para invertirlo en la compra de  ingredientes como son: harina, huevo, queso, aceite, entre otros para la  elaboración  de pan. En donde lleva practicando  tres mese y le va bien.

    En esta actividad se inspiro ya que su abuela le pidió ayuda a elaborarlo y le gusto y es como se asocio con ella  para trabajar juntas así tener un mejor ingreso y apoyar a su esposo en la solvencia económica.

     Lo que más se desea  es que con esta actividad pueda continuar trabajando para tener sus propios ahorros para solventar sus gastos de su hogar.

     Las persona que también integran en el grupo son: las señora  Antonia quien solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tostadas, así también se integra la señora  Rasura quien  invertirá el préstamo en la compra de cosméticos y así  también en su pequeño negocio de abarrotes  y por último se integra también la señora  Amelia quien invierte en su molino.
texts.en:
Mari Cleidy is married to Francisco Javier with whom he has a two month old son. She lives in a very pretty place where the celebrate the festival of the  Virgen de Candelaria on February 2. 

She is a housewife and this is the first time that she has asked for a loan from the Foundation. It is to invest in buying ingredients such as: flour, eggs, cheese, oil and more to make bread. She has been doing this for three months and it is going well for her.  

She was inspired to do this activity by her grandmother who asked for her help doing it. She liked it and is a partner. They work together to have more income and she helps her husband with expenses.

What she wants the most to to be able to keep working in this activity to be able to have her own savings for her household expenses.

The other members of the group are: Antonia, who asked for the loan to invest in buying ingredients to make tostadas, and Rasura, who will invest the loan in buying cosmetics and to invest in her small store. Lastly, there is Amelia, who will invest in her mill.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Mercedes, se dedica a la producción de leche que vende a la Planta Industrializadora de leche PIL y su esposo es profesor. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar una vaca lechera para aumentar la producción de leche y generar mejores ingresos para su familia. Vive en casa propia ubicado en la localidad de Achacachi  del departamento de La Paz; Mercedes  es casada y tiene un hijo. Es la Primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y en Kiva.
texts.en:
Mercedes devotes herself to milk production, which she sells to the industrial milk production plant called PIL.  Her husband is a teacher.

She needs the loan to buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production and generate better income for her family.

She lives in her own house in Achacachi in the La Paz department.  Mercedes is married and has one child.

This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production and generate better income

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
13 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní se unieron con el propósito de ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo. Ellas desean que sus hijos y familiares no tengan que pasar por las mismas privaciones que ellas, es por eso que deciden organizarse y entrar al programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Matilde, ella se dedica a la carnicería, en su negocio vende todo tipo de cortes de carnes. Comenta que lleva un tiempo en esto, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre acuden hasta ella. Por medio de este negocio ella logra salir y sacar adelante a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cortes de carnes, costillas vacunas y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta les brinda como grupo.
texts.en:
13 women from the city of Santaní came together with the plan of helping their families through their work.  They want their children and relatives not to have to go through the same privations that they have done, and this is why they have decided to organize themselves and enter Fundación Paraguaya's program for entrepreneurial women.

One of the group's members is Señora Matilde.  She works as a butcher, selling all types and cuts of meat.  She comments that it has taken a while, but she has a solid customer base who always go to her.  By means of this business, she has been able to succeed and move her family ahead in life.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cuts of meat, beef ribs, and more, with which she can stock up and meet her customers' orders.  She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity which is being provided to this group.

loans.use: to buy cuts of meat for later sale.

loans.name: Soura Yé Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM est la représentante du groupe SOURA YE. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. Deux(02) vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle est restauratrice depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Nabraaga en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, homme et les enfants.

Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de riz, 01 carton de spaghetti et des légumes.

Mme économise pour agrandir son restaurant. Elle ambitionne ouvrir d’autres point de vente et d’assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mariam is the representative of the "Soura Ye" group. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 20 years old and the youngest is 10 years old. Two of her children go to school. She has five people dependent on her.

She has had a restaurant for ten years. She stocks up at the Nabraaga market in the city. Her customers are men, women and children.

She would like to buy 2 sacks of rice, 1 box of spaghetti and some vegetables.

She is saving up to expand her restaurant. Her goal is to open other points of sale and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of riz, one box of spaghetti and some vegetables.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 44, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a single mother who has two children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Edna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells cooked viands (meals) for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 250 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Edna hopes to be able to expand soon and have her own house, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, toiletries, beverages, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru: Александр женат. Он имеет свой бизнес. Жена поддерживает и помогает ему в работе. Александр продает мужскую обувь  и одежду в магазине Вернисаж. Он всегда уверен в качестве своего товара, так как раньше занимался шитьем обуви.  Александр целеустремленный и надежный. В ближайшее время он ставит для себя целью наладить связи с поставщиками нового товара. Александр просит предоставить ему кредит  в сумме 20,000 гривен на закупку зимней обуви. Благодаря кредиту он сможет увеличить ассортимент и размерный ряд товара.
texts.en:
Alexander is married. He owns a business which his wife helps him run. Alexander sells men's footwear and clothing in a store called Vernisaj. He's always confident in the quality of his product; he was a shoemaker in the past. 
Alexander is driven and consistent. In the near future, he plans to establish relations with new suppliers. 
He's asking for a loan of 20,000 grivnas in order to purchase some winter footwear. With the loan, he'll be able to increase his assortment of products and their size range.

loans.use: to purchase winter footwear for resale.

loans.name: Ushindi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ushindi Group in Western Kenya! Celestine is the facilitator of Ushindi group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Celestine takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Celestine had a very good maize yield, harvesting 13 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Celestine was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Celestine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Celestine will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ushindi group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials such as paints, varnishes and a bedroom suite.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 50-year-old man from Migori County, which is on the shores of Lake Victoria in Kenya. He is married to Mary and they have eleven children.

George operates a motorcycle transport business and has been doing this for the last four years. This kind of service is popular in this area due to its availability and low cost. He is taking his first loan which he will use to buy a second-hand motorbike.  He will use the profits to build a house for his family.

His dream is to own a fleet of motorcycles.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Sofia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sofía, tiene 55 años de edad vive con su madre y sus hijos ya no viven con ella, ella realiza la venta de pupusas todos los días desde las dos de la tarde hasta las 8:30 de la noche, este negocio tiene una trayectoria de más de 15 años por lo cual tiene la ventaja de tener clientes bien definidos.

Está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en materiales para la pupuseria, maíz, condimentos, aceite, gaciosas y jugos, esta compra ayudará a incrementar los materiales necesarios en el negocio y poder realizar con confianza sus ventas diarias.

Ella quiere fortalecer el negocio por eso espera que después de esta inversión logre este objetivo y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sofia is 55 years old. She lives with her mother and her children no longer live with her. She makes and sells pupusas (Salvadoran delicacy) every day from two in the afternoon until 8:30 at night. This business has been running for over 15 years which gives the advantage of having well-established customers.

She is requesting a loan to invest in ingredients for her pupuseria (place where pupusas are made/sold) : corn, spices, oil, sodas and juice. This purchase will help increase the stock of ingredients needed for her business and give her confidence when effecting her daily sales.

She wants to strengthen her business, and so she hopes that with this investment she will achieve that goal and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Buy corn, spices, oil, sodas and juice.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 36-year-old man from the Western part of Kenya. He is married to Scholastica with whom he has two children.

Peter operates a barber shop and he has been doing this kind of business for the last year. 

He is taking his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase two more shaving machines. He will use his anticipated profits to plow back into his barber business. He seems qualified for continuous loaning, even in the future.

He desires to open more barber shops within his town.

loans.use: to purchase two more shaving machines

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma Elizabeth de treinta y seis años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una tienda donde vende toda clase de artículos, es muy conocida en la zona, debido a eso ha amentado la demanda en su negocio la gente la prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de excelente calidad y a precios realmente cómodos; Norma es una mujer llena de metas por cumplir y una de ellas es ver crecer su negocio, para lograrlo su más grande secreto es el amor en su trabajo, está muy decidida a llegar al éxito, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, fruta, verdura, producto instantáneo, golosinas, aceites, huevos etc. Norma Elizabeth tiene fe que así podrá darle a su familia seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Norma Elizabeth is 38 years old and lives with her life companion and their children. She has a store where she sells all types of products. Norma is well-known in the area, which means that demand has increased for her business because people always prefer the excellent quality of products and affordable prices that she offers. She is a woman who has many goals to accomplish, one of them being to grow her business. In order to achieve this, she relies on her greatest secret which is to love her work.

Norma is very determined to be successful, so she has requested a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy basic grains, fruit, vegetables, instant products, candy, oil, eggs, and other items. She has faith that her family will have financial security and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, fruit, vegetables, instant products, candy, oil, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Adeeb

texts.en:
Adeeb is a 26-year-old man living in Taiz, Yemen. He completed secondary school but was not able to proceed further with his studies due to the difficult living conditions he faced.
Adeeb's business is a grocery store, which he started three years ago by working with others. He worked hard to raise money to establish the business as it was to be the starting point of his young life. Adeeb was able to gain many customers and he is now inspired to expand his capital and income by purchasing all the grocery items needed by members of his neighborhood. To do this, Adeeb has taken a youth loan of 100,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB for purchasing all the required grocery items. 
In the future, Adeeb hopes to expand his business by opening another store to sell gas cylinders.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods for his business.

loans.name: Daler

texts.en: Daler is capable boy. He is a single. He is a student. He wants to become financial expert in a future. He is studying at the University he is the first year student. His family lives in salary. His parent couldn’t pay his University tuition. He decided to get a loan and to pay the University tuition. He is studying very well he participate in a lot of circles and he is a bright boy. He wants to pay for the University tuition.  He needs money. He is asking for a loan of 3780 with this aim. He awaits you mercy and help with your help he can continue his studying.

loans.use: He wants to pay for the University tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Re stock the business

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Ms. Nieves has worked for 10 years running a hotel. She is an enterprising woman and very hardworking. She is married and has one daughter, and started this business to be able to provide the necessities for her family. There were some financial problems with her business some time ago, but with the support of her family and friends she was able to overcome them. Now she wants her hotel, located in downtown Monclova, Coahuila (her home town), to grow and be a successful business.

At present, Nieves needs a loan of just $475.00, which she will use to remodel her hotel, in order to keep it the way her customers like it and to offer better service. She knows that she can repay the loan within the term of 4 to 8 months, because she is confident that with these modifications her hotel will produce better profits. You can be a part of this growth, don't doubt it. Please decicde to support Nieves and her family. They thank you sincerely.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun is a widow with 3 daughters. Her husband passed away during the Khmer Rouge regime from 1975 to 1979. Her daughters are all married but two of them are living in different houses. Currently, in her family, one of her daughters and sons-in-law and 3 grandchildren are living under her guardianship.

She started producing Khmer fresh noodle fiber in 1980. Today, her daughter and son-in-law are assisting her to do this business. She is selling her Khmer fresh noodle fiber from one village to another. In addition, the family also has a plot of land, in which they are planting corn, other food crops, and vegetables.

Her family has borrowed loans from MAXIMA twoce. The current loan amount is $500. She will use this loan to purchase rice, firewood, and diesel for continuing and expanding her noodle fiber production, and will spend some amount for planting corn. Her family does not have any problem with the repayment.

loans.use: Purchasing rice, firewood, diesel and planting corn.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: "I'm requesting a loan of $400 to invest in soft drinks and my yam business," says Mrs. Rachael E. who lives in Oguosa, Benin City. She is married with 3 children. Racheal is 48 years old and has 10 years' experience in her micro-business.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Mr. Zakir is a low income vulnerable person. He is 50 and married with 3 children. He lives in Saatli town, which is in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan, in the Caucasus region.

Zakir owns and operates a small food market in the local bazaar of Saatli town. He has had his shop for 15 years. The business is stable because Zakir has collected loyal customers. However, he needs to invest in the shop to diversify the assortment, increase the turnover and therefore the income. This will help to provide all the necessities for his life and for his children. Most commercial banks demand collateral to give Zakir credit, but he has nothing to mortgage. Therefore, he applied to Normicro's Saatli branch, which disburses credit free of collateral, for a $500 loan. This loan will help him to buy and sell a larger amount of goods, and to develop his business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 62 years old and lives in the district of Mache, Province of Otuzco in the region of La Libertad. She has seven children but all are grown and no longer depend on her. Rosa has only a first-graD. education. Prior to receiving her first loan she dedicated herself to her home and to helping her husband in the fields.

Upon discovering through the authorities that the organization Manuela Ramos was giving loans to women in the area, Rosa got together with other neighborhood women to form the Communal Bank “Women of Work.” With her first loan of S/.300.00 (approximately $100) she purchased cuajada (a type of fresh, dry curd cheese) and sold it in the city of Trujillo, thus beginning her business. Later with her other credit she bought animals such as pigs, sheep and cows in order to fatten them and sell them in the market of Julcán. Currently Rosa continues with various activities: She has a small store in Mache in which she sells bread, crackers, soft-drinks, candles, etc. In addition, she continues sending fresh cheese to Trujillo every Saturday, so that her daughter can distribute it. Some of this fresh cheese Rosa makes herself with the milk that her livestock produce, and she also buys and sells cattle, sheep, and pigs.

With the recent credit from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (approximately $333) which will be repaid in 4 installments, Rosa will buy 2 calves in order to fatten them and then sell them. Rosa dreams of stocking her store and above all of having various clients so that she can work without leaving home and not have to walk out to the fields or to Julcán to care for and sell livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa tiene 62 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Mache Provincia D. Otuzco del Departamento D. La Libertad; tiene siete hijos pero todos mayores D. edad que ya no dependen D. ella. La señora Rosa estudió solo hasta primer grado D. primaria. Antes D. recibir su primer crédito solo se dedicaba a su casa y a ayudar a su esposo en la chacra.

Al enterarse por las autoridades D. que Manuela Ramos estaba dando prestamos a mujeres D. la zona se junta con otras vecinas y forma el Banco Comunal “Mujeres D. trabajo”. Con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 (aproximadamente $100) compró cuajada (quesillo) y llevó a vender en la ciudad D. Trujillo iniciando así su negocio; posteriormente con sus otros créditos compró animales como cerdos, ovejas y vacas para engordarlas y venderlas vivas en el mercado D. Julcán. Actualmente la señora Rosa desarrolla varias actividades: Tiene una pequeña tienda en Mache en la que venD. pan, galletas, gaseosas, velas, etc., además sigue enviando a Trujillo, todos los sábados, cuajada para que su hija las distribuya, parte D. esta cuajada la elabora con la leche que produce su ganado y además compra y venD. ganado vacuno, ovino y porcino.

Con el reciente crédito recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.1,000 (aproximadamente $333) que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 2 terneras para engordarlas y luego venderlas. La señora Rosa sueña con surtir su tienda y sobre todo con tener varios clientes para que así trabaje sin salir D. casa y deje D. caminar con el ganado hasta la chacra o hasta Julcán donD. lo venD..

loans.use: The purchase of animals (livestock)

loans.name: Rukkiah

texts.en: My name is Rukkiah B.. I was married 12 years ago and I am a mother of four: three sons and one daughter. Currently, three of my children attend school and the youngest is too small to attend school. My husband runs a salon and he is in this business for past seven years. He possesses a strong client base and wants to expand his business further for which he requires a loan of $300. With the previous loans our income increased substantially and we bought a fridge for our house. With this loan, he wants to buy  facial equipment and towels for his business.

loans.use: Buy facial equipment and towels for the salon

loans.name: Verónica Isabel

texts.es:
Verónica Isabel is a lady who, for the past 10 years, has bought and sold articles of clothing such as necklaces, bracelets, rings, earrings, etc.

For the past 10 years she has run this business from her home in the department of León. Before this, she studied secondary school, but because of the difficult economic situation, she began to look for a way to survive and she did that by selling these products. She buys the merchandise from her mother, who lives outside the country, to whom she sends money and once she receives the money, her mother makes the purchases and sends them to her beloved daughter.

To be able to acquire the products, Verónica receives loans from Ceprodel, and she notes that this has been very beneficial to her in the sense that she has acquired more goods to sell. She needs some new loans because when the merchandise is sent to Nicaragua, she has to pay for the transportation costs, which are increasing all the time.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica Isabel es una dama que desde hace 10 años se dedica a la compra y venta de prendas de vestir tales como cadenas, pulseras, anillos, aretes, etc.

Desde hace 10 años se dedica a este negocio en su casa de habitación en el departamento de León. Antes de iniciar con esta actividad se dedicaba a sus estudios de secundaria pero por su difícil situación económica, busca la manera de sobrevivir y lo hace vendiendo estos productos. La compra de estos materiales los realiza por medio de su mamá que esta fuera del país, el cual le envía el dinero y al recibirlo su mamá, hace las compras y luego las envía a su amada hija.

Para lograr adquirir los productos la señora Verónica realiza prestamos en Ceprodel y según comenta le han sido muy beneficiosos en el sentido de que ha adquirido mayores artículos para la venta. Su necesidad es adquirir nuevos prestamos ya que al ser enviada su mercadería a Nicaragua, tiene que pagar un costo de transportación que cada vez va aumentando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Abasolo 1 Group

texts.es:
