Rufina is a 52-year-old mother of 5 children who has been running a general store for 10 years. This business is Rufina’s means of supporting her family. She buys her products in the city of Comitan and in Villa las Rosas, which means that her profits are low due to the transportation costs involved. The other members of the group, Maria J. and Asuncion M., sell chicken cut into pieces, while Teresa sells clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

RUFINA TIENE 52 AÑOS, TIENE 5 HIJOS, DESDE HACE 10 AÑOS CUENTA CON UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES .SU NEGOCIO ES LA MANERA DE SOSTENER A SU FAMILIA, SU MERCANCIA ES COMPRADA EN LA CIUDAD DE COMITAN Y VILLA LAS ROSAS, LA GANANCIA ES POCA DEBIDO A LOS GASTOS QUE GENERA EL TRANSPORTE DE LAS MERCANCIAS, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO MARIA J. Y ASUNCION M. SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE POLLO TROZADO, TERESA G. VENDE ROPA.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Assiki

texts.en:
Mrs. A. is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 7 children. From the revenue of her business, she is in charge of incurring all expenses for her children. She is a seller of smoked fish in the market of Avetonou, a small village situated about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Assiki A. has been in this business sector for 6 years. She wishes to use this loan to buy 10 cartons of fish and to bring her youngest daughter on board in the family business. With the help of her daughter, she will be better able to respond to the needs of her clientele, which never ceases to increase due to the fact that fish are consumed by all of the local population. She will use her profits to better the conditions of her large family. Mrs. A. has already benefited from 1 loan, which she paid back promptly and regularly.

Madame A. est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Par les revenus de son activité elle participe aux charges du foyer. Elle est revendeuse de poissons fumés dans le marché d'Avetonou, un village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Assiki A. tient ce secteur d’activité depuis 6 ans. Elle désire par ce crédit acheter 10 cartons de poissons et engager une petite fille pour l’aider dans ses tâches. Ce qui lui permettra de répondre plus aux besoins de la clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter puisque les poissons sont consommés par toute la population locale et aussi améliorer les conditions de sa famille pour les profits issus de ses ventes. A. avait bénéficié d’un crédit et les remboursements ont été promptement faits.

loans.use: To buy 10 cartons of fish and to bring her youngest daughter on board in the family business

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 56 years old woman. She is the mother of three children. She works and lives with her family in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Fatima owns a mini market. This is the second time she applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. She wants to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her mini market.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet I. is58 years, and married with eight children. She hails from Oka in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in the business of selling wood for the past four years. The wood business is profitable to her; she learned the business for six months before starting her own business. She needs a loan of $700 to buy more wood for sales.

loans.use: To buy more wood for sale

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi A. is 39 years old, married and the father of 4 children who are all in school. He is a merchant who sells cigarettes in Kpalime, a town located around 120 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. He sells his merchandise in bulk to other smaller merchants. With this loan, his second with FECECAV, Komi would like to expand his business by purchasing more cartons of cigarettes to resell to his customers. With his sales, Komi would like to support his family.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Komi A. est âgé de 39 ans, marié e père de 4 enfants tous à l’école. Il est vendeur de cigarettes à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il livre ses marchandises en gros aux détaillants. Avec ce crédit, le deuxième de FECECAV, Komi désire élargir la capacité de son commerce en achetant plus des cartons de cigarettes pour la redistribution à ses clients. Avec les produits de ses ventes, Komi subviendra mieux aux besoins de sa famille

loans.use: To purchase more cartons of cigarettes

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem N., 29, raises pigs and makes traditional Cambodian rice wine. She earns around $5 per day from these activities. Her husband, Heng Hak, is a motorcycle taxi driver and also earns about $5 per day. They have one child and live in Sophy Village, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

Mrs. N. is requesting a loan of $1,200 US to purchase more pigs to raise and to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband’s taxi service. A newer motorcycle will be more efficient and allow him to attract more customers.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to raise

loans.name: Tumaini's Bidii Group

texts.en:
Tumaini is 30 years old. She is married with a five-year-old child. She has been a shoe seller since 2006, and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Tumaini now hopes for a loan to buy more shoes for her business. She will share this loan with her group members, who have businesses dealing with food sales, shoe and clothing sales, and bites sales.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for her business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
El señor Martin T. S., cuenta actualmente con 53 años de edad, nació en 				
la Aldea Xojola, Nahuala, Sololá  y reside actualmente en la misma aldea, su actividad 				
diaria es en el cultivo siembra y cosechas de maxan, banano y café, gracias a esta				
actividad y con los esfuerzos día a día logro sacar a sus hijos adelante, que a				
ahora ya se graduaron y tienen sus trabajos, don Martin T. S. es un ejemplo 				
su comunidad porque anteriormente se dedica a limpia de terreno con otras personas				
y ahora ya cuenta con sus terrenos que con el paso del tiempo ha logrado que 				
su familia tenga una mejor condición de vida, y con el objetivo de incrementarlo 				
mas y poder  seguir con mejores condiciones, tuvo la necesidad  de acudir 				
en las oficinas de la Asociación ASDIR, para solicitar un crédito el cual lo 				
utilizara en la mejora de sus cosechas.				
Don Martin siempre ha sido una persona apreciable en su comunidad porque				
ha generado fuentes de empleo y con su actitud y amabilidad y colaboración 				
en la comunidad ha logrado un gran aprecio de las personas.
texts.en:
Mr Martin T. S. is 53 years old, he was born in the town of Xojola, Nahuala, Sololá and still lives there. Mr T. grows maxan, banana and coffee. Thanks to this activity, he successfully raised his children; they all went to school, graduated and have jobs. Mr T. is seen as a role model in his community. Before he would clean the land for other people, now he has his own land and over time he has succeeded in raising the standard of living of his family. Moreover, his work has created employment in the area and as he is a very kind and collaborative person, he is highly regarded by the community. Mr T. requested a loan from Associación ASDIR, he will use it to improve the quality of his harvests.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting and Harvesting Maxan, Coffee and Bananas

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is a wife of M. and lives in a small town named Bund Road in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 35 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Razia baji's husband is a mason by profession. He has been a mason for 2 years. Razaia baji herself has a garments business. She has been involved in this business for the last 15 years. She is applying for a loan to buy more garments to expand her business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Azra baji wants a loan to buy material such as lentils, cooking oil and spices for her food business. Saima baji wants a loan to buy fresh flowers to make flower bouquets to resell. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy more shoes for her shoe selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more garments to resell

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Itohan O. is 34 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks, and she also has a salon. She makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Djèkafo Group

texts.fr:
Vivant dans la localité de Sanankoroba (situé à  25  kilomètres de Bamako la capital du Mali), les membres du groupe djèkafo sont des femmes mariéesavec en moyenne cinq (5) enfants. Elles se sont connues par des liens d’amitié et de mariage. 
Pour la survie de leur pétit commerce, elles ont intégré le programme de prêt solidaire de Soro Yiriwaso à travers l’association siguidja du village et elles sont à leur sixième prêt tous les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
Elles s’approvisionnent toutes en diverses denrées alimentaires  à Bamako une fois par mois. En plus de la vente des denrées alimentaires certains membres font de la restauration. Avec ce prêt elles comptent acquérir 90  kilogrammes de fruits et légumes et  105   kilogrammes  de divers denrées alimentaires. Le bénéfice previsionnel mensuel est estimé à 25.000 FCFA.
texts.en:
The members of the group Djèkafo are married women who have five children on average. They live in the Sanankoroba area (located 25 km from Bamako, the capital of Mali) and know one another by ties of friendship and marriage.

For their small business to survive, they joined the solidarity loan program Soro Yiriwaso through the village association Siguidja. They are on their sixth loan. All of their previous loans have been repaid.

They all get their supplies of diverse foodstuffs in Bamako once a month. In addition to selling these goods, some members do catering. With this loan, they intend to acquire 90 kg of fruit and vegetables and 105 kg of various food items. The projected monthly profit is estimated at 25,000 francs CFA.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stock of fruit and vegetables for some and to buy groceries for catering for others

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 40 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. He has owned a grocery store for eleven years. He is very active. He also sells vegetables in a small truck and drives around the neighborhood around his area. Hassan requests a loan of 800 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase canned food and candies for his shop. This is his second loan and he paid the previous loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase canned food and candies for his shop.

loans.name: Los Quirquinchos Group

texts.es: El grupo "Quirquinchos" esta representado por la señora Maribel y conformado por 16 miembros, ellos van cursando su segundo ciclo en la cual demostraron responsabilidad y capacidad para administrar los fondos otorgados por la fundación Agrocapital demostrando entusiasmo y ganas de seguir trabajando para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. La mayoría de los socios (as ) se dedica a la prestación de servicio pero también al comercio de productos como cristales, ropa, cosméticos por catálogos, joyas, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio  otros de acuerdo a la temporada. Dentro del rubro en la que ellos se trabajan existe mucha competencia es por eso que trabajan con prestamos para mejorar la calidad de sus productos y a la reparación de sus herramientas de trabajo para la prestación de un servicio más eficiente.
texts.en:
The "Quirquinchos" group is represented by Marbiel and consists of 16 members. They are in their second loan cycle in which they have demonstrated responsibility and shown their capacity to administrate the authorised funds from the AgroCapital foundation, demonstrating enthusiasm and wanting to continue working to improve their families' quality of life. The majority of the members work offering services but also in selling products such as glasses, clothes, catalogue cosmetics, jewellery and groceries in neighbourhood shops and sometimes according to the season. In the areas where they work there is a lot of competition and it for this reason that they work with loans to improve the quality of the products and to repair their work tools in order to offer a more efficient service.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Mwanaid

texts.en:
Mwanaid has been a clothing seller in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha for 1 year. She belongs to the Upendo loan group (Group code 2001). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $25. Every day she works at her business from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Mwanaid is single.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nelly,

texts.es:
D. D. P.

Nelly ha cumplido quince años trabajando en su negocio D. venta D. pollo broster y salchipapas (frituras) en un puesto ambulante afuera D. su casa. Este negocio lo emprendió una vez que decidió tener un recurso propio D. dinero para poder ayudar con los gastos D. la casa. Es así que se decidió a dar lo mejor D. si, la comida.

Hoy en día, a sus sesenta y dos años, Nelly solo trabaja por las tardes. Con sus ganancias ha podido ayudar en los estudios D. sus seis hijos, actualmente todos mayores e independientes. Ella vive con dos D. sus hijas y con su esposo, jubilado D. una asociación minera. 

Mientras su buena salud se lo permita ella dice que continuará con su negocio y analizando la posibilidad D. abrir un restaurante en su propia casa.
texts.en:
D. D. P. For fifteen years, Nelly has been running her own roast chicken and fried salchipapa business outsiD. her house. She decided to start her business because she wanted her own income, to help with home expenses. She wanted her business to be the best she could make it, so she decided it would be a food business. These days, at sixty-two years old, Nelly works only in the afternoon. With profits from her business, she has been able to help her six children through school. Now, they are grown and independent. Nelly lives with two of her daughters, and her husband, who is a retired miner. Because of her good health, Nelly can say that she will continue to run her business, and is considering the possibility of opening a restaurant in her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for preparing the foods

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
Nodira is 44 years old. She and her husband raised four children. For more than five years Nodira has run her own business.

She has a small saloon where she sells and rents traditional wedding dresses and the national wedding dress. Traditionally, families in Tajikistan are large, consequently there are lots of marriages and Nodira has a lot of clients. The stability of her business allows her to make a considerable contribution to the family’s income.

Today Nodira requests $ 800 to purchase more new wedding dresses. Nodira would like to assure all lenders that she will repay the loan.

------------------------------------------------------------------

More about Tajikistan and IMON International. Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new wedding dresses.

loans.name: Jazmina

texts.es: Jazmina tiene 21 años, vive en una casa arrendada con su esposo y su hija de un año. Se dedica a la venta de ganado porcino, para ello tiene una pequeño establo de cerdos donde los cría y cuando están gordos los vende en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Jazmina se levanta cada mañana, muy temprano, para dar de comer a sus animales, cada día los alimenta 3 veces, a fin de obtener buenas ganancias, ya que al alimentar bien a sus cerdos puede cotizarlos a un mayor precio. Para más adelante, Jazmina está pensando en vender mayor cantidad de cerdos y para ello ampliará el espacio donde los cría. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de seguir adelante y de ser considerada para integrar este equipo de trabajo que es su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora viene solicitando es para la compra de calaminas, bolsas de cemento, ladrillos y palos para mejorar la infraestructura de su establo de cerdos.
texts.en:
Jazmina, 21, lives in a rented house with her husband and one-year old daughter. She earns a living selling pigs. She has a small stable where she raises them and when they've been fattened, she sells them at a local livestock market. Jazmina gets up every morning, very early, to feed her animals. She feeds them 3 times a day in order to get the best price for them because well-fed pigs fetch more money. For the future, Jazmina is thinking of selling more pigs, a plan that will require her to expand the stable where she raises them. This is her first MFP loan and she's very glad to be able to help herself and to be considered for membership in her community bank. The money that she's applying for will be used to buy siding, bags of cement, bricks and framing to improve her stable.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve pig pen for livestock business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.
Juana es casada, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Juana junto a su esposo fabrican ladrillos de manera artesanal, para lo cual cuentan con un horno a leña, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra.
Los sueños de Juana son mejorar su negocio y construir el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Desarrollo ("Development") Community Bank. She is a 29-year-old married mother of three. Along with her husband she makes artisan-style bricks in a firewood oven. She sells her product in the same place. Juana needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she plans to invest in the purchase of land. Juana's dreams are to improve her business and build a second floor on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land

loans.name: Ailyn Mae

texts.en:
Ailyn Mae D. married at the early age of 18. Her husband is Khem G. D., 23 years of age. Though they don't have children, they consider it a blessing because they are given the time to plan and prepare the beautiful future of their children.

Ailyn runs a fruit-vending business in the market. She has the strong desire to improve this business to bring in more income for the family. She is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000, her first loan from HSPFI. If granted, Ailyn considers this opportunity as a perfect time to work hard and enhance the business she has.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for her business

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique is the proud owner of a shoe repair business in Manhattan. Shoes are his passion. His business, with shoes displayed in the front and a small workshop in the back, supports his family, which consists of his wife Maria and their grown daughter.

Enrique apprenticed as a shoe repairman for many years.  Two years ago, he proudly took ownership of his own store. Despite working six days a week, his energy remains high. He has been approved for a loan of $5,000 from ACCION USA to provide him with working capital that will help him to continue his repair work. 
                            
He admits that times are sometimes tough, but his clients remain loyal because they know that his work is of the highest quality. New clients get a sense of his work with flyers and samples of work in his store.

loans.use: Leather, rubber soles and general working capital.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 24 años, vive con su pareja y padre de su bebé de pocos meses de nacido, en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace más de un año para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar, su pareja estudia y trabaja a la vez y ella quiere aportar también con los gastos de su hogar para brindarle a su bebé lo mejor. Lo bueno de su trabajo es que puede realizarlo en su casa sin tener que salir y descuidar a su hijo, el cual requiere de muchos cuidados ya que aún es muy pequeño. Las ventas son buenas, pues con su gran carisma logra vender entre sus vecinas muchos productos, resultándole muy rentable su negocio, el cual va creciendo poco a poco. Maritza espera tener una gran tienda donde pueda ofrecer con mayor comodidad su mercadería, sabe que si le pone más dedicación y esfuerzo logrará cumplir todas sus metas para sacar adelante a su familia. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, espera que le vaya muy bien como en sus anteriores préstamos, en los cuales ella y sus compañeras fueron muy puntuales. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos para aumentar su stock y así lograr mejores ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Maritza is 24 years old and she lives with her partner, the father of her baby who is a few months old, in their own home. She has sold cosmetics for a living for more than a year in order to meet the household costs. She partner studies and works as well and she also wanted to support him with their outgoings to give their baby the best. The good thing about her work is that she can do it from home without having to go out with her son, who requires a lot of care as he is still very young. Her slaes are good as she is very charismatic when it comes to sales, which means that her business is very profitable and is growing bit by bit. Maritza hopes to have a big store where she can offer her produce more comfortably, and she knows that with some more dedication and effort she will accomplish all his goals and her family will move forward. This is her third credit with MFP and she hopes it goes well as her previous loans with which she and her colleagues were very punctual. With this loan she will buy larger quantities of cosmetics to increase her stock and thereby increaseher earnings for her home.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise/Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is a 32-year-old trader. She is married with eight children and three are currently schooling. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote for minimizing poverty and, for that matter, she is very serious with her business.

Akosua trades in foodstuff like plantain. She buys them in bulk from the surrounding villages and treks them to the city centers to bargain for a high price. She started this business seven years ago and through this she has been very resourceful to her family.

Akosua wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of plantains to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes that with the loan, she can buy bunches of plantain from the farmers, circumventing middlemen who retail to her at high prices.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of plantains

loans.name: Seemen Group

texts.en:
Seemen is the group leader of the Seemen Group. Each of the four members of this group wants a loan to expand their business. They are requesting a group loan of 56000 Afghani. 

Seemen wants a loan for his tailoring business. Nasren wants to take a loan for her husband who is a painter. Fazala wants a loan for her husband who has a metal-working shop. G. M. wants a loan for his painting business. They are very happy that AFS and Kiva lenders that can support entrepreneurs from all over the world.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma M. is a 63-year-old business woman. She joined Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) in 2005 wanting to start up her own business since her husband's livelihood was then unstable. Using her first loan from ASHI, she put up a small variety store that she has been able to sustain until now.

Three years ago, she used her loan for starting up a hog-fattening business (hog-raising business). Hog fattening is raising piglets for three to four months. After those months, the pigs have grown and they will be sold. Profit from this kind of business is double the amount of its capital. Piglets bought for Php 1,500 to Php 2,000 can be sold to Php 4,000 to Php 6,000 after four months. Norma started by raising two piglets. After that, the loans she accessed from ASHI were used for growing her later business. Profits she made from the hog fattening were re-invested in her variety store business.

Someday, Norma hopes to have bigger pig pen to raise many pigs for a bigger profit. Her ambition of growing her business and having more profits is because of her desire to have savings for her unemployed husband and herself in case of emergency, for she doesn't like her children to be financially bothered about them. She and her husband have been living alone together for many years since their children have had their own families.

loans.use: Financing her hog fattening (pig raising) and variety store businesses

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 31 years of age. She is married to Warlito, a company driver. They have raised three children: Leo Jazel, age 9, who is in grade 3; Warlito, Jr., age 7, who is in grade 2; and Prince Noah, who is 1 year old. Their family lives harmoniously in Barangay Nungnungan in Cauayan City, a rural plain area that is three kilometers from the city.
	
Bella raises goats. Sometimes, she also cooks food snacks to sell in their village. Her weekly net income from sales is only around PHP 500, but she also generates an income of PHP 3,500 every 2-3 months from livestock disposal. To maintain her business, Bella wants to borrow PHP 12,000 from Kiva. She wants to be a big help to her husband in providing for their family's needs.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie V. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Analie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Analie owns & operates a specialized "sari-sari" variety store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Analie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Analie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analie is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Analie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luis Guillermo

texts.es: Don Luís S. de 47 años de edad,  reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, el trabaja en la compañía coca cola en el área de rotación con 19 años de experiencia, por ingresos económicos no logro seguir estudiando es por eso que no logro a optar a otra área ejecutiva dentro de la empresa donde se gana un mejor salario. Vive junto con su hermana ya que hace años se separo de su familia, pues le apoyan para seguir adelante. Es por eso que con este financiamiento comprara materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto y poder estar con privacidad y comodidad. Este es su séptimo ciclo en Afodenic y agradece por el financiamiento que ha dado en todos este tiempo el cual ha logrado sus objetivos.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construcciony hacer un cuarto para tener privacidad

loans.name: Manuel Albert

texts.en:
Our client is Manuel Albert.  He is part of a communal bank consisting of 16 neighbors who live in Cusco.  The group is called Santa Rosita de Lima, named after a religious icon, a virgin, in Peru.  He is a native of Cusco. He is 44 years old and is single.

Manual has a steady job working at a grocery store.  He will use this loan to fix up his home.  This is his first loan from Asociación Arariwa. Manual Albert appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To repair his home

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 36 years old and married with four children. All her children are in school and she hopes to give them a quality education. She is determined to excel in her business and her family life.

She sells medicines at retail prices to her customers in Benin City, Edo state. She has been in this business for two years. She hopes to be a major medicine distributor in Benin City. She is hoping for a loan of 80,000 NGN (Nigerian Naira) to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Mame Fatim

texts.fr: Mame Fatim KÂ est une femme de 26 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PLATEAU2 depuis deux ans et demi et y a reçu 5 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien remboursé. Elle fait du commerce d'arachide et ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à l'entretien de la famille.
texts.en:
Mame Fatim KÂ, aged 26, is married with three children. She has been a member of Village Bank of PLATEAU2 for two and a half years, and has received and repaid 5 previous loans. She sells peanut oil. The income allows her to help support her family.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Augment her business

loans.name: Walter

texts.en: Walter is a businessman and resident of Wabigalo Parish, Makindye Division. He is 49 years old and has cinema hall where he shows movies. He wants to use the loan to increase his working capital by purchasing new and interesting movies, renovating the hall to look beautiful, and so forth. He has been in his business for over two years and his hope for the future is to get a very big music studio and movie theater and even do some hiring.

loans.use: To purchase new and interesting movies and renovate the movie theater

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger C. C. tiene 42 años, vive en union libre, y  tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 9 y 13 años respectivamente. El vive en Pueblo Nuevo con su familia de 4 miembros. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de cerdos para engorde y venderlos en comercios cercanos. El tiene mucho experiencia con cerdos. Es la primera vez don Roger se financia con FUDECOSUR. El no ha tenido otros creditos con Bancos formales. El espera que tenga una vida mejor para el futuro, ya que pueden tener ingresos economicos. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Roger C. C. is 42 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and has 2 children that are his main priority. They are 9 and, 13 respectively. He lives in Pueblo Nuevo with his 4 member family. The loan he wants is for buying pigs to fatten and sell to nearby businesses. He has a lot of experience with pigs. This is Roger’s first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans with formal banks. He hopes he will have a better life in the future, now that he can earn an income.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten

loans.name: Marie Thérèse

texts.fr: Marie Thérèse C. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Sainte Thérèse depuis 02 ans et a eu 04 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de la teinture de tissus, couture et tissage de pagnes. Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Thérèse C. is a 52 year-old married mother of two. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de Sainte Thérèse for two years, and has received four loans. She dyes fabric, clothing and 'pagnes' (brightly coloured wax cloth) for a living; her aim is to increase her savings and look after her family.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment funds

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester C. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Iligan City. She is 59 years old. Ester is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Ester sells dried seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community.  In 2010, Ester joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ester from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to sell

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Jorgelino

texts.es:
El Señor Jorge Lino A. es de la ciudad de Quiindy (districto de Carapegua), el mismo es propietario de un comercio dedicado a la reparación de heladeras, congeladores, instalaciones de acondicionadores de aire, brindando su servicio en dicha ciudad hace varios años con clientela formada. 

Accedió a un crédito con nuestra entidad que lo empleo para compra de herramientas  más sofisticadas con el fin de mejorar la calidad de su servicio.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge Lino A. is from the city of Quiindy (Carapegua District), and has his own business repairing refrigerators and freezers, and installing air conditioning units. He has been providing service to the city for many years, and has a well developed clientele. He requested a loan from Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya to buy better tools and provide better quality of service.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tools

loans.name: Fatimas De La Concepcion

texts.es: Fátima tiene 49 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general y una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que desde que inicio ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y ha luchado fuertemente para obtener estos ingresos. Los propósitos de ella para su negocio son de aplicar nuevas técnicas de pago para sus clientes ya si pueda obtener su dinero en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo en la compra de mercadería en general como ropa, cosméticos y otros productos variados. Los deseos de ella son de mejorar su condición económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Fátima is 49 years old and sells general merchandise and runs a snack stand. She has had this business for more than six years. In the beginning she worked as a street vendor, and she has fought hard to earn a living. With her business, she strives to offer her clients new payment options so that she can receive her income in a timely manner. She is requesting this loan to use as working capital in order to buy general merchandise like clothing, cosmetics and a variety of other products. Her dream is to improve her family's economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing, cosmetics and a variety of other products

loans.name: Kosar Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Kosar Parveen is from the city named Pakpattan, in Pakistan a city famous for its shrines. She is 36-year old woman, married and has three children. To make a living her husband operates a shoe selling business. He has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Pak Rupees in a month.

Kosar started a bed sheets making business with the intention of sharing financial burden of her husband. Her husband appreciates her for her kind thoughts. Her income fruitfully improved the living of her family. 

She is requesting for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 10,000 which will be used to enhance her husband’s shoe selling business by buying the shoes in bulk. They have a plan to use the additional revenue generated from the business to brighten up their kids’ future by enrolling them into good school. 

She has four other ladies in her loan group. Kaniz baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Rubia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Rani baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies.

loans.use: To buy shoes for selling

loans.name: David Ng'a'nga

texts.en:
David N. is a man of forty-eight years who is married and the father to eight lovely children. He lives in Soy in Eldoret, where he grows maize. David has been farming for twenty-four years now and he also does dairy farming where he sells milk mostly to his neighbors and other dairy industries along Likuyani in Eldoret.

David was introduced to KADET by KADET clients. He has applied for a loan which he plans to use to buy farm inputs like fertilizer, top-dressing to help the maize grow faster, herbicides, and also to pay his employees.

David’s goal is to become a better farmer, to teach others good farming, and also to provide the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy farm imputs like fertilizer, top dressing and herbicides and to pay his employees

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy O. is from the village of Dampalan Lopez Jaena. She is 30 years old. Mercy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy owns & operates a business venture providing transportation services to the local community. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Mercy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 9,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Mercy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Cooperativa Group

texts.es:
Manuela Q. es integrante de la Asociación Comunal Cooperativa que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Panamericana, es vecina de la ciudad de El Alto, indica que ingresó a Pro Mujer a invitación de una vecina.
 
Ella atiende una tienda de barrio, donde tiene productos como pan, leche, azúcar, dulces, galletas, conservas, arroz, fideo y otros. Florentina necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y tener una tienda surtida. 
Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen actividades económicas como: tejido de mantas,  venta de fruta, artesanía, venta de pilas, papa y fruta.
 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
Manuela Q. is a member of both the Asociacion Comunal Cooperative and the Centro Focal Panamericana. She is a resident of the city of El Alto. She says that she joined Pro Mujer after being invited by a neighbor. She operates a neighborhood store where she sells products such as bread, milk, sugar, candy, cookies, jams, rice, pasta and so on. She needs the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store. Other members of this association operate a range of businesses: weaving blankets, selling fruit, making and selling traditional craft products, etc. All of the members need funds to buy merchandise, supplies and basic materials, each according to the kind of business they own.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Né le 24 Mai 1982 à Sikasso, Monsieur Bakary Koné est marié, père d’une petite fille et vit dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie au quartier Mamassoni de la ville de  Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, il s’est vite initié à cette activité génératrice de revenu, en optant pour la  coiffure des hommes et l’achat vente de matériels de coiffure depuis l’année 2000. Il jouit d’une forte sollicitation, réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes matériels de salon.
Afin de satisfaire cette clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses, il décida alors d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Bakary est à son premier prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter, 2 nouvelles tondeuses, 4 paires de peigne et brosses, 2 bidons d’eau de Javel, 3 bouteilles d’alcool de 90°, 5 bouteilles de pommade de cheveux, etc. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre  ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on May 24, 1982 in Sikasso, Mr. Bakary Koné is the married father of a young girl and lives in large traditional extended family in the Mamassoni district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance to progress in school, he was soon introduced to this income-generating business. In 2000, he opted to be a barber and to buy and sell hair care products. He enjoys a great demand and strong reputation, and he accommodates many orders for barber shop supplies. In order to satisfy his more and more numerous customers, Bakary decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his first loan, which will enable him to buy two new clippers, four pairs of combs and brushes, two containers of bleach, three bottles of 90% alcohol, five bottles of hair ointment, etc. With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 85,000 francs CFA. With these profits, he plans on resolving his expenses and those of his family, paying the loan interest, and investing the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies and equpment for his barber shop

loans.name: Michaela

texts.en:
Michaela P., is from the village of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Michaela is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Michaela owns and operates a buy & sell business. Michaela has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Michaela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Michaela is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Michaela from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Barak

texts.en:
Barak T.  is currently in the business of selling local brews and beer out of her home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Barak is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bar.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 31 years old and married with two children. Since 1998, she has been selling building stones, sand and ballast.

Susan joined Faulu Kenya so that she could easily access loans. So far, she has serviced one loan which she used to purchase a piece of land. She has requested a new loan of 40,000 KES to purchase more building materials such as stones, sand and ballast.

Susan hopes to complete the process of building a house on her piece of land. She describes herself as hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: To purchase more building stones, ballast and sand

loans.name: Nelibeth

texts.en:
Nelibeth S. is from the village of Basag, San Carlos, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Nelibeth is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Nelibeth owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nelibeth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nelibeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelibeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nelibeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Ms. Hilda is separated and has grown up children; she lives alone. She is dedicated to the tayloring of garments, and for more than five years she has been devoted to this área.
She began in this area with her brother who also has a sewing workshop, but with her savings, she managed to gain Independence and open her own workshop.
She needs this loan for a purchase of an industrial machine and with it she will have in stocks because she has many orders. In the future she wants to have a boutique.
texts.en:
Ms. Hilda is separated and has grown children; she lives alone. She is dedicated to the tailoring of garments, and for more than five years she has been devoted to this occupation. She started out in this occupation with her brother who also has a tailorin workshop. With her own savings, she managed to open her own shop. She needs this loan to purchase an industrial sewing machine. With it she will have many more orders. In the future she wants to open a boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Eang

texts.en: Eang S., 51, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. S. sells fruit for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a plot of farmland to increase their agricultural produce. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a plot of farmland to increase agricultural produce

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena B. sells palm kernel oil, cassava and plantain at Elmina.  Abena has received senior high education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a petty trader. She responsibly supports her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to purchase additional palm kernels to process for sale. She plans on reinvesting her profit back into her business. 

To prepare her palm kernel oil, she begins by shelling the palm nuts. The shelling used to be performed using two stones to crack each nut and separating the kernel and shell simultaneously. This manual operation is an old-fashioned method by which nuts were cracked. But thanks to machines, we now use nut-cracking machines instead.

The traditional oil extraction method is to simply heat the dried nuts to release the palm kernel oil. The released oil is occasionally skimmed from the top as the heat is applied. This process is continued until almost all the oil is skimmed out of the palm kernel.

loans.use: purchase additional palm kernels to process for sale

loans.name: Mt. Livingstone Group

texts.en:
Ally N. is in his mid-30s and is married with three children. He owns a tailoring shop, which he has been running for ten years now. His shop is open daily between 7am and 8pm, and earns Ally a good monthly profit.
This will be Ally's first motisha loan with Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a Tujijenge Tanzania product that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. With this loan, Ally aims to increase his stock of material, including cloth, thread and needles. His dream is to one day have people working for him so that he can focus on producing new designs.
Ally will share this loan with his loan group, Mt. Livingstone, which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loans. In the picture, Ally is the only man.

loans.use: To increase stock of material

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel H. C. quiere mejorar sus ingresos económicos mejorando la calidad de su ganado.
El es  de una comunidad llamada Santa fe de Alajuela, es conocida por ser una bella zona montañosa a tan solo 30 minutos de Nicaragua. El tiene toda su vida de dedicarse a la ganadería, hace 2 años compro 4 vaquitas y  en este momento el necesita un préstamo de ¢603 000 (seiscientos tres mil colones) para la compra de alambre de Grapa y semilla de pasto para dar las mejores condiciones a su terreno para cuidar a sus 12 vaquitas que ya ahora ha logrado conseguir. 
El tiene 59 años y es socio de la  Empresa de Crédito Comunal Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Y la ECC con más créditos de Kiva
texts.en: Manuel H. C. wishes to improve his source of income by improving the quality of his herd of cattle. He lives in the community named Santa Fe de Alajuela. The region is known for its beautiful mountains and it is only 30 minutes from Nicaragua. He has been a cattle farmer his entire life. Two years ago he purchases 4 calves. He requires a loan in the amount of 603 000 (six hundred and three thousand) colones to purchase barbed wire and grass seed to improve the state of his pastures. He has managed to have 12 cows in total. He is 59 years old and he is a member of the community bank Santa Fe, one of the 100 member organization of EDESA (Kiva Field Partner) in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural merchandise.

loans.name: Buyanbadrah

texts.en:
Buyanbadrah D. is 22 years old and an orphan. He lives with his brother in the Uvs province, Mongolia, in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. He has a girlfriend whose name is Saraa.

Buyanbadrah operates his own taxi service. He worked in the construction field with the help of his brother this summer, and has been able to open a savings account with 2,000,000 MNT in the XacBank. His business was successful enough to upgrade his car by purchasing a car for 3,000,000 MNT. His monthly average income is between 180,000-200,000 MNT. Buyanbadrah is a modest and handsome young man who is not afraid of hard work and hopes to get married soon. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT in order to purchase a car.

loans.use: To purchase a car.

loans.name: Patrick Kinuthia

texts.en:
Patrick has been constructing houses and buildings in Olkalou town since 2006.  He is 50 years old, married to Jane Wanjiku, and they have seven children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy four bags of cement to use in his latest project.

In future, Patrick hopes to build his own rental houses.

loans.use: To buy four  bags of cement to use for construction

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice and beans

loans.name: Mrs. Nou Samai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 16 people located in Khnar Rung village, Takeo province. The group has selected Mrs. Nou S. as village bank president. The group members will use their portions of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their family's standard of living.
Mrs. Nou S. is a mother of two children who both attend public school. She and her husband, Mr. Ra Ben, are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land to grow rice, watermelon and cucumber to sell to support their family. Nou S. also breeds chickens. Now it is time to grow crops, but her income is small as her business has recently suffered due to insufficient capital. To improve production, Mrs. Nou S. is asking for a loan to buy watermelon seed, cucumber seed and rice. With the rest of the loan she is going to buy more chicken and chicken food.

loans.use: To buy watermelon seed, cucumber seed and rice

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma R., 41, lives in Pasay City, Philippines. She is married and has one child who she has managed, with the grace of God, to provide with a good education. Now she is working hard simply to meet daily expenses by running a small variety store where she sells groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her regular customers are her neighbors and she earns about PHP 200 a day. 

She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to expand her business by buying more items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to continue operating a stable business that will allow her to continue paying for her child's education. She faithfully meets weekly with her other borrowers to talk about her work.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather regularly to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay their loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
46-year-old Bernard M. is a farmer from the town of Murang'a in central Kenya. He has been in the farming business for 10 years and employs two farmhands. His farm produces coffee and horticultural products, which he sells through a local cooperative society. Farming is his main source of income.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 53,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He hopes that his income, through the sale of milk and this loan, will help improve the livelihood of his family.  His primary challenges are lack of reliable vet doctors and artificial insemination services. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to produce over 50 liters of milk daily.

Bernard is married with three children who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cecelia's Group

texts.en:
Cecelia A. is from the village of Minante 2, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 32 years old. Cecelia is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Cecelia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. She is just starting this business.

In 2007, Cecelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.ar:
احمد في عمر 50 سنة متزوج وله 1 ولد يعمل في بيع الخضار والفاكهة له في عمله 30 سنة  يحب عمله ويسعى جاهدا لكي يتطور
ويزيد من مدخوله ومدخول عائلته يلقى الدعم الكامل من افراد عائلته حيث انهم يشجعونه على زيادة عمل جديد يتميز 
بالدقة في العمل والمثابرة على التطور يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء سيارة جديدة لكي تساعده في العمل
لنقل الخضار والفاكهة
texts.en: Ahmed is 50 years old. He is married with one child. For thirty years, Ahmed has been selling vegetables and fruit. He loves his job and seeks to increase his income and develop. Ahmed has his family’s support, and they encourage him to seek new business. He is known for his accuracy and perseverance. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, Ahmed would like to purchase a new car to help transport his vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: Purchase a car to transport vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Milka

texts.es: Milka, de 41 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Milka es una mujer muy alegre y muy preocupada por salir adelante, es por eso que decidió poner una tienda de licores, la cual le ayudaron a poner sus padres hace mucho tiempo, su negocio siempre para lleno ya que vende sus productos a precios muy cómodos. A ella le gusta su trabajo, disfruta mucho el aconsejar a sus clientes, sobre cual es el licor de mayor calidad que pueden comprar. Para ella su mayor prioridad es el tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender toda clase de licores y así incrementar sus ingresos. Lleva 12 años realizando este trabajo y lo más difícil de su negocio es conseguir los licores de calidad y diferenciarlas de las adulteradas. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y desea pagarlo a tiempo, ya que quiere acceder a otros posteriormente, en su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que siempre le da alegría al resto de sus socias. Con los mil nuevos soles que recibirá, comprará más bebidas para implementar mejor su tienda de licores.
texts.en:
41-year old Milka is a friendly, hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her three much-loved children. They are the reason she works so hard. Milka is a cheerful person but concerned about the future so she decided to open a liquor store some time ago with the help of her parents. The store is always full since she sells the products for a good price.

Milka likes her work and enjoys advising her customers about the best quality liquor to buy. Her greatest wish is to have a bigger store where she can sell all types of drinks and thus increase her income.  She’s been doing this work for twelve years. Her biggest problem is obtaining quality liquor which has not been tampered with.

This will be her fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP and she wants to make her repayments punctually and get another loan in the future. Milka is well-liked by the other members of her community bank since she always makes everyone feel happy. With the money she receives, she plans to buy more drinks and expand the stock in her liquor store.

loans.use: to buy more high-quality drinks

loans.name: Juana Delta

texts.es: Juana Delta M. R. de 52 años de edad, reside en la colonia Las Margaritas, en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su hijo quien se dedica a trabajar y a ayudarle económicamente a su madre. Juana posee una tienda de productos perecederos y así mismo un taller de corte y confección en el cual se encarga de realizar prendas de vestir para hombres, mujeres y niños. Así mismo ella elabora ropa sin pedido previo los cuales los comercializa con las personas de la zona, esto con el fin de obtener otras fuentes de ingresos. Juana solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder obtener el dinero necesario para poder comprar hilo, telas, botones y todo lo relacionado a la materia prima que ella utiliza para realizar su trabajo. Ella desea poder brindarle una mejor ayuda económica a su hijo, es por ello que trabaja tanto por obtener ganancias extras.
texts.en: 52 year old Juana lives in the Las Margaritas community in the San Salvador department. She lives there with her son who works and helps his mother financially. Juana has a perishable goods store and also a tailoring workshop where she makes clothes to order for men, women, and children. She also makes clothes that haven't been ordered and sells them to people in the area, which gives her another source of income. Juana is requesting a loan so that she will have the money she needs to buy thread, fabric, buttons, and all the raw materials that she uses in her work. She wants to be able to give more financial support to her son, and this is why she works so hard to get some extra income.

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

location.town: colonia Las Margaritas, departamento de San Salvad

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is married to a farmer and has five children, all of whom attend school. The family owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Dzame's greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past two years, Dzame has operated a business selling mangoes, coconuts and dry fish from home to local residents. The business has enabled her to educate her children and provide basic needs for the family.

Dzame is planning to use this KES 15,000 loan to purchase sacks of dry fish and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu because of the availability of various loan products.

loans.use: to purchase dry fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is a married woman with four children. She is 42 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 20 years.

Lucena sells items like notebooks, pads of paper, and canned juices to the people in her community. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more items to sell, such as canned goods and noodles.

In the future, she hopes to expand her store further.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school.
Mariam has a retail shop business. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works six days out of every week. Mariam sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. She also generates additional income through poultry farming.
The main business challenges for Mariam include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van. Mariam lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and paying utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Kashi

texts.en:
Kashi is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Kashi has operated a soap-making business for the past five years. She sells them from door to door to her neighbors and passers-by.

Her greatest challenges are the high cost of transportation and seasonality. Kashi dreams of being a wholesale soap supplier in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase soap-making chemicals, wax and potassium manganese.

loans.use: to purchase soap-making chemicals, wax, potassium manganese

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en: Rodah is 37 years old and married with six children.  She sells vegetables so as to earn a living.  Besides that, she sells fish. She has been engaged in the business for eleven years.  Being a member of a group in Faulu Kenya, she has been able to share business ideas with the group members.  This has helped her to improve her business.  She has requested 20,000 KES to buy fish, kale and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy fish, kale and tomatoes.

loans.name: Ma. Nimfa

texts.en:
Ma. Nimfa is 30 years old and is a married woman with three children. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Ma. Nimfa has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for six years. She sells items like detergent. soap and shampoo to the people in her community. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as sugar and rice. 

She hopes for her business to be stable so that she can sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as sugar and rice.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad, who is pictured in the photograph, is a 26-year-old taxi driver from Jabalia Refugee camp. Muhammad was hired by the Taxi agency in the refugee camp and has been working with them for three years now.

Muhammad could save a good amount of money but he needs $1,500 to purchase a taxi car and have a better income than sharing the income with the agency.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi car

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 28ans, Afi est revendeuse de pagnes au grand marché de Lomé. Elle a démarré en 2011 en s’approvisionnant chez des grossistes au même lieu. Elle veut ce prêt pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en: 28 yeas old, Afi is a reseller of pagnes (traditional fabric) at the grand market of Lome.  She started in 2011 and buys from wholesalers at the same market.  She wants this loan to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy pagne (traditional fabric)

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 49 years old, married and has four children.

Akram has had a barber shop since 1995, where he offers shaving and massage services. He has a lot of experience and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to renovate his shop and to make a new ceiling for it. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and to make a new ceiling for it.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is 30 years old and married with one child, age 8. She runs a boutique in Tengbeh town, the western part of Freetown. She takes care of two relatives. Her child is currently attending school.   

Salamatu has owned this business for five years and sells a variety of leather slippers at her boutique. She also receives income from her husband. She says that the main challenge to her business is rapid inflation of commodities.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more leather slippers. Salamatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase savings and educate her child. In the future, she would like to expand her business more.

loans.use: to purchase more leather slippers

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 30 years old, married and has three children.

Zeina has been a tailor since 2008. She makes and repairs women's and kids' clothing. She has a long experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and she is becoming well known in her area.

She decided to apply for $2000 loan in order to buy two tailoring machines and a generator. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy two tailoring machines and a generator.

loans.name: Mayra Jannet

texts.es:
Mayra Jannet  tiene 31 años de edad  es soltera vive con dos hijos de 12 y 10 años en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVA UNION se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café.

Mayra Jannet se dedica al cultivo de cacao y naranja. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos e insumos, fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas,  para sus cultivos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta  salir de paseo con los hijos.
texts.en:
Mayra Jannet, 31, is single living with her two children who are 12 and 10 years old in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Nueva Unión” (New Union) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  The members of this communal bank are farmers, especially of corn, cocoa beans, rice, oranges, bananas and coffee.

Mayra Jannet grows cocoa beans and oranges.  She makes her purchases and her sales at the San José del Tambo market every weekend.

She requests the loan to buy farming supplies: fertilizers and manure, for her crops.  The loan will help her meet her economic needs and improve her farming activities.  She faces challenges like the drop in price of the products she sells as well as dealing with middlemen.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.  She enjoys going on outings with her children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is 41 years old and lives with her three children and husband in a private house in a Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her first son is a college sophomore at the Labor University and two other sons are high school students. Her husband was an assistant driver in rural transportation and became a driver in April 2011. Currently, he is fixing his broken car and soon will go for the domestic transportation. If he starts working, his monthly salary will be between 500,000 MNT and 800,000 MNT. 

Altantsetseg started her business by selling lunches and dinners at the local train station from 1996 to 2004. Then, with the profits she earned, she started to sell meat at the Baldanzasag market. She sells 2 or 3 goat or sheep meats on a daily basis. She never changed her sales location and has made many regular clients and sales channels. She is very experienced in her field. 

Altantsetseg became a driver in 2009 after completing the driver's training course. Now she saves her business profits to her savings bank account at Xas bank. She is a loyal customer of Xas bank. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to pay her son's tuition fee and to buy more meat to increase her sales turnover.

loans.use: To pay her son's tuition fee and buy more meat for her business

loans.name: Tony

texts.es: Tony, de 22 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida y por ello se esmera a diario. Tony es locutor de la radio "Amistad" que se encuentra en el poblado de Santa Rosa (Dentro de la selva Ayacuchana. En la vida de tony, la locución es su principal fuente de ingresos y por lo cual se ha dedicado todo su vida. Su esfuerzo se ha visto recompensado, ya que es la principal radio de la ciudad de Santa Rosa y la más sintonizada, lo cual ha hecho que este negocio le sea muy rentable. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es programar música y monitorear que los programas que se transmiten en la radio tengan el contenido adecuado, lleva 03 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer dentro de la radio por casi 12 horas diarias, lo cual lo fatiga mucho. Espera seguir creciendo con este negocio ya que es de su vocación. Este será su quinto crédito con MFP y se compromete a aportar sus pagos en la fecha indicada, ya que desea acceder a otros prestamos posteriormente y esta muy seguro de que contará con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir prosperando.
