Mr. Seng U., 45 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sida Kao (both shown in the photo), 38 years old, have been married since 1988. They have five children: three sons and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker, two attend school and another one is still young. They are living along national road number one, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Seng and his wife are farmers. They grow rice and vegetables on their farmland in the village. But, the couple does not have enough capital to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to maintain their rice and vegetable farm and to pay for plowing fees.  

Hence Seng is asking for his first of $1,200 to help his capital.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice and vegetable farm and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama BA est une femme de 31 ans, elle mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAKIDIOTO depuis le 12 décembre 2006 et a 9 fois de suite reçu de crédits. Avec l'implantation de CAURIE-MF dans son village, elle a commencé commencé à initier une activité par la vente du thé, sucre, cigarette, allumettes etc. Au bout de quatre ans, elle a construit un local où elle vend divers produits et denrées de consommation. Les profits qu'elle génère lui permettent d'aider son mari sur les charges familiales nourriture et éducation des enfants elle souhaite également renforcer le capital de sa boutique qu'elle gère depuis qu'elle est membre du Banc Villageois. Elle souhaiterait faire plus de revenus afin de pouvoir prendre en charge l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adama BA is a 31-year old woman, married and the mother of two dependent children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Bakdioto since December 12, 2006, and obtained loans nine times since joining. After the Caurie Microfinance institution started operating in her village, she launched an enterprise selling tea, sugar, cigarettes, matches etc. After four years, she was able to have a store built, where she sells different products and foodstuffs. The income generated through the store allows her to help her husband take care of the family expenses, such as food and education of their children. She would also like to bolster the business capital of the store she has been running since joining Banc Villageois. She would like to increase her income in order to be able to provide for her children’s education.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster her investment capital in order to expand her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more new movies for her mini-cinema

loans.name: Genivie

texts.en:
Genivie A. is from the village of Basag, San Carlos, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Genivie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Genivie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Genivie joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Genivie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro y lo que mas le agrada es la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro.
Rosa es viuda y tiene 6 hijos, Rosa tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donde vende carne, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la tarde.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne de res y cerdo.
Rosa sueña con mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Futuro” (Future) communal bank. What she likes best is the ease of payments and the savings. Rosa is a widow and has 6 children. She has a stand in Magdalena Market where she sells meat every day from 7am until late afternoon. Rosa needs a 2000 sol loan to buy beef and pork. She dreams with improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef and pork.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia lives in the small city of Kasur in Punjab province, Pakistan. Kasur is near to Lahore and famous for its leather industry. Safia is 58 years old and the mother of two sons. Both sons have left their education and started work. Both do different kinds of job to support the family financially. Safia's husband does manual labor, but at the old age of 60 it is very difficult for him to do such a tough job. However, in order to put three meals on the table he has no other option but to work.
Safia has an embroidery business. She is very good at her work and has more than 30 years' experience. Her work is very popular among her customers and she receives regular orders to make embroidered dresses.
Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her son who wants to buy kites for his kite-selling business. He supplies kites to customers in his local city as well as other cities, particularly Lahore. He has run this business for the last eight years and it brings a good profit. Flying kites is a popular sport in Pakistan, particularly at Basant festival. During this festival, people from all over the world come to Lahore to enjoy flying kites.
Safia is hopeful that by investing in her son’s business he will be able to make extra income each month as a result of improvements in his business. Safia is a regular loan user of Asasah and is on her fourth loan.

loans.use: To purchase kites for resale

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Margarita; tiene 45 años de edad y es madre soltera, ella tiene 3 hijos  trabaja en el Centro Médico Sr. De Huanca en el barrio de Santiago, La socia tiene su consultorio de medicina y ella desea implementar sus instrumentales solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de instrumental médico.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the "Padre Urraca" communal bank, situated in the Huanchac district of Cusco province. Margarita is 45 years old, and is a single mother of 3 children. She works in the Sr. De Huanca Medical Centre in the Santiago neighbourhood. She has her own medical practice and wishes to replace her surgical instruments. She is seeking the loan to invest in the purchase of these instruments. She is grateful for the loan offered by this organisation and vows to complete her repayments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy surgical instruments

loans.name: Sarly

texts.en:
Sarly is a 44-year-old single mother of two who lives with her children in San Rafael Abajo, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Sarly runs a hair salon where she offers services such as styling, dying, cutting, curling, etc. She also sells hair products including items for the treatment of unhealthy hair. She hopes to use this loan to finance the purchase of various hair products, both for sale and to use while carrying out salon services. 

Sarly wakes up early and walks one hour to work from home. When she arrives, she attends to her clients with appointments first. In a good month, she serves between three and five clients.

Sarly´s long term goal is to remodel her salon. By increasing the physical size of her business, she hopes to attract more clients and to hire some help. Her main obstacle is the high level of competition which exists in the area for the services Sarly offers. Additionally, robberies are not uncommon.

loans.use: For the purchase of hair products

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
la señora Maria del Carmen O. G. tiene 58 años de edad, vive en la Colonia San Francisco de la ciudad e San Lorenzo, tiene 5 años de residir en este domicilio y se dedica a la compra y venta de lacteos como ser queso seco, semi seco, ahumado, fresco, quesillo y mantequilla, dichos porductos los vende a sus clientes mayoristas y al detalle.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlos en su negocio para la compra de mas productos lacteos y asi poder mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
las ventas han mejorado y sus clientes le hacen pedidos grandes y no puede cubrir con las necesidades de todos sus clientes es por esa razon que necesita comprar mas lacteos.
texts.en:
Maria Del Carmen O. G. is 58 years old and she lives in the community of San Francisco in the city of San Lorenzo. She has lived for the past 5 years in the same location and her business is buying and selling milk products such as dried cheeses, fresh cheese, smoked cheese, cottage cheese, and butter. She sells her products to wholesalers but she also sells retail. The loan will be used to invest in the business, to purchase more milk products and to improve her income and their quality of life. 

Sales have been improving and her clients are placing large orders and she is unable to meet the demand of all of her clients. She needs to purchase more goods.

loans.use: To purchase cheeses and butter.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase additional materials

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel P. is from the village of Panay, Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 25 years old. Miguel is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Miguel owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from these services. Miguel has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Miguel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miguel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Miguel is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Miguel from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
El Sr. Cristhian es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 21 años, es soltero, hijo único y vive con su madre.

              Se dedica  a la venta de frazadas y colchas por la ciudad de La Colmena y sus compañías hace 3 años, su madre se dedica al mismo rubro.
 Cuenta con más de 60 clientes y comenta que tiene un buen ingreso ya que el mismo administra su negocio.
                Solicita el préstamo para la compra de colchas, frazadas.
texts.en:
Cristhian is from the town of Carapeguá.  He is 21 years old and single.  He is an only child and lives with his mother.

Cristhian has been selling blankets and bedspreads in the town of La Colmena and to his friends for three years.  His mother is in the same business.

He has more than 60 customers and he comments that he makes a good income since he runs his own business.

He is requesting his loan to buy bedspreads and blankets.

loans.use: To buy bedspreads, blankets, hammocks, quilts and other handicrafts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures. She sells eggs and food, and she also drives a pedicab. She lives in Brgy. Cogon, Cordova, Cebu City. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 9,000 PHP. Elizabeth is now borrowing 11,000 PHP so that she can purchase additional inventory to sell. This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elizabeth aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Idayatkan's Group

texts.en:
Idayatkan B. has a traditionally large family of 5 children. Today all of those children are married, have their own families and daily chores, and live separately from parents.

Eleven years ago, the family decided to increase their budget using profits from breeding cattle. This business is now rather stable and provides a regular income from selling sheep and cows. These earnings have provided the opportunity to arrange their children’s weddings and prepare dowries for their daughters.

In order to improve the family's well-being, Idayatkan would like to increase their total number of farm animals and develop the business. This plan requires a certain amount of money, and for this reason the family hopes to receive a loan. In the future they would like to build a new shed in order to improve conditions in which they keep their cattle.

	--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Karamathon's Group

texts.en:
Karamathon S. is the leader of this group. She is 65 and married. Her husband is retired and receives a monthly pension of 2,500 soms. Together they raised three sons and a daughter. The sons are working in construction and the daughter is in Russia. Karamathon and her husband are engaged in livestock breeding.  By reselling the livestock animals after fattening, they earn 5,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, the family wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, Karamathon wants to purchase a piece of land and start building a house for her older son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Haldardjan

texts.en:
Haldardjan I., 60, lives with his family in Tashkiya village. He has three sons and one daughter, who was adopted from an orphanage by his family and became the light of their life. Haldardjan is known as a hard-working and energetic person.

Haldardjan was born into a low-income farm worker’s family and from early childhood helped his parents in farming. Gaining a wide experience in stockmanship, he started his cattle breeding business ten years ago and it became the main source of income for his family. Due to his strong efforts, he has developed his farm and today earns about 15,000 KGS a month through selling milk and meat products to his loyal customers. 
Haldardjan plans to use the loan of 28,000 KGS to broaden his business through buying a bull-calf for fattening and reselling. With the revenues from the loan, he plans to give a good education to his daughter and hold his youngest son’s marriage. Haldardjan is doing his best to provide good conditions in which his children can develop. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners, one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan, uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun H. is 37 years old; he lives in Lchashen village, area of Sevan. He is married with two school-age daughters and his wife stays home to take care of them. 

At different times Harutyun has worked as a taxi driver and as a businessman. He moved to Russia to make more money, but then returned to Armenia. Now he is engaged in animal husbandry and land cultivation. He breeds cows and sheep and cultivates potato plants. His wife helps him in farming and so the support of their family.
 
Harutyun is asking for an 800.000 ($2,200) loan to buy fodder for his farm animals and potato seedlings.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals and potato seedlings

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, es una mujer D. 53 años, que junto a su esposo José cuidan D. sus 2 hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad D. La Merced (selva central peruana). Hace 10 años que se dedica al trasporte con sus 2 motos carros en el interior D. la ciudad (movilidad a base D. motocicletas acondicionadas), todas las mañanas desD. muy temprano sale a supervisar los vehículos, para después dirigirse a una casa D. venta D. motos, y demás vehículos. Pero conocedora D. este negocio, ella también se dedica a la venta D. accesorios del hogar como: manteles, vasos, platos, secadoras, y demás artículos; es que así que por su variedad D. productos, ella logró obtener muchos clientes, razón por la que más adelante desea instalar una tienda equipada, granD. y sobre todo propia. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Optimistas”,  este es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, donD. es una socia responsable y muy comprometida. María como es D. costumbre comprará mercadería, por ello con el crédito comprará electrodomésticos para abastecer la necesidad D. sus clientes. Asimismo comprará repuestos para arreglar su motocicleta.
texts.en:
María is a 53 year old woman who together with her husband, José, cares for their two children in their own home located in the city of La Merced (Peruvian central jungle).

For the last ten years she has been providing  transportation services with her two mototaxis in the city (vehicles based on modified motorcycles).  She goes out early every morning to supervise the vehicles to later go to a firm selling motorcycles and other vehicles.  

Because she is well versed in this business she also sells items for the home: tablecloths, glasses, plates, dryers and other articles.  Because of the variety of products she has been able to secure many customers.  For this reason she’d like to set up a well equipped, large, but above all of her own, store in the future.

She is a member of the “Las Optimistas” (The Optimistic Ones) communal bank.  This is her fifth loan with MFP where she’s a responsible, very committed member.

As usual, María will buy merchandise so will use the loan to buy appliances to meet customer needs.  Similarly, she will buy replacement parts to repair her motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy applianced and motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Mrs. Chuob Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people make up this village bank loan and will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. Mrs. Chuob is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She was born in 1955. She and her husband, Mr. Sunney, are farmers who own a plot of land where they can grow rice. They sell part of their harvest and keep the rest to feed their family. 

Although they try to work hard, they can earn only a little income. So  Mrs. Chuob is applying for a loan to buy a piglet for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other two are students.

loans.use: To buy a piglet

loans.name: Blue Mary

texts.en:
Blue Mary is 45 years old and single with one child. Blue Mary works very hard to provide for them. Blue Mary runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock for her general store.

Blue Mary has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items. Blue Mary also earns income with a farm (rice and sugarcane). In the future, Blue Mary would like to put up a little hardware someday.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Loek

texts.en:
Loek S., 67 years old, is a humble villager living in the capital, Phnom Penh, in the middle of Cambodia. She is married and blessed with three children; two of them are employed in different jobs earning an income. 

To earn a living, Loek S. and her husband are local crop farmers, growing rice and vegetables on their own farmland. Her children use their own motorbike to go to work every day. Unfortunately, their existing motorbike  has often broken down during use. Because of that, Loek S. has decided to seek a loan of $600 from Kiva, which she will use to exchange her children's broken-down motorcycle.

loans.use: To exchange her children's broken-down motorcycle.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: FELIPA G. A.: CASADA DE 40 AÑOS TIENE 4 HIJOS DE LOS CUALES 1 YA ESTA CASADO SU SEGUNDO HIJO TRABAJA Y LE AYUDA PARA SACAR ADELANTE A SUS OTROS DOS HIJOS MAS QUE ESTAN ESTUDIANDO,ELLA TIENE NEGOCIO DE VENTAS DE REFACCIONES Y TAMALES, INICIO VENDIENDO HACE 20 AÑOS Y GRACIAS A LA VENTAS Y EL APOYO DE SU ESPOSO PUDO DARLE UNA CARRERA A NIVEL MEDIO A SU HIJA Y SE SIENTE MUY FELIZ AL SABER QUE GRACIAS A SU TRABAJO A PODIDO DARLES LO MEJOR A SU FAMILIA,ELLA NOS CUENTA QUE QUIERE PONER UNA VENTA DE ZAPATOS AMERICANOS YA QUE SOLO VENDE LOS DIAS MIERCOLES,VIERNES Y SABADO. Y EN LAS MAÑANAS SE DEDICA A CUIDAR A UN NIÑO PARA GANERAR UN INGRESO MAS DE DINERO, ELLA SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE ZAPATOS AMERICANOS DE SEGUNDA MANO EL SUEÑO DE ELLA ES SEGUIR APOYANDO A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR Y DARLES UN MEJOR FUTURO A SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
Felipa García A., 40, is married and has four children.  One of them is already married and her second son works and helps her support her other two children who are still in school.  She has a business selling refreshments and tamales.  She started selling 20 years ago and thanks to sales and help from her husband she was able to provide her daughter with a middle level career.  She feels very happy to know that through her work she was able to give the best to her family.

She tells us that she wants to set up an American shoe sales business on Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays.  During mornings she babysits a little boy to earn extra income.  She is asking for the loan to buy used American shoes.  Her dream is to continue to help her husband with household expenses and provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy used American shoes.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina M. is 55 years old,  married, and has three children.  She is from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. Catalina has been engaged in farming for 30 years. She primarily grows rice to sell. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers and seeds. Catalina works hard to improve her business. She wants to be able to save for her children’s future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Kagarama Bakyara Tukore Group

texts.en:
Abdul, 54, has been a taxi driver for the last 16 years in Kagarama town council-Ntungamo. This business has been invaluable to him in many respects, principally in the provision of better welfare for his family of 22. 

Local folk describe Abdul as a gentleman with a happy-go-lucky disposition. This they say has endeared him to many people who travel from Ntungamo to other parts of Western Uganda. 

Abdul was at first engaged in an agro produce sales business. Like many people in Western Uganda, Abdul also ekes out additional income from a farming business. He says weekly this business nets him profits of 100,000 Ugandan shillings. He says with this loan, he is going to purchase spare parts for his taxi and also pay for overall repairs on it.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for repairs on his taxi

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos ya todos mayores de edad. Su esposo es maestro en un colegio en la  ciudad de Manta.

Ella comparte su tiempo entre su trabajo y su negocio ya que ella es maestra de una escuela en la ciudad de Montecristi pero también se dedica al comercio en lo que es venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días por semana recorriendo la ciudad pero casi todos los días ella ofrece sus productos en la escuela donde imparte sus conocimientos tanto a sus compañeras como también a madres de familia que llegan hasta este centro de estudios. Deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Lleva cinco años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos ciclos y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The José Cesario Reyes community bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are recognized on both a national and international level. It is also known for its famous Panama hats.

Here we meet Ana, who is 52 years old, married, and has four adult children.  Her husband is a teacher in a high school in the city of Manta.

She divides her time between her job and her business.  She is a teacher in a school in the city of Montecristi, but she also has a business selling all types of clothing.  She sells door to door.  She works three days a week, traveling through the city, but every day she offers her products at the school, where she teaches her skills to her colleagues and also to the mothers who come to the school.  She offers credit to her customers, and she collects payment every fifteen days.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to.  She has been doing this work for five years and it is going very well.

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.  She has been in the community bank for two cycles and she likes the ease of getting loans.  

Her dream is to have a large store where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and young child. He has owned a barber shop since 2006 and has ten years of experience working in the same field. He learned this occupation when he was young. He is well known in his town as well as in neighboring villages. The borrower is the only source of income for the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase additional products and tools needed to continue his work appropriately. He is expecting to further expand his business and he is very confident that he will be able to achieve substantial growth in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has three children.

Haydar has owned a car repair workshop since 2000. He has a lot of experience, a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to renovate his workshop and to make a sliding door. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his workshop and to make a sliding door.

loans.name: Erminia

texts.es:
Erminia es una mujer alegre y trabajadora de 40 años de edad, es madre de familia y vive en casa propia con sus 3 hijos y esposo, que la apoya en sus actividades. Erminia vive en una comunidad pequeña y rural del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. No cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.

Erminia se dedica  a la agricultura y ganadería. Ella cosecha limón y cría ovinos para luego comercializarlos. Erminia cuenta con un ganado numeroso (35 ovejas) y su esposo la ayuda a manejarlo. Esta actividad la realizan desde hace más de 5 años.

Erminia solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de limón (fertilizantes) y para comprar alimento balanceado a sus ovinos.

Erminia es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación y este crédito le daría la oportunidad de seguir desarrollando su negocio adecuadamente
texts.en:
Erminia is a cheerful and hardworking woman of 40 years old. She is the mother of a family and lives in her own house with her 3 children and her husband, who supports her in her work. Erminia lives in a small rural community in the district of Tambogrande – Piura, which does not have access to all the basic utilities.

Erminia dedicates herself to farming and raising livestock. She harvests lemons and raises sheep, which she later sells. Erminia has a large flock of 36 sheep, and her husband helps her to look after them. She has been doing this for over 5 years. 

Erminia is seeking a loan of 1000 Soles from [the field partner] Edpyme Alternativa, in order to maintain her lemon crop with fertilizers and to buy feed for her sheep.

Erminia has a great desire to improve her situation, and this loan will give her the opportunity to continue developing her business.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose  is 50 years old, married to Peter,  and they have  four school-going children.  

She has practiced farming for the last eleven years.  She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her third  loan. She plans to use the loan amount to purchase  a dairy cow.

In future, Rose hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos de 18, 17, 14 y 8 años de edad, él es agricultor, a través de la siembra de maíz y frijol ha logrado por años mantener a su familia, esta actividad se la enseño su padre, y actualmente trabaja de 6:00am a 2:00pm, quiere invertir un préstamo en abono y herbicidas, para proteger las siembras.
La compra le ayudara para que su cultivo se desarrolle y produzca buenos frutos, con el único riesgo que dicho cultivo depende de las condiciones del clima; con la esperanza de tener un buen trabajo al final, aspira contribuir al estudio de sus hijos, apoyándolos en todo lo necesario.
texts.en: Paulino lives with his wife and four children aged 18, 17, 14, and 8. He is a farmer and by planting corn and beans he has managed to support his family for years. He learned his trade from his father. He works each day from 6:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. He wants to use his loan to invest in fertilizer and herbicides to protect his crops. This purchase will help in crop development and production. The only risk is that the crops depend on weather conditions. He hopes to contribute to his children's studies and to support them with whatever they need with the hope of them finding good jobs in the end.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide

loans.name: Petra

texts.es:
La señora Petra tiene la edad de 39 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos que se encuentra estudiando uno estudia la educacion primaria y el otro la secuendaria. Ella y su familia viven en una zona productora de azucar.

Ella nos comenta que desde hace unos años decidio iniciar con su propio de negocio de venta de ropa porque queria apoyar a su esposo con los gasto del hogar y porque querie ofrecerle en un futuro a sus hijos una profesion.

Doña Petra realiza su venta de ropa casa por casa, mostrandole a sus amigas y vecinos su ropa, dice que en ocasiones ya le llegan a pedir su ropa pues sus clientes la ocupan para dar un obsquio para una fiesta por eso siempre le gusta estar surtida de varidad de ropa, es por eso que ella quiere en un futuro tener un pequeño localito para  poner mostrar su ropa y pueda su negocio posperar.

Ella necesita este credito para la compra de blusas, faldas, calcetines, ropa interior para dama y caballero, playeras, camisas, pantalones, vestidos para su posterior venta.

Doña Petra espera que con esta inversion su negocio aumente y pueda ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Petra is 39 years old and studied through the preparatory school level.  She is married and has two children, one in elementary school and the other in high school.  Petra and her family live in a sugar producing region.  

She says that a few years ago she decided to start her own business selling clothes because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and provide her children the chance to pursue a profession in the future.  

Doña Petra sells clothes by going house-to-house, showing her merchandise to friends and neighbors.  Sometimes her customers will order clothes to give as party gifts so she always tries to remain stocked with a variety of fashions.  For this reason, she wants to have a small shop in the future where she can exhibit her merchandise and see her business prosper.  

She needs this loan to buy blouses, skirts, socks, undergarments for men and women, t-shirts, shirts, trousers, and dresses for eventual resale.  Doña Petra hopes that this investment will increase her business so that she can offer a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
For the past six years Abena, a single parent taking care of four children, has been making palm kernel oil in Abura. She will use her loan to buy more palm nuts to expand her kernel business, and anticipates reinvesting the increased profits for further growth.

To prepare her palm kernel oil, Abena removes the shells from the palm nuts. The shelling used to be performed manually, using two stones to crack each nut to separate the kernel and shell. Thanks to advancements in machinery, we now use nut-cracking machines instead. The traditional oil extraction method is to simply heat the dried nuts to release the palm kernel oil. The released oil is then skimmed from the top of the nuts. This process is continued until all of the oil is skimmed out of the palm kernel.

loans.use: to expand her palm kernel business.

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали женат и ответственный отец 3 детей. Он занимается купля продажей женской обуви на местном рынке. Он начал свой бизнес в 1996 году, он продал свой домашних скот и с этим капиталом привез товары для бизнеса. Вот до сих пор успешно продолжает этот бизнес и у него много постоянных клиентов. Курбонали хотел бы получить 2000$ США для покупки женской обуви с целью расширения бизнеса и пополнение оборотного капитала. Он заранее хочет благодарить вас всех за поддержку.
texts.en: Kurbonali is married and is a responsible father of three children.  He is involved in buying and selling women's shoes at the local market.  He started his business in 1996 when he sold his livestock and used this capital to acquire the goods for his business.  He still successfully runs this business and has many loyal customers.  Kurbonali wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of women's shoes in order to expand his business and add to his revolving capital.  He wants to thank you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher wants a loan to complete construction of a commercial building. He deals in motorcycle transportation and the business has been very profitable. Aged 30 years, he hails from Kyenjojo District and is a father of three children, ages 2 through 6, with whom he lives together with their mother in a permanent house. His major challenge is accidents and his desire is to diversify and venture into the renting business.

loans.use: to complete building a commercial building.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 24 years old, and married to his wife Phylis who is a housewife. They are blessed with one child. Justine has been buying and selling beans for the last three years, with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

He requests a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), with which he intends to purchase more stock of beans for his business. This is his first loan and his hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To add stock of beans for sale.

loans.name: Shereen

texts.en: Shereen is a 24-year-old married woman from Gaza. She owns a store in which she sells accessories. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to buy new accessories for her store. She also hopes that once she improves the status of her store, she will be able to help her husband financially as well.

loans.use: To buy new accessories for her store.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin has 7 children aged 20 to 33. He has been a maize farmer for 23 years. He would like a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow his crop. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow his crop.

loans.name: Oumou Khairé

texts.fr: Madame Oumou Khairé  est mariée et vit au Sénégal. Elle est mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 5 et 12 ans. Elle est âgée  de 32 ans et s’active dans  le commerce et la vente de tissus, portables, prêt à porter, etc. Elle a une expérience  de 2 ans dans son activité. C’est un choix qu’elle a fait pour pouvoir  travailler pour son propre compte et satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Elle est membre  de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis septembre 2011 et sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus  teintés  qui seront destinés a la vente. Son objectif avec ce financement est de renforcer son chiffre d’affaire, de gagner une part  plus importante du marché et élargir son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Mrs Oumou Khairé is a 32 year old married woman living in Senegal, and a mother of three children aged 5 to 12. She has been involved in the sale of cloth, mobile phones, ready to wear clothing, etc for the past two years. She made this choice in order to work on her own conditions and to satisfy her personal needs. She has been a member of the UIMCEC bank since September 2011 and is asking for a loan of 400,000 francs [approximately 820 USD] to purchase dyed cloth to be re-sold. Her goal with this financing is to receive more revenues, gain market share and increase her retail activity.

loans.use: purchase cloth to re-sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia lives in the coastal town of Likoni, Kenya. She is a single mother of two children. Virginia owns a tailoring shop which has been in operation for ten years.

She heard of Milango from her friends and decided to join in order to access credit for her businesses. She is applying for a loan of KES 20,000 in order to purchase more cloth in preparation for the Christmas festivities. Her main challenge is high cost of materials.

Virginia looks forward to owning more boutiques in the future. The income obtained from this business will help her to purchase more tailoring machines for example an overlock machine (used for hemming and seaming).

loans.use: to purchase more new cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood and corn

loans.name: Chibakogroup

texts.en:
Samson is 43 years old. He is married and has 5 children, aged 15, 6, 5, 3 years and a 9-month old baby.   Two of the children go to school. He does not have any other dependents staying with him.

He operates a flea market stand in Masvingo town. He has been in the business for 9 years and has no employees working for him. He buys his products from Harare. Samson has requested for a loan of $200.00 to buy clothes for resale. He faces a challenge of debtors failing to pay on time. In the next 5 years he would like to own a shop in the Central Business District of Masvingo. The profits he will get from the loan will assist him in providing food and send his growing family to school.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet has been active in farming for 4 years. She is married and has 3 children, all under eight years old. Her farm produce of eggs and maize go to the local market in her hometown of Kitale, in Western Kenya.

Violet has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from JuhudI Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the improvement in her farming income will enable her to make her family members lives better. With additional milk for family consumption, the improved farming will also provide money to add more pressing basic needs.

Violet remains optimistic with the farming business, owing to the experience she has since acquired. She, however, points out that animal diseases remain the major challenge to the gains of farming, especially dairy.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.en: Mashura is hardworking and smart woman. She is 26 years old. Mashura is married. She studies at the second course Pedagogical University. She is a student of the Math and informatics. Mashura studies well. She reads many books. She likes read classic literature. Mashura dreams to be successful teacher in future. She must pay for tuition but she has not money. She is asking for a loan of 400 USD to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Living in the rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Mom is 49 years old and married with four children. She has been farming rice, selling grocery items and sometimes she works as a paid worker while her husband works as a policeman to earn more income for the family. 
Mom has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Jocelyne's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Jocelyne, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 34 ans est mariée à un certain Rock. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jocelyne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Depuis six ans environ, Jocelyne vend des mèches et des produits de coiffure par la technique de distribution, ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Jocelyne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Jocelyne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des des mèches et des produits de coiffure.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 26 years old married to Irine and blessed with two children Caroline and Emmanuel.He has been into vegetable and tea selling business for seven years and earns a monthly income of KES. 18,000.

This is his second loan with Vision Fund Kenya,he intends to pay fees for his two children as he anticipates to expand his business from the expanded business profits.His dream is to have a good house for his family.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Bea is 42 years and a mother of two. She has been selling local liquor over the last 5 years. The liquor store is located in a heavily populated area of the city which bustles with a lot of social activities. She has gone through the TEACH learning sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION and hopes to increase sales significantly if KIVA assists her with requested amount.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary Lamet intends to buy beads for the business

loans.name: Swinnie

texts.en: Swinnie is 38 years old, and is a divorced mother of five. She has been selling maize supplies and has a small food business where she sells food to construction workers. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her clientele base, supply more, and set up a small restaurant.

loans.use: To expand her business and set up a restaurant

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine A. is married with six (6) children, and is 45 years old. She hails from Delta State, Nigeria. She is proud of her business and promises to effectively use the above loan to expand her foodstuffs business. She has 25 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: To buy provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Meredith De Jesús

texts.es:
Meredtih is a young mother of two small children. She is separated temporarily from her husband because his labor obligations take him out of their city in order to find work to meet their financial needs and responsibilities. During one of their difficult times, with the help of her eldest daughter, she decided to embark on making juices in her home and to sell them in the city market. At first it was difficult because she didn't expect how hard it would be to store the prepared juice, since she didn't have the proper space. Later, and with much effort, Meredith managed to rent a space in the nearby market and in just a short time, things began to improve considerably. Now, due to the increasing demand for her juices, Meredith has decided to acquire more utensils and associated juicing merchandise in order to improve service. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of $500 USD, which she plans to repay in a short period of time (6 months).

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Meredtih es una joven madre de dos pequeños niños; se encuentran separados temporalmente del jefe de familia debido a que sus obligaciones laborales las tiene que desempeñar fuera de su ciudad natal sin descuidar ni dejar de contribuir con los gastos de su hogar La falta de trabajo hizo que se dedicara a la venta de jugos con el apoyo de su hija mayor en el mercado de su ciudad con el objetivo de procurarles bienestar e incrementar la calidad de vida de los mismos.Al principio fue una difícil tarea por que no contaba con el espacio ni el lugar idóneo para ofrecer sus preparados, posteriormente y con mucho esfuerzo logró alquilar un espacio en el mercado más concurrido y en poco tiempo las cosas han ido mejorando notablemente. Debido a la demanda creciente de su trabajo ha decidido adquirir más utensilios y artefactos con el propósito de mejorar su servicio a razón de este hecho solicita el préstamo de 500 dólares con el deseo de concretar en corto tiempo sus metas..

loans.use: To purchase utensils and items for her juicing business.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
The father of Maria’s two small children abandoned them, and she was left liable for certain household bills and their children. What she earned as a cleaner in a construction company was not enough to meet the expenses of her children. For this reason she decided that selling some product would be the best means to ensure her family’s advance. One day in October 2006, as she was leaving her sons at school, she realised that the salespeople who were in the school entrance sold a lot, and it occurred to her that she could do the same outside her house, so one day she put a small table outside with some sweets and snacks and the people who passed began to buy. She like this work and little by little invested in more merchandise: later she put up a shelf with snacks and now she has more stock.

The project of Maria is to expand her business more and to establish a more permanent and larger shop by renovating part of her house’s patio. It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan of $475 USD which she is intending to pay back in 4 months and with money Maria will be able to buy more merchandise and with these profits she will be able to establish her little grocery shop in her house patio. With your help Maria, one of so many single mothers, will be able to move forward with her children and offer a good example for life.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El padre de los dos pequeños hijos de María los abandonó, y ella quedó desprotegida con ciertos gastos del hogar y de sus hijos. Puesto que con lo que ganaba como trabajadora de limpieza en una constructora no le alcanzaba para pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Por lo tanto decidió que vender algún producto sería la mejor manera de sacar adelante a su familia. Y fue así que en Octubre del 2006, una vez que fue a dejar a sus hijos a la escuela se dio cuenta que los vendedores que estaban a la entrada de la escuela vendían mucho, y a ella se me ocurrió hacerlo fuera de su casa, así que un día sacó una mesita con algunos dulces y frituras y la gente que pasaba le empezó a comprar, le gustó y poco a poco fue invirtiendo en más mercancía, después puso un anaquel con frituras y ahora tiene más surtido.

El proyecto de María es expandir más su negocio para poner una tiendita en forma y más grande, acondicionando un espacio del patio de su casa. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar más mercancía para que así con las ganancias ella pueda adecuar su pequeña tienda de abarrotes en el patio de su casa. Con tu ayuda María una de tantas madres solteras podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles un buen ejemplo de vida y superación.

loans.use: Stock merchandise in order to be able to acquire a place for his shop

loans.name: Encam

texts.en: Encam is 30 years old, and sells clothes on credit door-to-door around the village. She usually earns US $2.75 per day. Her husband, A., has no fixed income. Encam requests a loan to expand her business. She is a member of MBK, and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan K. is 43 years old and married with three children.  He sells used clothes in the eastern part of Kabala town, in Sierra Leone.  He started his business 12 years ago, but the business started really expanding 3 years ago with the loans from SMT.  He is eager to continue to expand the business. He would like to be able to purchase more bales of clothing at a time so he can lower his expenses and increase his profits.

loans.use: Hassan would like to be able to purchase more bales of clothing for sale at a time.

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es:
Benjamin is a committed family man. His high sense of responsibility motivates him to work hard every day in the fields. He also finds the time to be an active member of the community. He owns crop fields where he primarily plants corn and peas in the high elevations of his city. His desire to improve the quality of life of his family has led him to become involved in many community activities, and he is therefore well-known among its residents. He is seeking a loan with the desire to increase his financial earnings and invest them in the purchase of improved seeds, manure and fertilizers for the next sowing season. Your help will be very important in the achievement of this active family man's goals.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer

Benjamín, es un padre de familia comprometido, su alto sentido de responsabilidad lo impulsa cada día a dedicarse en las duras tareas del campo y es así que su actividad diaria las comparte con su compromiso como participante activo de su comunidad.Cuenta con campos de cultivo en los que siembra predominantemente maíz y arvejas en las alturas de su ciudad. El deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de los miembros de su hogar lo han conducido a involucrarse en muchas actividades comunales y por esta razón es muy reconocido entre sus miembros.Con el deseo de incrementar sus ingresos económicos solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de semillas mejoradas, abonos y fertilizantes para esta próxima siembra.Tu ayuda es muy importante para la cristalización de los deseos de este activo padre de familia.

loans.use: Purchase of manure, fertilizers and better seeds

loans.name: Lake H B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rebecca N.. She is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to boost her business. Rebecca is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has 5 children ranging from age 2 to 12 and most of her children go to school. Each week, Rebecca makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her household's needs and repay the loan. Rebecca has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to expand her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Rebecca is joined in her small group by Mutunda K. and Jane M.. Mutunda K. has a business selling used clothes and wants to increase her purchases. Jane M. is currently operating a business trading produce and wants a loan to purchase more rice.

loans.use: To add to business selling clothes and increase stock

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina Q. is a trader who sells cooking utensils and provisions. She is married and has four children. Demand for her goods has increased but her current capital can not buy enough goods to meet the customer demand.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
“I thank God for making LAPO to be in Benin, I am very sure God made it to be in Benin because of me,” says Mrs Charity E.. She is 58 years old, married with two children, and lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria.

Mrs E. sells and supplies pure water which she learnt by herself. She has been into this business for the past 21 years. She needs the loan to buy more table water for sales to meet the demands of her increasing customers.

loans.use: To buy more Table Water for sales

loans.name: Ismat

texts.ru:
Ismat S. has successfully paid off his first loan. He used the received profits to noticeably improve his business. There has been many changes in his personal life, particularly that he has repaired his house. At this time he wants to get another loan to continue expanding his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сидиков Исмат успешно закончил свой первый займ полученный. На полученную прибыль он заметно улучшил условия своего бизнеса, много перемен в его семейных условиях, в частности он отремонтировал свой дом. Сейчас он собирается получить новый займ для дальнейшего расширения своей деятельности.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr:
Kodzo A. is 38 years old. He is married and father to four children. He lives fifty kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He is a chaffeur and taxi driver who owns his own vehicle. With this loan, he wishes to replace his motor; it is worn out, and is the cause of frequent breakdowns that prevent him from working regularly. The replacement of the motor and the servicing of the car will allow him to spend less and save more, the better to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Kodzo A. est âgé de 38 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il habite à 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. II est chauffeur, conducteur de taxi et propriétaire de son propre véhicule. Avec ce nouveau crédit, il désire renouveler le moteur qui est trop usé et source de fréquentes pannes ce qui l’empêche de travailler normalement. Le renouvellement du moteur et la révision de la voiture lui permettront de dépenser moins et d’économiser plus pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Replacement of motor and servicing of automobile

loans.name: Elsavar

texts.en: Elsavar was born in 1971. He is  an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He settled in the Fuzuli region, Mahmudliu village. This young man is married and has 2 children. 5 years ago, he started an auto repair business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy necessary tools for auto repairing.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools for auto repair

loans.name: Waride's Mkorofi Si Mwenzetu Group

texts.en:
Waride is married with 8 children between 18 and 6 years old. She has been a charcoal and juice seller since 2006. Daily she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Waride now hopes for a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Frola and Sharifa, who also have businesses dealing with juice and snacks sales.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding her current stock.

loans.name: Joshqun

texts.en:
Joshqun H. is 21 years old, unmarried, and the only son in his family.  He is responsible for the care of his elderly parents who are now receiving pensions.

Joshqun is an industrious person and has worked as an apprentice in the house construction business.  Now after two years, he is an experienced builder, and has constructed a number of different building types which have sold in the region.

His business provides for the needs of his family and he wishes to improve their quality of life. Joshqun is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase the necessary construction materials to repair houses, thus completing his current orders and pending jobs on time for his clients.

He and his family are very grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for repairing houses

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.es:
Yasmin es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Yasmin es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Yasmin es de profesión obstetriz, tiene 3 consultorios obstétricos, en los cuales brinda servicios de control prenatal, atención de partos entre otros servicios, además en uno de sus consultorios tiene una farmacia.
Yasmin necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos de belleza.
Los sueños de Yasmin es tener una clínica moderna, ampliar sus negocios y sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yasmin is a member of the village bank Comunal Legioncito. Yasmin lives with her partner, is 38 years old, and has 3 children. Yasmin is an obstetrician, has 3 offices where she provides prenatal services, labor and delivery care, among other services. In addition, in one of her offices she has a pharmacy. Yasmin needs a loan of 1000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of beauty products. Yasmin's dreams are to have a modern clinic, expand her business and for her children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products

loans.name: Lena Karen

texts.es:
La Señora Lena Karen R. C. vive en la zona de Sopocachi, un barrio residencial de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia. Trabajaba como proyectista en su propia microempresa que se dedica a la instalación de gas domiciliario en la ciudad del El Alto, Bolivia.
Este crédito será destoinado a la compra del material necesario, como ser: tubos, varillas, válvulas, medidores, etc. debido a que actualmente el negocio ha sido bastante exitoso y tiene muchas instalaciones pendientes. Es una microempresaria bastante exitosa y gracias al microcrédito ha podido salir adelante.
texts.en:
Señora Lena Karen R. C. lives in the Sopocachi zone, a residential neighborhood in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. She worked as a planner for her own small company that installs gas in homes in the city of El Alton, Bolivia. This loan is going to be used in the purchase of needed materials like: pipes, rods, valves, meters, etc. since her business has been pretty successful and has many more pending installations. She is a small-business woman who has been quite successful and, thanks to microcredit, she has been able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in Capital

loans.name: El Manantial Group

texts.es:
El contacto para la formación fue la señora Elba M., domiciliada en el barrio Romancito Sector 5 de C.D.E. Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas  para formar el comité en dicha zona.
El comité se denomina “El Manantial”, está constituido  por 16 señoras muy activas todas de la misma zona.
Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser Venta de: Pantalones, remeras, tomates, cebollas, maquillajes, polvo compacto, cremas para el rostro, perfumes,  manzanas, bananas, melones, sandias, platos, cucharas, Tenedores, cuchillos y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo.
El detalle de actividades por señora es la siguiente:
El Crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para y artículos de primera necesidad para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
The contact person for this group was Mrs. Elba M., who lives in the neighborhood Romancito Sector 5 de C.D.E. She contacted her neighbors and friends to set up the committee for the aforementioned area.

The committee is called "El Manantial" and is made up by 16 very active ladies, all from the same neighborhood. They carry out different activities such as sale of trousers, T-shirts, tomatoes, onions, make-up, compact powder, facial cream, perfumes, apples, bananas, melons, watermelons, plates, spoons, forks, and knives. Some of them are setting up a new business but have a fixed income. The loan will be spent on the purchase of merchandise and basic articles to be sold later.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, vegetables, cosmetics, cutlery, etc. for retail sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy accesories and equipment needed for fishing

loans.name: Panakh

texts.en:
Panakh A. is 47 years old. He works as a merchant in a rented store where he sells children's toys. Panakh  started his business 9 years ago. He is married and has six children. As it is very hard to cover all the needs of such a big family, Panakh tries very hard. His business is the main source of income for the family. 

Panakh is trying to have a wide range of goods with good quality to meet the requirements of his customers and to satisfy the needs of customers with different levels of income. Today, Panakh is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 14 months. This is the first time that Panakh has asked for a loan through AqroInvest and KIVA. It will be used to buy more toys in order to increase the range of his goods. Panakh and his family are counting on your help.

loans.use: Purchase toys for re-sale

loans.name: José

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León el señor José A. se dedica arduamente a su actividad de ganadería el cual atiende con mucho esfuerzo para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Su principal actividad es la crianza de vacas el cual les saca el máximo provecho extrayendo la leche para después comercializarla. Hoy en día el motivo por el cual acude a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de vaquillas y de esta forma continuar en su actividad ganadera que tanto requiere de su apoyo para desarrollarla.
texts.en:
Mr. José A. earns his living by raising livestock in the borough of El Sauce in the city of León. He works very hard at his business to provide a living for his family.

He maximizes his earnings on breeding livestock by milking the cows, and then selling the milk. Today he has turned to Ceprodel because he hopes to receive a loan in order to buy additional heifer cows so that he can continue to grow his livestock business. Your support will make this possible.

Translated from Spanish by Claudio Cambon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Heifer Cows

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say C. is 26 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is married to Mr. Sony, who is a taxi driver, and they have one lovely young child. Say owns farmland that she inherited from her grandparents. She grows vegetables and some fruit trees. She sells her produce to market retailers every five months, when her crops mature. Cashew season is approaching, so she is applying for a $600 loan to purchase cashews that she will store in the family home for a while and then later resell for income..

loans.use: To purchase cashew

loans.name: Narmandah

texts.en:
Narmandah S. is 21 years old. He was just married this year. He also become a father one month ago. Narmandah's spouse, Oyuntsetseg, is a teacher who works at a local elementary school. She is now staying at home to take care of her infant.

Narmandah's family lives in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent) on land they own in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. In 2008, Narmandah started his retail business. He buys animals such as sheep and cows from herders in spring, when they are cheap, and feeds them all summer to use their milk to make dairy products. In autumn, when animals get fat, he kills and sells them. Narmandah says, "I would like to become a herder in the future, and own a thousand animals. I want my son to become a herder too.” He requests a loan to buy animals in the approaching spring to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To buy animals in the approaching spring.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
Emperatriz siempre ha trabajado mucho por tener un futuro más prospero, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su querida hija Joselin de 10 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La vida de Emperatriz no fue muy sencilla, desde muy pequeña siempre se preocupo por ayudar con los gastos de su casa, actualmente ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, supuesto esta ubicado en el mercado Tupac Amaru (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), en el cual ofrece muchas prendas de vestir, como casacas, chompas, pantalones, etc.
Lleva 7 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus vecinas de venta y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en el mercado, anhela mejorar su puesto y llenarlo de mas prendas de vestir, lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir, aun así esta dispuesta a cualquier sacrificio con tal de alcanzar sus metas. Este es el quinto préstamo de Emperatriz en MFP y esta decidida a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, así como hizo con sus anteriores préstamos, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada por sus socias. Con los mil nuevos comprará más ropa para aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que vende en su puesto.
texts.en:
Emperatriz has always worked hard to have a more prosperous future. She lives in a rented house with her dear daughter Joselin, age 10, who is the reason for all Emperatriz's work efforts. Emperatriz's life hasn't been easy, since she was very young she has had to worry about helping with household expenses. Currently she has a business selling clothes, located in the Tupac Amaru market (a very well-known market in Juliaca city), which offers different types of clothing such as jackets, sweaters, pants, etc. She has done this work for seven years and what she likes best is chatting with neighboring vendors and finding out what is happening in the market. Emperatriz longs to improve her stand and fill it with more clothing. What she likes least about the work is having to stay inside her store all day without leaving, although she is willing to make any sacrifice as long as she reaches her goals. This is her fifth loan with MFP and Emperatriz is determined to make her payments on time, as she did for her previous loans. In her community bank she is loved and respected by the other members. With the 1,000 PEN she will buy more clothing to increase the quantity of merchandise that she sells in her market stall.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase store merchandise

loans.name: Urazgul

texts.ru: Уразгул – молодая женщина 23 лет, замужем но пока детей не имеет. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Она помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, потому что хочет иметь больше прибыли, чтобы расширять семью, так как Уразгул готовится стать матерью. За счет займа Уразгул и её муж хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли. Уразгул кредитуется в нашей организации больше одного года. Это ее третий займ за этот период. Уразгул всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ и поэтому она смогла помочь мужу для увеличения количества своего скота. Она благодарит нас и КИВУ за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Urazgul is a young 23 year old woman, married, but does not have children yet. Her husband is in the business of buying and reselling cattle on the market. She feeds the cattle at home. She helps her husband in growing of the business because she wants to make more profit to expand their family as Urazgul is getting ready to become a mother. Urazgul and her husband want to use the loan to increase the number of cattle and make more profit. Urazgul has been taking out loans from our organization for more than one year. This is her third loan. Urazgul has been always using the loans purposefully and this is why she was able to help her husband to increase the number of cattle. She is thanking us and Kiva for the financial support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Noelia T. se dedica a su negocio de venta de variedad de productos en su pulpería que a diario atiende con el propósito de mantener su hogar.

Ella se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace varios años y hoy en día está comprometida en desarrollar más dicho negocio y para ello espera en que Ceprodel le ayude por medio del otorgamiento del crédito que solicitó para mejorar sus condiciones y salir adelante.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, señora Noelia T. has a business selling a variety of products in her grocery store, which she attends to daily to support her home. She has had this business for several years and is committed to develop it even more. She is hoping that Ceprodel will help her by offering her a credit so she can improve her business and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Msf Group

texts.en:
Here are Alimany M., Mustapha S. and Amadu K. of the MSF group. They are businessmen in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each to help them develop their businesses.

Alimany M. (left) is the leader of this group. Alimany was born in Magburaka town 37 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children. Three of their children are in primary school and the last is still being breastfed. Alimany sells tires and inner tubes. He also patches inner tubes in Magburaka town. He has been in this business for eight years now.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Rebecca Kisakye’S Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is the leader of a group with four members.  She is a 35-year-old single mother of five children, between the ages of 3 and 12. All her children go to school. She rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with five people. Rebecca also takes care of four additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water in her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. Rebecca deals in secondhand men’s clothes and shoes. She goes shopping daily, using public transport, to buy inventory from industrial producers. She sells to an average of 10 people a day, from all walks of life. She works seven days a week. Rebbecca sells mainly on a retail basis. Her major monthly expenses include school fees for her children, electricity and food. She has been in this business for the last ten years.

Rebecca has been with MCDT for over five years with the same group mates, and she is applying for their tenth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of shoes for resale. Rebecca hopes to see her business grow until she can earn a permanent business location and home.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Iv

texts.en:
Iv L., 44, is married and has four children: two of them are students and the rest are construction workers who typically earn US$ 2 per day. He lives with his wife in Battambong province. He is engaged in working in the agriculture sector as a rice field farmer on his own plot of farmland. He is also a motor-taxi driver who usually provides his transportation services in his village and some nearby markets.

Iv L. typically is able to generate an income of US$ 4.50 per day as a primary source of income to cover his family expenses. His wife (pictured) operates a grocery store at her home with an income of US$ 5 per day. Global financial problems have hit many people hard. These economic struggles have forced many people to cut back on expenses and to find ways to save money.

L. and his wife have found an opportunity to increase family income by starting another business for his wife as grocery seller. They have approached CREDIT for a loan of US$ 250 to purchase groceries that will allow them to save more money and to raise their standard of living.

loans.use: purchasing more groceries for resale

loans.name: Seony

texts.en:
Seony R. is from the village of Marahan, Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 24 years old. Seony is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Seony owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store.
