While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of products in the local community. Seony is just starting this business.

In 2009, Seony joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Seony is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Seony from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Mrs. Perpetua P. is 53 years old, married and blessed with 5 children. Her family are residents of Tabao Baybay, Prk. Malipayon, San Enrique, Negros Occidental. She dreams of providing a proper education for her children, supporting the family's needs and providing them with a better future. This is Mrs. P.'s main concern, because  she knows that if she relies only on her husband's income, all of her dreams would come to naught, because his income is just too small to sustain the needs of her fairly large family. 

Because of her strong determination to fulfill her dreams, she thought of ways to earn more income. To have access to the much-needed capital to start her business, Perpetua joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, and started selling gasoline in her community. Their place is relatively far from the nearest gasoline station, and there is a demand for gasoline because of the many motorcycles and tricycles (motorcycle with a side-car for passengers) that ply the roads of their community. For 10 years, Perpetua has been fairly successful in this business and it earns her about PHP 4,000 per month.

This will be Mrs. P.'s 14th loan from NWTF. She wants to borrow Php 20,000 to use as additional working capital so that she can expand her gasoline retailing business.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To invest in expanding business

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr:
A. Florence est née vers les années 1971 à Abomey, Capitale historique du Bénin. Florence est
mariée DOSSOU Julien, mécanicien moto de formation qui s’est reconverti dans la revente de véhicules d’occasion. Florence est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés dont l’aîné en classe de cinquième.La famille vit à Xwlacodji un bidonville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Depuis 6 ans, Florence a pour activité la vente de charbon de bois; une activité que Florence exerce dans le son quartier à Xwlacodji. Dans le but d’agrandir son stock de charbon et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Florence contracta son premier prêt à ALIDé en 2007. Cette expérience de prêt a été fructueuse à Florence et récemment, elle a débuté aussi la vente de boisson liqueur produit localement.
Florence a déjà eu quatre crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de ses activités. Pour continuer à développer ses activités, Florence demande un cinquième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Florence A. was born around 1971 in Abomey, the historic capital of Benin. Florence is married to Julien Dossou, an auto mechanic by training who has switched to selling second-hand vehicles. Florence is the mother of three children, all in school, of whom the eldest is in seventh grade. The family lives in Xwlacodji, a shantytown in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. For 6 years, Florence has had a business selling charcoal; she runs this activity in her area in Xwlacodji. With the aim of enlarging her stock of charcoal and better satisfying her clientele, Florence took out her first loan through ALIDE (one of Kiva's field partners) in 2007. This loan experience was fruitful for Florence, and she recently began selling locally-produced alcoholic beverages. Florence has already obtained four loans through ALIDE, all of which she repaid without problems, and with which she was able to raise the level of her business. To continue developing her business activities, Florence is seeking a fifth loan to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 37 años y vive con su esposa, quien lo apoya mucho. Él es propietario de un motocarro, con el que se dedica al transporte de pasajeros por los distintos lugares de su zona. Este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 6 años atrás, pero también cuenta con una chacra donde tiene cultivadas 3 hectáreas de naranjas y mandarinas, por lo que cada fin de semana acude a cosechar sus productos para traerlos a vender al mercado de su localidad. Lo que le gusta a Víctor de sus trabajos es mantenerse activo y considera que le son rentables; porque en el caso de su labor como transportista, sus ganancias son diarias y en el caso de la fruta, casi siempre logra obtener un buen precio por sus productos. Para más adelante, Víctor quiere implementar un taller de mecánica, pues quiere demostrar las habilidades en el oficio que estudió. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a trabajar responsablemente con el apoyo de su banco comunal y a pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un aproximado de 200 soles en repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro, pues está presentando algunas fallas mecánicas. Con lo restante adquirirá materiales de construcción para hacer algunas mejoras a su casa.

loans.use: Reparación de su motocarro

loans.name: Oumou Khaïry

texts.fr: 36 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, Oumou Khaïry B. est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE CENTRE depuis 1 an et demi. Elle vend du poisson frais au niveau du marché de son quartier et les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent d'assurer la prise en charge partielle des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
A 36-year-old mother with three children, Oumou Khaïry B. has been a member of Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE CENTRE for 1½ years.  She sells fresh fish at the market in her area. And the profits she earns allow her to ensure that some of her family's needs are met. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her small business

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
T. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of his daughters, 10 and 7, attend a local secondary school, while T. and his wife operate a clothing retail business. He began his business in 2005 by renting a stall at a local market. Since then, the business profits have enabled him to pay for his children’s tuition fees and have improved the entire family’s quality of life. He hopes to one day open his own clothing shop so that he can increase his customer base and his profits. T. is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase and import clothing products from China.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase and import clothing products from China

loans.name: Bautista

texts.es:
La señora Bautista  es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Nueva”, en el Distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años, de estado civil casada,  tiene 02 hijos quienes están estudiando,  ella tiene  estudios de secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3años, se dedica a  la compra y venta de ropa para niños, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 con el que compró pantalones y casacas. Esta actividad no es diaria por ello también se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores y agricultura de autoconsumo.

Ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos Soles, con ello piensa comprar ropa  y zapatillas para niños.

Indica que su  Banco Comunal le ayudó a superarse como persona y a mejorar su negocio.

Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos estudien para que sean profesionales, hace poco les compró una computadora para que les ayude en sus estudios y no se sientan marginados por los estudiantes de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Ms. Bautista is a member of the Banco Comunal “Ciudad Nueva” in the Pilcuyo District of the El Collao Province – Dept. of Puno. She is 39-years old and is in a civil union. She has two children who are students and Ms. Bautista has completed secondary school. She has been working for the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 3-years and has dedicated herself to buying and selling childrens' clothes. Her first loan was for S./ 300.00 of which she used to purchase pants and jackets. This is not a daily activity for her as she also attends to farm animals and share-cropping. Ms. Bautista requests a loan for S/1000.00, so that she can purchase a stock of clothes and shoes for children. She says her Banco Communal has helped her overcome things personally and with her business. Her great desire is for her children study and become great professionals. She recently purchased a computer to help her kids with their studies and doesn’t want them to fall behind other kids in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothes and shoes

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en: Ritah is 34 years old and lives in Wbira Zone, Kyotera. She is married and has three children. Ritah has a beauty salon business located in Kyotera along Bukoba Main Road, next to Serona Hotel in Rakai District. The name of her salon is New Friends Pub and Bridal Centre and she has been operating this business for over six years. She is using the loan to purchase more plastic chairs and salon items for her salon business. Her future plans and hopes are to build and expand on the business for much better profits.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic chairs and salon items

loans.name: Analive

texts.es:
Analive V. Quirós es una señora de 66 años de edad quien vive  en una  comunidad llamada Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semimontañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con una gran oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio.

Desde hace 40 años que doña Analive inició un negocio de confección de ropa. Ella elabora diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir  específicamente ropa interior femenina, además comenta que da clases de costura a algunas mujeres de su comunidad. Ella  vende su mercadería en negocios de la comunidad o incluso la llegan a buscarla a su casa. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que su condición de vida haya mejorado mucho. 

Actualmente doña Analive requiere un préstamo de ¢675.000 (seiscientos setenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar materiales como telas, hilos, elásticos, accesorios  etc. Con esta inversión espera poder incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad de los  productos. Afirma que gracias a este préstamo podrá ofrecer más y mejores opciones para sus clientes actuales y potenciales.

Doña Analive es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Analive V. Q. is 66 years old and lives in a community called Canalete, located in Upala in the province of Alajuela. It is a somewhat mountainous place and its economic activities mostly center around agriculture and livestock. It is a community with a great opportunity for development and the establishment of small companies, agroindustry as much as commercial trade. 40 years ago, Analive started up a clothing business. She makes different types of garments, specifically underwear for women. Additionally, she tells us the she gives sewing classes to a few women in her community. She sells her merchandise in businesses in her community, and people even come to her house to look for her. Her small company has greatly helped improve her quality of life. Currently, Analive requires a loan of 675,000 colones to purchase materials like fabric, thread, elastic, accessories, etc. With this investment she hopes to be able to increase her production and improve the quality of the products. She is sure that thanks to this loan, she will be able to offer more and better options to her current and potential clients. Analive is a partner of the Empresa de Credito Comunal Canalete, one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and with it she hopes to continue growing on a personal and economic level, aside from participating actively in her community's credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of materials to make clothing

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Brillantes” Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 46 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 01  que aun depende de ella.

Rosario, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 200.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Rosario, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Rosario belongs to the Mujeres Brillantes Communal Bank in the Moyabamba district, Moyabamba province, department of San Martín. She is 46, single, and has two children. One child is still dependent upon her. Rosario is a fighter and a hard-working woman. She decided to set up her own business selling carbonated drinks. It is in a very well equipped area in her own house. She runs the business without having a schedule or a boss. She tells us that she started with 200 PEN; she bought five packages of soft drinks. She saw that it went very well for her, so, little by little, she invested more. She currently continues with the same business. She is well known by her customers, who are her neighbors, relatives, and friends. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy more drinks like packs of soft drinks in different flavors, sizes, and brands. She will also buy carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water. Rosario has lots of goals ahead, and she feels very motivated to be able to make her dreams come true. That is what she has made up her mind to do. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed it. She is responsible with her payments, and she plans to continue that way.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy packages of soft drinks

loans.name: Renelda

texts.en:
Renelda T. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Iligan City. She is 39 years old. Renelda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Renelda owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling a variety of kitchen utensils in the local community.  Renelda has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately $100 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Renelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Renelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Renelda is requesting new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
la señora Emperatriz M. C. tiene 55 años de edad, es soltera y vive con una nieta,  tiene casa propia y esta ubicada en la aldea el Caimito San Lorenzo.
Sus hijos viven en los estados unidos.
Emperatriz se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa desde hace 8 años, en estos momentos esta solicitando el credito para surtir su negocio con calzado, como ser tenis para educacion fisica, zapatos para la escuela y colegio.
esta es la epoca escolar y muchas personas compran zapatos y tenis nuevos para sus hijos, las ventas de calzado suben mucho y desea estar preparada para cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes. 
 
su mayor deseo es que su nieta se gradue de la universidad.
texts.en:
Emperatriz M. C., 55, is single and lives with a granddaughter. She has her own home located in the village of Caimito San Lorenzo. Her children live in the United States. Emperatriz has sold clothing for 8 years now. She is asking for funding to stock her business with shoes, in particular, athletic shoes for P.E. classes and school shoes. This is the beginning of a school term and many people buy new shoes and athletic shoes for their children. Shoe sales rise much and she wants to be prepared to cover all her customers' needs. Her greatest wish is that her granddaughter graduate from university.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Kayembe Women's Group, Rukungiri

texts.en: Adrine T., pictured at top left as well as in the group photo, is the leader of her lending group. She is a jolly and hard-working lady who has been running a business selling produce such as beans, maize and rice from the Rukungiri trading centre for eight years. She has a store where she keeps all her produce for sale and she hopes to expand this store so that it can hold more stock. Adrine is married with four children, all of whom are in school, and she works very hard to ensure that they attain the best education. She needs a loan to be able to buy more beans, maize and rice from the villagers and bring it to her store where her customers come.

loans.use: Buying more beans, maize and rice for resale.

loans.name: Alovidin

texts.en: S. Alovidin is married and has a little son. Alovidin works as a farmer everyday. He was educated until secondary school but he had to quit early because he couldn't afford to attend. Alovidin has a good work ethic and has whole-heartedly committed himself to agriculture. Thanks to his hard work, he has today become a man known for his determination and serves as an example and reference for other farmers. Alovidin has been growing vegetables and fruit for the past five years. He is now seeking a loan of 1,000 USD to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his crops in the hopes of being well prepared for the upcoming season so as to produce a good harvest at the end of the season. He can then better meet the needs of his family and improve his working conditions. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Neetha

texts.en:
Neetha is a 37-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura, Matara, with her husband, four children and her mother. The family consists of three sons and a daughter. Two sons are working while the other son is studying. Her daughter is married.

Neetha has a business selling vegetables from a shop in her town. Her brother is also a partner in her business. They started this business in 2005. When her brother goes to buy vegetables for the shop, she works in the shop.

Neetha has asked for a 60,000 Sri Lankan rupee loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to further develop the vegetable business. Neetha is honest and careful in her business. She hopes to provide a nutritious diet to her family through the additional income from the business.

loans.use: To improve a vegetable business

loans.name: Mwaminifu Group

texts.en:
Suma M., 43 and married with two children, ages 10 and 7, has operated a brick business since 2008. Working from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m., she is able to make a monthly profit of about $147. This will be Suma’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, the first having been used to buy more cement and sand and repaid promptly. She now hopes for a loan to buy still more sand and cement.

Suma will share this loan with her loan Group Mwaminifu, which totals 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture, Suma is in orange, second from left in the last row .

loans.use: To buy more cement and sand

loans.name: Cristo Viene Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group Cristo Viene (Christ is Coming), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the Samana peninsula, a lush, rugged isthmus with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with husband and four children.

Ana is excited to be taK. her fifth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling deodorants, creams, perfumes and makeup in her community. She will use the profits to invest in medicine and school supplies for the children, to add a room to her home, and to purchase a scooter to help her get around town. Her long term dream is to own a salon and to see her home fully constructed. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase deodorants, creams, perfumes, and makeup to sell.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité LA ALEGRIA se formó hace más de dos años mediante la gestión varias señoras y sigue unido mediante el apoyo de todas las integrantes que se encuentran  trabajando cada una realizando sus actividades.
Cada una de las señoras se encuentra con mucha esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida (Vivienda,  alimentación) mediante el trabajo que cada una realiza.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Avelina quien es peluquera, y trabaja desde su casa en un salón. Ella estudio esta profesión siendo joven y actualmente ya cuenta con muchas clientas. 
Ella esta muy conforme con su trabajo ya que mediante el puede mantener a su familia, alimentar especialmente.
Actualmente quiere mejorar su servicio y para ello desea comprar un sillón mas confortable para peluquería ya el mismo se usa para el lavado y otros mantenimientos para cabello.
Solicita el préstamo para concretar dicha idea y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
The Alegria (Happiness) group was formed more than two years ago by several women. They joined together to support one another. They met while working at their various jobs. Each group member is hopeful about improving the quality of her life especially in the areas of housing and nutrition. One of them is Sra. Avelina who is a hairdresser. She runs a salon in her home. As a young woman, she took a hairdressing course and now has many clients. She is very happy with what she does since it allows her to support her family and most importantly, provide them with food. Avelina now wants to improve the service she offers by buying a more comfortable hairdresser’s chair which can be used for hair washing and other hair treatments. She is asking for a loan to buy such a chair. She is grateful to Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya for this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a hairdresser's chair

loans.name: Ochirmunkh

texts.en: Ochirmunkh is 58 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His 21-year-old daughter graduated from university, and now she's helping the family’s business. His younger son is 12 years old and attends a local secondary school. In 2009, Ochirmunkh started selling bricks to local construction companies. From the beginning, the business has been doing well, with business capital increasing from 300,000 MNT (about $217) to 2.5 million MNT (about $1,800). Ochirmunkh dreams of owning a larger brick factory that can meet the needs of larger construction companies. He also hopes his son will achieve a high level of education. His family is the most important thing for him and he says, “as a father, I would like to be financially available to provide a good education and other necessary expenses for my children, and also I would like to expand my business and to purchase my own apartment or house for my family in the future." Ochirmunkh is now requesting a loan to purchase business equipment such as a brick machine.

loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Rejelyn

texts.en:
Rejelyn P. is from the village of Western Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old. Rejelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rejelyn owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Rejelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rejelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rejelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional food containers & working capital. Rejelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Rejelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Jeremae

texts.en: Jeremae V. is a 33-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Hacienda Purisima, Manapla, Negros Occidental. Jeremae has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 8,000. Jeremae is now borrowing Php 25,000 to add to her working capital. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jeremae aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but of thousands of women. Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua F. operates a mini-table provision shop at Elmina.  Efua has received a junior high education.  She is married and has six dependants. She has been selling provisions for 13 years now. She helps her husband to provide the basic needs of the children such as food, shelter and clothing. Her loan will be used to buy additional provisions to resell. She wishes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a bigger shop.

loans.use: To buy additional provisions to resell.

loans.name: Nerisa

texts.en: Nerisa L. is 55 and married with six children whose ages range from 13 to 35 years. She is starting a business to sell pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam). Nerisa needs a loan of 1,000 Samoan talas to buy flour, flavoring, sugar and plastic bags. She plans to use the earnings from her business, estimated to be 400 talas or $167 per week, to improve/expand the business. In 2010, Nerisa joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Nerisa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar and plastic bags

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte was born in 1969 and is married with six children aged between 5 and 16. Charlotte takes care of two dependents. The first one is 19 years old and the younger one is 13.  Charlotte is a businesswoman; her husband also has a business. Charlotte owns a small business which sells various products such as: cosmetics, cooking oil, and so on. This is her fourth year of successful operation in business! The hours of her shop are from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day except on Sunday.

Charlotte is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing an additional products for her shop. This expansion will make her more efficient and effective and more successful.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Aníbal está casado con la señora Fátima desde hace varios años, tienen 2 hijos menores que están cursando la escuela primaria.
Ellos trabajan en el micro centro, tienen un puesto donde venden ropas varias, además de su local. Aníbal trabaja como asalariado en un negocio.
Para que de esa manera puedan aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar a Fátima con los gastos del hogar.
El manifiesta que la única forma de crecimiento es a través de los créditos, porque le resulta muy difícil conseguir acumular el capital operativo, razón por el cual opta por este pedido para la compra de ropas como remeras, camisas, vestidos, pantalones y otros.
 El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que vaya a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
texts.en:
Aníbal has been married to Fátima for several year and they have two young children who attend elementary school. They work in the city center, where they have a point of sale, selling various types of clothing items. Aníbal works as a salaried employee in his business. In this way they can increase their profits and help Fátima with the household expenses. He believes that the only way he can grow his business is through these loans, because he finds it very difficult to accumulate the necessary working capital otherwise. This is his reason for requesting this loan to buy clothing items such as t-shirts, shirts, dresses, pants, and other things. He is a very responsible person with a great desire to succeed. He has a good jovial and entrepreneurial spirit and there is no doubt that he will reach all of his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es: Gaby, es una joven madre de familia, con todas las ganas de salir adelante, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. El negocio al que Gaby se dedica, es la venta de comida rápida, siendo papas y pollos fritos, platillo de mucha demanda en horas de la tarde. Su punto de venta, es en la puerta de su casa, donde va instalándose  a partir de las 6:00 de la tarde limpiando correctamente su establecimiento, para que pueda sus clientes sentirse cómodos mientras consumen estos platillos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo; es que puede ser independiente, por otro lado le da mucha satisfacción saber que sus ventas se duplican durante los fines de semana. Han transcurrido 3 años y considera que lo más difícil, es tener que trabajar en invierno; ya que se expone en la intemperie y eso perjudica su salud. Para en el futuro, planea diversificar su negocio, en la venta de ropa y construir su casa. Ingresa a su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, puesto que desea tener nuevos créditos y así mejorar su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará cervezas y gaseosas, ya que los fines de semana la gente de su barrio consumen mucho estas bebidas.
texts.en:
Gaby is a young mother who has the desire to succeed. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children. Gaby has a business selling fast foods, such as French fries and fried chicken, which are in great demand during the afternoon hours. Her vending post is set up on the doorstep of her house. She begins cleaning around 6pm so that her customers will be comfortable while eating their food. What she enjoys most about her work is the ability to be independent. In addition, she gets great satisfaction from knowing that she can double her sales on the weekends. Gaby has been in business for three years and considers the most difficult part to be working during the winter because she puts her health at risk by being out in the elements. In the future, she plans to build a house and diversify her business by selling clothing.

Gaby is requesting her first loan from MFP and promises to complete her payments on time. She wants to be eligible for subsequent loans so that she can continue improving her business. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy beer and sodas since her customers consume more of these beverages on the weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & beer

loans.name: Rosa Luisa

texts.es:
la señora Rosa Luisa B. M. tiene 49 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos que dependan de ella, vive con una nieta de un año, radica en la comunidad del Caimito desde hace 47 años y se dedica al comercio a realizado varios negocios como ser venta de golosinas, mariscos y actualmente vende ropa nueva, sandalias, zapatos, frijoles, maiz, arroz, azucar.
 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mas variedad de ropa, dentro de dos meses es la epoca de mas movimiento en ventas y quiere estar preparada para cuando llegue el momento.
Rosa nos comento sentirse muy feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo bien y que su nieta esta creciendo saludable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Luisa B. M. is 49 years old, single, and doesn’t have children that depend on her. She lives with her one-year-old granddaughter. She has lived in the community of Caimito for 47 years, and she pursues many businesses including selling sweets and seafood. At present, she sells clothing, sandals, shoes, beans, corn, rice, and sugar.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise, so that she will have a larger variety of clothing. The season of high sales is approaching, and she wants to be prepared. Rosa feels very happy that everything is going well and that her granddaughter is healthy.

loans.use: To buy jeans, t-shirts, shirts, sandals, shoes, beans, corns, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Samer is 38 years old and the married father of three children. Since 2009, he has been the owner of a shoe store. Samer used to own a restaurant, but he wanted to try another type of work and he found that it was a good decision to change. Samer is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to buy shoes for a new fall and winter collection. Samer’s clients are foreigners, relatives, neighbors and friends. He hopes to start selling clothes as well as shoes in the future.

loans.use: to buy shoes for a new fall and winter collection

loans.name: Zamira's Group

texts.en:
Zamira U. is 40, married. She is the leader of the group. Currently she has to raise 2 children by herself because her husband is working in Russia. Both of children are school pupils. Zamira supports her family financially by selling fruits and vegetables wholesale.  On the side she also sells household goods. With her profits, she has managed to increase the assortment and also start a poultry breeding business. In order to make house repairs, the family needs to get a loan. In future they are planning to arrange daughter’s marriage, then to build the kitchen. 

Zamira’s partners:

Ulugbek N. is 20 years old and is not married. He earns a living by working as a taxi-driver.  On the side he earns income from cattle breeding. The purpose of the loan is to purchase livestock animals for fattening and breeding. 

Gavharoi S. is 39 years old and is married. Her family has 3 children. The family is engaged in cultivating sunflowers and corn. On the side, the head of the family earns a living by reselling fruits and vegetables wholesale. The purpose of the loan is to purchase potato seeds. 

Ihvalai R. is 41 and married. She is the treasurer of the group. Together with her husband, they are raising a daughter. The family earns money by harvesting carrot, turnip and cotton. The purpose of the loan is to purchase potato seeds and prepare the ground for sowing. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to repair the house.

loans.name: Néstor De Jesús

texts.es: Néstor de Jesús C. C. de 54 años de edad  reside en el municipio de San Juan Opico, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como costurera, y así mismo vive junto a su pequeño nieto de 4 años de edad, el cual se encuentra a total cuidado de Néstor. Él es un hombre de familia muy responsable, quien trabaja comprando y vendiendo tarimas, las cuales son hechas de madera y que se utilizan para diversos eventos. Desde hace 5 años que Néstor se dedica a este trabajo, gracias al cual puede contar con todo lo necesario para salir adelante. Néstor solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el monto necesario para invertir en su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de tarimas y de esta forma mejorar su negocio y así mismo sus ganancias, las cuales sean de gran beneficio para su familia.
texts.en:
Néstor de Jesús C. C. is 54 years old and lives in the town of San Juan Opico, located in the department of La Libertad.  He lives with his wife, who works as a seamstress and their four year old grandson, who Nestor takes care of.  He is a very responsible family man.

He works buying and selling platforms made of wood that are used for many events.  He has done this work for five years and it has given him the necessities to get ahead.  

Néstor is asking for this loan in order to have the money to invest in his business, so he can buy a larger quantity of platforms.  This will improve his business and increase his income, which will benefit his family.

loans.use: Purchase platforms for his business

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Habil  Gilbert

texts.en:
Habil Gilbert A. is a man of 43 who is married to Halima and has nine children. He buys music discs and tapes in bulk and sells them in small quantities to his customers. He has been in this business for 20 years and he gets a monthly income of 10,000 shillings.


This will be Habil's fourth loan from KADET. He will buy music discs and tapes. Since it is the month of December, his sales will increase. With the income he is going to get, he plans to own a music shop in the future. 


In future, Habil wants to educate his children to university level and also provide them with basic needs like food, shelter and good clothing.

loans.use: To add more stock of Music Discs and Tapes

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet B. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Juliet is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns & operates a business baking & selling a variety of staple products including bread & sweet monay in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Ruth has a business selling clothes, which she has run for one year.
To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Ruth hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to own a house. Ruth is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Having attained elementary education, Emma S., 42, wants to achieve more in life, not just for herself but for her family as well. Emma lives in Baseco Port Area, Manila, along with her eight children. Three of her children are already working, four are living at home and one is in elementary grade.
Emma presently owns and manages a small store of accessories, electronic items, gift items, kitchen utensils and other items commonly used in household chores in Filipino homes. Her store is situated along Corazon Aquino Public Market in Baseco, Manila. She buys her items in bulk quantities and sells them piecemeal with minimum mark-up. Emma earns at least 10,000 PHP monthly from her business, which she uses to meet her family's needs and add to her present business capital.
Emma's current challenge is that the local government keeps transferring vendors' stores, including hers, from one place to another. She hopes this month the local government will settle them in a permanent location at the market. She also hopes that her business will continue to grow and that she will be able to send all her children all the way through college. To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP. She plans to use this loan to purchase additional items for her store. Emma believes that through this loan, she will be able to expand her inventory and increase her earning capacity.
As a CCT community partner*, Emma faithfully attends her weekly fellowship meetings where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God as a mother and as a micro-entrepreneur.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store

loans.name: Flomena Jepkoech

texts.en:
Flomena Jepkoech K. is a forty-two year old lady, married to Julius K. Serem, and together they have four children. Her husband is a carpenter, while Flomena operates a green grocery that offers fruits, vegetables and cereals for sale. They live in Iten on the outskirts of Eldoret town, and she runs her business in Iten market. She has been in this business for twelve years now and gets a monthly income of about $188.

This will be Flomena's 1st loan from KADET LTD, and with the loan she plans to buy assorted fruits, vegetables and cereals for resale. With the income she is going to get she wants to pay school fees for her children, and also to buy more cereals for resale. 

In the future she wants to open a wholesale shop in Iten town and also educate her children.

loans.use: To buy groceries like tomatoes, onions, green vegetables and cereals for resale

loans.name: Jovina

texts.es:
Jovina es una madre de familia de 62 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus cuatro hijos en el caserío Malingas ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace muchos años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino, Jovina cría su ganado en un corral ubicado en su domicilio cuando estos han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece a los vecinos de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura. 

Jovina desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar el desarrollo de su ganado y percibir mayores ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jovina is 62 years old and is the mother of a family. She lives with her husband and their four children in the village of Malingas, located in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone that is situated in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For many years Jovina has raised and sold sheep. She raises them in a corral at her home. When they have reached a good level of development, she offers them to neighbors in the area. She also works in agriculture.

Jovina wants to acquire balanced feed to improve the development of her animals and receive better earnings. To do this, she believed it would be convenient to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN.

loans.use: Acquire balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Muhudin

texts.en:
Muhudin is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school while the other is still too young. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

He has operated a real estate business for the past four years. His potential customers are tenants and others in the neighboring community. Muhudin faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. He hopes to expand his real estate business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase cement and blocks to renovate his rental houses. He decided to join Yehu because it offers sustainable financial services to small scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase cement and blocks to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is 30 years old and single.

Ma. Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase different stock.

Ma. Cristina has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items. Ma. Cristina also earns income as a dealer of AVON products. 

In the future, Ma. Cristina would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase different stock for her general store

loans.name: Kwewaayo Namukozi Women's Group-Mityana

texts.en: Leticia M., 49 years old, has been operating a general merchandise retail shop in Namukozi-Mityana for the last 26 years. The happily married mother of 4 credits determination, resolve and tenacity for the longevity of her business, which she began with savings from her commercial farming business. The business generates 50,000 UGX as weekly profit. Leticia says that she will use this loan to purchase more retail commodities to resell. In the group photo, 2 male group's member's faces are not seen so clearly so i marked them as unpictured. One lady too was not around when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Solema

texts.es: Solema, de 43 años, es una mujer humilde y muy sencilla. Vive junto a su esposo, con quien convive desde hace 25 años. Ambos tuvieron 7 hijos; pero solo viven con 6 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de San Antonio. Todas las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas ubicados a las afueras de su localidad, como es de costumbre se dirige con sus instrumentos de trabajo, ya que diariamente tiene que sacar la maleza que crece de entre sus cultivos. Sus principales productos son papa, arveja, maíz, habas y zanahoria, productos que comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde viaja en cada cosecha. Asimismo, como mujer del campo se dedica a la crianza de toros, los cuales compra para después engordarlos, llevando a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde los vende a un mayor precio, “crío un promedio de 3 a 4 ejemplares, donde gano S/. 200 soles como mínimo”, menciona. Su principal inconveniente son los gastos de alimentación y vestido de sus hijos, por los que continuará trabajando con más esfuerzo y ahínco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que le brindaron por tantos años. Solema, terminó el periodo de cosecha; por ello con el crédito solicitado comprará 2 toros, los cuales engordará y venderá a un mayor precio, y así tener capital de trabajo en el nuevo periodo de cosecha.
texts.en:
Solema, age 43, is a simple and humble woman. She and her husband have been together for 25 years. They have seven children, but only six live with them in the house they own in the village of San Antonio. Every morning Solema proceeds to her farmland located outside of town. Her daily routine involves carrying her work tools with her because she spends a great deal of time removing weeds that can negatively impact the growth of her crops. Her main products are potatoes, peas, corn, beans, and carrots. These products are sold at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, the place where she travels to after each harvest. In addition, Solema engages in raising bulls. After purchasing her animals, she fattens them before taking them to the city of Huancayo to be sold at a better price. “I raise three or four young bulls at a time and earn at least 200 PEN for each one,” says Solema. Her main challenge is being able to clothe her children and provide them with an education, so she continues to work with great effort and dedication.

Solema is a member of the Santa Rosa Communal Bank. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is grateful for the support that has been extended to her over the years. She just finished the harvest period, so she is requesting a loan to buy two bulls to fatten and sell at a better price. This will provide her with operating capital for the next harvest season.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 52 years old and is a married man. He has three children aged 23, 22 and 20. His wife works as a teacher. 

Romeo has been in the business of raising hogs for 20 years. He plans to use his loan to purchase pig feed, vitamins and other supplies. Romeo works hard to improve his business and earnings. He wants to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed, vitamins, and other supplies

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 32 years old, and she has six children who are 2 to 14 years old. All are in school except for the youngest. Beatha's husband is a motorcycle driver.

Beatja sells food stuffs such as maize, sorghum and beans. This business has enabled them to improve their standard of living and pay school fees for their children. She is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs such as maize, sorghum and beans. With the profits she plans to renovate her house. Her future plans are to open up a wholesale store.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 48-year-old mother blessed with three school-aged children. Elizabeth is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 4,000 per month. 

Elizabeth is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional breeding livestock and livestock feed. She has been raising hogs for almost three years.

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve this kind of business to raise more pigs and earn income to support the education of their children and to improve their living status. She hopes that she can take more loans from the Kiva lenders in order to strengthen the business she manages and give her children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional breeding pigs and feed

location.town: Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Carlos  Segundo

texts.es:
Carlos Segundo tiene 42 años, es soltero vive con los padres no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS,	 se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y construir una casa grande.

Le gusta hacer deporte especialmente correr por las mañanas.
texts.en:
Carlos Segundo is 42 years old.  He is single, and lives with his parents.  He has no children.

This group is called "UNIDOS VENCEREMOS" (United We Shall Overcome). It is located in La América, in Ventanas Canton. The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Carlos has been working in agriculture for a long time, especially corn and rice. He makes purchases monthly at Agrippa in Ventanas, and sells in the market in the same town.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers and manure. With the support of the loan he will be able to financially cover his needs. He faces challenges such as crop diseases.  His dream is to buy some land and to build a big house.

He likes to play sports, especially running in the mornings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 42 years old and married. She has been selling cosmetics for almost six years. For a year she also has had a retail shop where she sells different kinds of goods such as bread, sugar, milk, snacks, soft drinks and some cosmetics.

Each month Olivia makes about 4,000 PHP from her store and 5,000 PHP in cosmetics sales. Olivia is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, milk, and cosmetics for her store.

In the future Olivia hopes to maintain her business so that she can send her children through higher levels of education and sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, milk, and some cosmetics products for her store.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a married woman from Kyenjojo district. She is a Ugandan woman aged 39 who has owned a retail shop for 13 years and is also a farmer. A mother of six children, she dreams of educating her children and building a better house. She acquired her initial capital from operating a restaurant. Janet wants a loan to purchase sodas, beer, and salt to sell and to plough her land.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda and salt, and to plough land in preparation for the next season

loans.name: Henry B.'s Group

texts.en:
These eight teachers work in a primary school located in Bafodia village, near the township of Kabala, northern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 1987 to improve education in the community. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan. 

This is the first loan that the teachers of this school have received from SMT/Kiva lenders. The group has requested for a loan of SLL 7,200,000. With the help of this loan, these teachers are in a better position to buy or invest in something that their salary cannot let them do.

Henry is the leader of the group. He is 63 years old and was born in Kambalia. Henry is married and has eight children. He has requested for this loan in order to pay school fees for his children and to buy household furniture.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and to buy household furniture.

loans.name: Ngoy

texts.fr:
Client de 38 ans, marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 1 mois et 2 ans. A la fin de ses études universitaires, il se lance dans la vente des produits divers et manufacturés en 2006 pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
Ses ventes sont de 45.000 à 60.000frs par jour, il a su fidéliser ses clients en leur proposant des prix abordables et de la marchandise de qualité.
A l’octroi de ce nouveau prêt, il va acheter des cartons de margarine, de lait de l’huile, des cartons de savons de lessive et toilette, des conserves telles que sardines, corn bœuf, tomate et bidons d’huile.
Pour l’avenir il pense ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation et avec ses bénéfices, épargner et acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
This client is 38 years old, married and the father of two children, one month old and two years old. At the end of his university studies, he got into selling various manufactured products in 2006 to support his family. 

His sales are from 45,000 to 60,000 francs per day. He has been able to establish a client base by offering affordable prices and quality merchandise. Upon receiving this new loan, he is going to buy cartons of margarine, milk, detergents and toilet soap, and tinned foods such as sardines, corned beef, tomatoes, and tins of oil. 

In the future he intends to open a grocery store and with his profit, save to buy a plot of land for his children.

loans.use: to buy cartons of tomato paste, sacks of rice, and tins of oil.

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa, se dedica al cultivo de maíz e integra un mariachi, con el que brinda eventos por las noches, el cultivo lo realiza desde hace 20 años y la música la realiza con más anticipación, trabaja todos los días atendiendo sus dos actividades desde las 7:00am a 9:00pm.
El invertirá su préstamo en abono, tratamientos para plagas, los cuales aplicara en los cultivos, esto fortalecerá la plantación y la protegerá de posibles plagas, el propósito de José es mejorar su trabajo, para poder vivir con su esposa con una vida digna, en un hogar más seguro.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife.  He grows corn, and he is part of a mariachi group.  The group offers events for the evenings.  He has been farming for 20 years, and he performs music with advance notice.  He works every day tending to both of his businesses from 7:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. 

He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and treatments for pest infestations.  He will apply them to his crops, and this will strengthen his crops and protect them from possible pest infestations.  José’s intention is to improve his work in order to be able to live a decent life with his wife in a more secure home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and treatments for pest infestations.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Mike has been working hard to manage his brick-making, which sells bricks. 

To help expand his business, Mike has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy firewood for burning the bricks, and will help Mike to generate greater profits and pay medical and school fees and expenses. Mike hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a machine for bricks. 

Mike  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mike who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy firewood for burning the bricks.

loans.name: Bornice

texts.en:
Bornice is a mother of four aged between 19 and 14 years and all schooling. She is aged 43 and has been in dairy farming for the last 13 years in her home area in Litein, South Rift, Kenya. Her milk produce is sold locally. She currently employs one farmhand.

Bornice has made a first loan request with Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 60,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow at 30,000 KES and a chuff cutter at 30,000 KES, too. She expects her milk output to improve with the additional dairy cow and better feeding as a result of the availability of a chuff cutter.

She notes fluctuation in milk prices as the challenge.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit and buy a chuff cutter (for cutting fodder).

loans.name: Justino

texts.es: El señor Justino se dedica a la confección y  producción de deportivos de 2 piezas "buzos y chaquetas" en su taller  propio el cual se encuentra en su domicilio, se dedica a esta actividad hace  6 años,  vive junto a su esposa e hijos, su domicilio es propio ubicado en la zona periurbana de la ciudad en la zona sud de Cochabamba carretera antigua a Santa Cruz; el préstamo que solicita es para realizar la compra de material de trabajo "tela"  que comprara para la producción de poleras y otros pedidos;  el señor indica que el crédito le ayudara de gran manera para incrementar su producción, ya que tiene muchos pedidos que entregar, el es una persona muy trabajadora, su deseo es poder tener un taller mas grande contratar mano de obra y  entregar sus pedidos a los diferentes departamentos de Bolivia, se encuentra feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo.
texts.en:
Justino makes and produces two-piece track suits in his own shop located in his home.  He has been doing this work for six years.

He lives with his wife and children in his own home, located in the peri-urban area of the city in the southern part of Cochabamba, old highway to Santa Cruz.

The loan he is requesting is to buy work material--fabric--which he will buy to produce shirts and other orders.  He indicates that the loan will help him greatly increase his production, since he has many orders to deliver.

Justino is a very hardworking person.  He wants to be able to have a bigger workshop, hire help, and deliver his orders to different departments in Bolivia.  He is happy for the opportunity that is offered to him and grateful to the institution for the support.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 55 years old, married, and blessed with five children. To earn a living, he runs a taxi business. He has been in this business for six years.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has received training in business management skills, which has helped him to improve his business.

Philip has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to service his vehicle. He hopes to grow his business and to become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta, de 41 años es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Emiliano, desde hace 5 años. Ambos tienen una hija: Helen a la que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Quebrada imperial Acostambo.  Con un capital de trabajo de 2 mil soles, está mujer sale adelante por el futuro de su familia. Pues todos los viernes, viaja a la ciudad a comprar productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles y tiene buena acogida, ya que es la única tienda del anexo. Pero como el lugar donde vive es algo alejado. Aprovecha los viernes, cuando viaja a la feria; en vender sus animales, entre ovejas y cerdos. Los cuales enseba con mucho cuidado y dedicación. Ya que obtiene buenas ganancias en ellos. Además cuenta que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, su principal cultivo es de maca. Todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, se dirige a cuidar de sus sembríos pues, el producto es muy cotizado y tiene que cuidarlo con dedicación y esmero. Ahora planean sembrar nuevamente naca y están seguros que tendrán mucho éxito. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los puquiales” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP. Agradece el apoyo brindado en todo este tiempo y espera de un nuevo préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Modesta de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 5 kilos de semilla de maca, para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Modesta, 41, is a modest, hard-working woman.  She and her husband, Emiliano, have been together for 5 years and have a daughter, Helen.  The family lives in a house they own in the rural town of Quebrada.  With working capital of only 2,000 soles, Modesta is building a better future for her family.  She goes to town on Fridays to buy merchandise for her general store, the only one for miles around.  She goes on Fridays because there's a market in the town that day.  She buys her animals at the market--sheep and pigs, for example--animals that she raises with a lot of care and dedication because they are an important source of income for her.  She says that her husband is a farmer and his most important crop is maca.  Every morning, very early, he goes out to his fields to tend the crop, taking great care because maca is very valuable.  They are now planning another maca crop and they are sure it will be a big success.  Modesta belongs to the Los Puquiales community bank and this is her fifth MFP loan.  She is grateful for the help she has received from the bank in the past and expects that the new loan will help her meet her goals.  She is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.  She will use the loan to buy 5 kilos of maca seeds for her next crop.

loans.use: to buy 5 kilos of maca seeds for her farming business.

loans.name: Yeakpan

texts.en: Yeakpan is 30 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is single and has three children aged ten months and ten years old. One of her children is in school, while the younger two are not yet in school. All three of them live at home. For the past 18 years she has been selling fresh bonnie fish in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bonnie fish by the carton for her business. The main challenge in her business is storage/freezer room. She started this business with money given to her by her sister and she learned this business from her mother. She likes the way customers buy her products. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bonnie fish by the carton for her business.

loans.name: Cheikh Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh  vit au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 28 ans. C’est un tailleur célibataire qui évolue dans le secteur de la couture depuis 1992. C’est une activité qu’il a opté par amour et par vocation. Il est membre d’un guichet des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis septembre 2007. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs  prévu pour l’achat de tissus qu’il va confectionner pour les vendre.  Ses bénéfices lui permettront de pouvoir s’autofinancer dans l’avenir. Le développement de son activité lui permet de multiplier ses ateliers de couture.
texts.en: Mr. Cheikh is a 28-year-old, single man who lives in Senegal. A tailor by trade, he has been working in this industry since 1992. He chose this activity out of love and thinks of it as his calling. He became a member of a U-IMCEC branch in September 2007. He is seeking a loan of 100,000 francs to buy fabrics to make clothes for sale. The profits will allow him to self-finance in the future, and the expansion of his business will help him to set up additional sewing shops.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make clothes for sale

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
Yuliana is a 56-year-old seamstress and is married to David, a 57-year-old man. From their marriage, Yuliana and David have six children, they are: Hendrik, 35; Septini, 32; Bertin, 30 and Fortun, 28 - all married; Nona, 24 and Daniel, 22 both still studying at a university.

Yuliana has been involved in her seamstress business for about eight years; she decided to run the business in order to support her husband in generating more income for their family since her husband is only working odd jobs so the income generated is unstable. 

In a week, Yuliana can produce 3 to 5 garments, but particularly in December Yuliana always gets many orders from customers. Yuliana always works hard to complete the orders and she is grateful for the assistance of her children in completing the orders. 

Yuliana has an empty room to be rented but it should be renovated. She also plans to produce curtains but she should buy the fabric as the basic material. Unfortunately, Yuliana does not have enough capital to do so. She is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000 to purchase fabric for her business and building material such as cement, sand, etc. Yuliana is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for her business and building material such as cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, oil and firewood.

loans.name: Alvaro Marcelo

texts.es:
Alvaro Marcelo tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive solo en san Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad,  se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantón San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.

Álvaro se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura como fuente de ingresos lo que más produce es el maíz.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Miguel. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, semillas, insecticidas, líquidos para la maleza y poder culminar los estudios.

El sueño es poder culminar los estudios y llegar hacer profesional para poder trabajar.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir y practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Alvaro Marcelo is 21, single and has no children.  He lives alone in San Miguel in the province of Bolívar.

His communal bank "Yagui Chico" is named after the community which is 20 minutes from the San Miguel Canton and the members have agriculture as their source of income for the families.

Alvaro earns a living through agriculture and grows corn mainly.  He buys and sells in San Miguel.  He is requesting a loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, seeds, insecticides and weed killer, as well as to finish his education.  His dream is to finish his studies and become a professional so he can get a job.

He has not had any problem of any kind.  In his free time he enjoys going out and being active in sports.

loans.use: To buy supplies, fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and weed killer, and to finish his education.

loans.name: Lucelly

texts.es: La señora Lucelly ha sido una trabajadora toda su vida para sacar adelante su familia. Lastimosamente su esposo la dejó, por lo que hoy es una madre soltera cabeza de familia. La inspiración de Lucelly es su hija de 28 años, que sufre de parálisis cerebral y por la que cada día tiene que trabajar arduamente, pues no posee apoyo de ninguna otra persona. Lucelly tiene a su tienda como la alternativa para generar los ingresos de su hogar, por lo que siempre sueña con poder incrementar sus ventas y hacer su tienda atractiva para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucelly has been a hard-worker all of her life in order to get her family ahead. Unfortunately, her husband left her.  Therefore she is now a single mother and the head of the family.

Lucelly’s 28 year old daughter, who suffers from cerebral palsy, is her inspiration.  Lucelly has to work arduously every day for her because she does not have help from anyone else.

Lucelly chose her store as the way to generate income for her household.  She always dreams of being able to increase her sales and of making her store attractive to her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a thirty four year old married man with eight children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for one year, despite the challenges of limited capital to meet the high demands. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business dream is a wholesale shop. Charles needs the loan facility to buy soap and salt to sell.
