loans.use: to buy soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Tipansi Group

texts.en:
Chrissy is 65 years old. She is married with 4 children that depend on her. Her husband is a farmer.

Chrissy sells cloth for a living. She started her business to financially support her husband in paying for household bills. She has requested for this loan to buy more rolls of cloth to sell. The profits from the business will help her to buy food, pay for medical bills and buy household necessities. A family member helps with the running of the business.

Chrissy operates her business on an open ground and she hopes to build a shop where she will be operating her cloth business. She also hopes to open a grocery business in future.

loans.use: to buy more cloths to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is 50 years old and a mother of two. She operates a gift/jewelry shop in the Central Business District of the city. In addition, she retails also imported perfumes. Owing to the shop\'s location, she enjoys a high patronage from the public .She has gone through the TEACH learning sessions of KRABAN and is poised to seek KIVA\'s assistance to capitalize her operations.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Beatrice would like to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en:
Mirian is a single mother of two young children. She is 35 years and lives with her grandmother. She runs a small convenience store that earns her the income she needs to feed her children and cover there health and education expenses. She has been developing her business for seven years and has had to sacrifice a lot to raise her children, but her sales have been reduced and small businesses like hers cannot compete with the supermarkets that offer a better price and a wider selection. She needs a loan to add more supplies to her store and generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunter

Mirian es madre soltera de dos niños pequeños, tiene 35 años, vive con su abuela . Tiene una pequeña despensa la cual le genera ingresos con los que puede afrontar los gastos de educación, alimentación y salud de sus hijos. Hace 7 años que desarrolla la misma actividad y comenta que con mucho sacrificio está criando a sus hijos debido a que las ventas son muy reducidas y los pequeños negocios como el suyo no pueden hacer competencia a los supermercados que ofrecen mejor precio y más variedad. Necesita de un préstamo para surtir mejor su despensa y así generar más ingresos.

loans.use: Add more supplies to store

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio Q., father of 6 children and an artisan shoemaker by profession, has owned a sales stall in the Avenida Circunvalación for 8 years. He has been a Pro Mujer partner for 12 years. He is one of Pro Mujer's longest standing partners, and belongs to the communal association Villazón.

When he first started his business, Antonio worked in the street, covering his stall with a plastic tarp so he could work through inclement weather, all to support his large family.

At the present time Antonio owns a kiosk on the same street, where he is now better able to work.

Despite his success, he needs to inject capital into his business to be able to buy a motorized sander to use in his kiosk. The sander would allow him to meet his client demand and thereby increase his income, which is important now that his children are growing and their needs are greater.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Antonio Q., padre de 6 hijos y de profesión Artesano Zapatero, hace más de 8 años tiene su puesto en la Av. Circunvalación. Socio de Pro Mujer hace más de 12 años, es uno de los más antiguos, y pertenece a la Asociación Comunal Villazón.

En sus inicios, Antonio trabajaba en la calle, instalando una carpa de plástico y expuesto a las inclemencias del tiempo, todo para poder llevar el sustento a su numerosa familia.

Actualmente Antonio es dueño de un Kiosco en la misma avenida, donde puede desarrollar de mejor forma su trabajo.

Pese a todo, el necesita de una inyección de capital para poder adquirir un motor de lijar, para implementar en su kiosco, de esta manera hacer frente a la demanda de los clientes y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos, ya que sus hijos van creciendo y sus necesidades son mayores.

loans.use: He needs capital with which to buy a motorized sander to use in the kiosk where he makes shoes. The sander will allow him to meet client demand and increase his income, which in turn will help him support his 6 growing children.

loans.name: Santa Martina

texts.es:
Santa Martina C. Z. is from the city of Bluefields. She is 45 years old and is married to Kuen Yan, who is from China and is 65 years old. They have 4 children who are all adults, married, and no longer live with them. Mrs. C. administers the business, which consists of making noodles and chop suey and selling them in bags. This business is familiar to both Mrs. C. and to Kuen Yan, but due to his age, he doesn’t work. Therefore, all the responsibility falls on Mrs. C., who has learned from her husband how to prepare the noodles and chop suey.

The advantage of this business is that they have more than 30 years of experience in it, and for more than 20 years Mr. Yan has been transmitting his knowledge to his wife, Martina C.. The quality of the product is well known in this city where people of Chinese origin enjoy prestige from making this food. Their clients are the many families that buy this product for their own consumption, and also restaurants that buy it for re-sale.

Each hundred pound sack of flour costs $27.00, each bucket of cooking oil costs $22.00, each box of eggs costs $3.00, and each sack of charcoal costs $4.00.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Santa Martina C. Z. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 45 años de edad, es casada con el señor Kuen Yan de origen chino y quien tiene 65 años de edad. Ambos tienen 4 hijos todos adultos y casados, los 4 hijos viven aparte de la pareja. La señora C. administra el negocio que consiste en preparar tallarines y chopsuei y venderlos en bolsas. Este negocio es familiar tanto de la señora C. Z. como de su marido Kuen Yan, pero por su edad este no trabaja por lo que toda la responsabilidad recae en ella quien a aprendido de su marido a preparar tallarines y chop suey. La ventaja del negocio es que cuentan con una experiencia de mas de 30 años y de estos por mas de 20 años le a estado transmitiendo el señor Yan a su esposa Martina C.. La calidad del producto es conocida en esta ciudad en donde las personas de origen chino gozan de prestigio en la elaboracion de este producto. Sus clientes son muchas familias que compran este producto para autoconsumo y tambien restaurantes que lo compran para su venta. Cada quintal de harina se compra en 27 dolares, cada balde de aceite se compra en 22 dolares, cada cajilla de huevo se compra en 3 dolares y cada saco de carbon cuesta 4 dolares.

loans.use: To buy 5 one hundred-pound sacks of flour, 5 buckets of cooking oil, 5 boxes of eggs, and 5 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Vasile

texts.en: Vasile G. has just over one and a half hectares of agricultural land and an additional half hectare of vineyard. He has a annual harvest of up to 2 tons of grapes which he sells to local wineries. He also grows wheat and corn which he uses as animal feed. Vasile works his agricultural business in his free time in order to supplement the income from his regular job as a technician at the mayor’s office. Unfortunately he does not have his own equipment and he has to pay someone else in the village to cultivate his fields. Vasile would like a loan to buy wheat seeds and to pay for tilling so he can prepare his fields for seeding.

loans.use: seed purchase and plowing expenses

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga belongs to the Lideres Triunfadoras (Winning Leaders) Communal Bank. She lives at Jr. 3 D. Febrero Mz. G Lt. 3 in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 52-years-old, and is the mother of 6 children, who are all adults. Her husband is a merchant, but his income isn't enough to cover all of their home's expenses. This is why Olga, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a small grocery store.

Presently, Olga gets up very early to open her store, to which she attends with her children and husband. With this loan of 1,800 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, a large box of milk, a packet of oil, a box of noodles, and 6 crates of eggs.

Olga is a very charismatic person and feels very happy because her store is growing thanks to the growth from her loan. Through the efforts she puts forth as a mother, woman, and wife, she also feels proud of supporting the well-being of her family thanks to Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Olga pertenece al Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras, vive en el Jr. 3 D. Febrero Mz. G Lt. 3 del distrito Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años D. edad, es madre D. 6 hijos, todos mayores D. edad, su esposo es comerciante, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Olga, con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos deciD. invertir en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad ella se levanta muy temprano para abrir su bodega, que atienD. junto con sus hijos y esposo. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1.800, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará un saco D. arroz, un saco D. azúcar, una caja D. leche granD., un paquete D. aceite, una caja D. fideos, seis jabas D. huevos.

Olga, es una persona muy carismática y se siente muy feliz que su bodega crezca gracias al incremento D. su préstamo, a su esfuerzo que realiza como madre, mujer y esposa, también se siente orgullosa D. aportar para el bienestar D. su familia y todo gracias a Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (rice, sugar, milk, oil, noodles, and eggs)

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en: Forty-five-year-old Alusine B. is married with five children.  He trades foods such as rice, millet, and peanuts.  He purchases them from the villages and sells them wholesale and retail in Kabala town, in Sierra Leone.  With his previous loans, Alusine was able to generate enough profit for his family expenses.  He still plans to expand the business and is therefore requesting another loan for more capital.

loans.use: He would like to increase his business of selling food staple items on wholesale.

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Mr. Teymur is a 36-year-old farmer, married, and a local resident of Saatli. He breeds cattle with his wife (she is shown in the picture). They have been engaged in this business for 10 years. He raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. He also sells milk and other dairy products. He wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. He is applying to Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $500.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Ciriaco

texts.es:
Ciriaco lives with his wife and two children, ages 14 and 16, at #479 3rd Ave. in the Puerto Mejillones zone of El Alto. His wife works in trade, buying and selling cheeses. Ciriaco is a seamstress. He hand sews sports jerseys and shirts and delivers them to local factory.

The requested loan will be used for purchase construction materials to repair the kitchen and bedrooms of his home. After three months of extraordinarily heavy rain the home is completely damaged and is in urgent need of repair.

This is the first loan requested from IMPRO. The family was evaluated and approved for the loan. Ciriaco has sufficient earnings to cover both his family’s expenses and the monthly payments on the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Ciriaco vive en la avenida 3 # 479 de la zona Puerto Mejillones ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposa a sus dos hijos de 16 y 14 años, su esposa se dedica al comercio de queso ( compra y venta).

Es confeccionista en mano de obra de buzos deportivos y camisas los cuales entrega a una fabrica que esta ubicada en la zona.

El crédito lo destinara a la compra de materiales de construcción para la refacción de una cocina y sus dependencias, la cual por motivo de las lluvias tan fuertes durante los últimos tres meses, está completamente dañada y necesita urgentemente una reparación total.

Es el primer crédito con IMPRO y la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Tiene ingresos suficientes para efectuar los pagos mensuales y sus gastos familiares.

loans.use: Repair of the home and kitchen which was severely damaged by heavy rains.

loans.name: Salma's Usagara Muheza Group

texts.en:
Salma is 40 years old and is married with 7 children, aged 13-25. Salma owns a small shop, which she started in 2001. She works every day from 9 am to 5 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (sugar, kerosene, rice, cooking oil) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Somoe, who owns a shop.

loans.use: To buy more items (sugar, rice, kerosene, cooking oil) for her shop

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice O. is 60 years old, married, and has 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria, and earns income selling table water. Beatrice learnt the business from a friend for 3 months, and currently needs a loan of US$1,125 to buy more water for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of table water for sale

loans.name: Tatimalap Group

texts.en:
Fatu is an honest Kiva client and the Tatinalap group leader. She completed repayment of her previous loan and is very grateful to Kiva for expanding her business. With her previous loan, she was able to purchase a truck of firewood and that increased her income. Because of the business expansion, her husband is able to assist in selling and splitting the wood; thus keeping him busy.

Marie S. owns a small, local restaurant. Pusshe Kabbia sells cotton materials in the Makeni market. The group members are requesting for a loan of Le.3000000 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To increase stock of fire wood, clothes and food ingredients

loans.name: Sikujua

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Sikujua L.. She is married and has two children, aged 7 and 9. She has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans. In 2000, Sikujua established her used clothing business. Working six days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $50 every month from this business. Sikujua has already received and successfully repaid three loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more used clothes. She thanks you for your support.

Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because they are so cheap and because of the general appeal of anything western or modern. Many people argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress; however, the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John A. A. sells groceries and frozen meat. He is married, but his wife's income is not sufficient for John and his 4 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business

loans.name: Samiha

texts.en: Samiha A., 49 years old and single, lives with her elderly mother in a village in the Northern Bekaa Valley. Samiha owns a grocery shop, her only source of income, and is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more merchandise so as to be able to offer a larger choice of products to her regular clients. This is Samiha’s first loan request from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is a wife of Mr. S. and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has lived in this town for the last 20 years and is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Her younger son and a daughter are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Bashiran baji's husband makes plastic shopping bags. He has been in this business for the last 20 years. Bashiran baji's oldest three sons all help their father. Bashiran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy materials so that her husband can make more plastic bags and earn a good profit.

She is joined in her loan group by several other people. Musarat baji wants a loan to buy goats for her meat-selling business. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy another game for her video game shop. Mairaj baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy plastic beans to make shopping bags

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.en:
In this loan there are five women from the larger group "Shalom" who are applying for a loan. Each woman has tasted a little success in her business, and wants to continue to increase its size. Gloria is the representative of the group, and has three children she has to care for by herself. She is a very diligent worker and has always made her loan payments on time. She has a small food market where she sells a variety of products. She hopes to continue growing and open a larger store soon. She finally feels like she can take care of her children, but now she dreams of providing them a happy, healthy, and comfortable life. She is very dedicated to her children and wants nothing more in the world than for them to succeed. She would love to send her children to college so they can have a better life, and get out of their cycle of poverty.

On behalf of Gloria, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Buy products for small market

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es: Leoncio tiene 30 años, vive con sus padres. Desde su niñez ha estado dedicado a la agricultura, con años de esfuerzo y ahorro pudo adquirir una camioneta, la cual es ahora su actual herramienta de trabajo, con la ofrece el servicio de carga de sacos de abono, fertilizantes, urea y demás productos agrícolas y transportarlos a las tierras de cultivo. Este servicio que Leoncio proporciona es ahora indispensable para sus propios vecinos que siempre lo solicitan, esto lo anima a seguir con sus planes de implementar mejoras en su negocio, aunque él no ha dejado de dedicarse a sembrar sus tierras de cultivo. Es la primera vez que Leoncio solicita un préstamo en MFP, se compromete ser responsable en sus cuentas. Leoncio solicita esta cantidad para realizar un mantenimiento a su camioneta y también para la compra de fertilizantes para sembrar papa en una de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 30 years old and lives with his parents. Since childhood he has been a farmer. After years of effort and saving he has been able to buy a small truck, which is now his main source of work; he transports sacks of manure, fertilizers, urea and other agricultural products to the farming fields. This service that Leoncio provides in now essential to his neighbors which always request him. This inspires him to continue with his plans to improve his business, even though he himself has not stopped cultivating his own fields. This is Leoncio's first loan request at MFP and he promises to be responsible with his account. Leoncio is requesting these funds to do some maintenance on his truck and also purchase fertilizer for the planting of potatoes in one of his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of truck.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora María Auxiliadora C. originaria de la ciudad de Masaya donde reside actualmente, se dedica a su propio negocio de panadería teniendo las maquinarias necesarias para la elaboración de pan dulce y pan simple y luego que el pan está hecho, ella lo coloca en las vitrinas para su venta.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo requiere de inversión directa, ella hoy en día requiere el capital financiero para la compra de la materia prima como lo es la harina, la levadura, el azúcar y las bolsas plásticas para la elaboración del pan. Por esta razón ella espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así mejorar saliendo adelante en su negocio y llevando el sustento a su hogar de habitación en Masaya.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora C. is from the city of Masaya, where she still lives. She has her own bread shop and has the necessary machines for baking sweet bread and plain bread. After the bread is made, she puts it in her store's windows. As all developing businesses need direct investment, Maria now needs a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, yeast, sugar, and plastic bags for baking bread. Because of this, she hopes that her loan will be approved so she can continue improving her business and supporting her household in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for baking bread

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel F., 43 years old, is married and lives at Irasan, Roxas, Zamboanga del Norte. She had to find ways to earn a living, that’s why she began raising pigs with their neighborhood, and the sharing of profit upon sale was divided depending on their agreement, mostly 60:40 or 70:30.

With her desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own. Needing capital for piglets and feed, she decided to join Paglaum MPC. Fortunately, she was able to start up her business and still does it today. Now, she is requesting 5,000PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefits her family, aside from the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pigpen.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pig raising

loans.name: Khafiz

texts.en: Khafiz M. is a hard-working man who strives every day to provide for his wife and four children. He manages a grocery store where he sells many staples such as bread, juice, sweets, and other preserved foods. He started this business ten years ago with less than $100, Khafiz has attracted a strong base of customers who are impressed by his efforts to travel to neighboring cities to purchase valuable items. In order to purchase additional foodstuffs and increase his inventory, Khafiz is requesting a loan of $1200 USD.

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Enes

texts.en:
Enes has owned a small shop in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 2 years. She belongs to Majengo "A" street group loan (Group code 2001). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 125. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, improve her home, and pay school fees for her children.

Enes is married, and has eight children: ages 22, 19, 11, 10, 8, and one is only 4 months old.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Benk A Group

texts.en:
Enick has been a food seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 6 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 90. Daily she works at her business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Enick is 45 years old, married, and has seven children. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Edah and Lucia. Each woman has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Saeni

texts.en:
Saeni T., 59, is married with six children. She has two years of experience running her general shop. She sells to the general public/villagers and schools six days per week.

She's had one previous loan with Kiva's partner SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $150). SPBD loans are Saeni’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband helps with her business.

loans.use: Purchase goods for the shop such as snack foods, canned food, freezers and soft drinks

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida O. is 50 years old, married with two children and resides at Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer.

Nida grows orchids in her backyard both as a hobby and as a business. Now she wants to expand and buy a variety of orchid seedlings. Her loyal customers are her friends, relatives and neighbors. She wishes to give her family a better life someday.

loans.use: To buy a variety of orchid seedlings

loans.name: Pepita

texts.en:
Pepita A. is a farmer. She owns a small parcel of land and grows rice for her family. Her husband manages their farm. They work very hard to be able to provide the needs of their family. "We started farming a small hectare farm. Because it is small, we also have a small harvest. We have just finished harvesting our rice. Now we are starting to prepare the land for the next planting," she said.

She would like to ask a loan of  5000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to purchase 1 quart of herbicide and fertilizer.

CEVI is reaching a lot of farmers in the Philippines. CEVI provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase 1 quart of herbicide and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: El Naranjal Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Naranjal” es un grupo nuevo que esta integrado de quince  socios y representados por la señora Adela quien al igual que sus compañeros residen en el mismo barrio. El grupo conformado por  4 varones y 11 mujeres que se dedican a actividades como la venta de cerveza, plantas, pan, ropa y actividades de construcción de viviendas, trasporte publico y como empleados de diferentes empresas. La competencia en el rubro comercial es alto por lo que deben contar con un capital de apoyo para la compra de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas de trabajo que ayuden a genera una mayor ingreso y colaboren para el sustento de sus familias. La mayoría de los socios son nuevos en la modalidad de grupos solidarios pero saben como ser responsables ya que de ello depende el bien estar de sus hogares, es por esta razón que la fundación agrocapital les brinda un apoyo financiero.
texts.en:
The “El Naranjal” group is a new group that is comprised of 15 members. Mrs. Adela is the group’s representative. Mrs. Adela and her fellow members all live in the same neighborhood. There are four men and eleven women in the group who make a living doing various things like: selling beer, plants, bread, clothing and some who build houses, work in transportation, and others who work as employees at various businesses. There is a lot of competition, which is why they need to be able to count on some capital, so they can buy merchandise, supplies, and tools for work that will help them generate better incomes and help maintain their families. Most members are new at being in a solidarity group, but they know how to be responsible, since the wellbeing of their homes depends on this. This is why the Agrocapital Foundationoffers them financial support.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Facundo

texts.en:
Facundo G. is 75 years old, married and has eight older children. He works making clay bricks that are later baked in a firewood oven. These bricks are then used as the raw material for building houses. Facundo began working with his father from whom he learned the trade. He currently has one of the most renowned brick-making businesses in the area. He produces about 40,000 to 45,000 bricks per month. His success is due to the weather resistant, high quality bricks he makes.

Thanks to his work and constant effort, he has been able to build his own house and with his income cover the expenses of his children’s educations as well as household expenses. The credit he has applied for is for the repair of a bricklaying mill, which is used to mix clay and other raw materials to make bricks.

loans.use: Repair of brick mill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of goods, in bulk.

loans.name: Pauline Andeso

texts.en:
Pauline, married, is mother to three school-aged children.  She sells second-hand clothes at her kiosk in the neighborhood of Manyatta, outside of Kisumu, Kenya. She has been running her business for two years, and says that things are going well. She really wants to purchase some new clothes, for her business, with her loan proceeds (some imported items from Dubai). Her dream is to someday become a wholesaler so that she can sell in bulk to retailers in the area. She says that she has regular customers, but that her profit margins are small on the common, local goods that she currently has.  

In addition to running her business, Pauline takes care of three children who were orphaned when her sister passed away two years ago. She also works as a community health worker with K-MET, the field partner giving her the loan.  She works two days a week, visiting the sick, offering basic services, and running errands for those too sick to take care of themselves.  She also educates her peers about important health issues and best practices.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian P. is from the village of Pigsag-an in Cagayan de Oro City. She is 29 years old. Vivian is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Vivian owns and operates a food stall where she sell specialty foods and delicacies in the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Vivian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Vivian from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La señora Teodora es una cliente antigua D. la institución, tiene su anaquel D. dulces y golosinas en la Av. Camacho, zona central D. la ciudad D. La Paz. Vive en su casa con sus hijos que ya son independientes y le ayuda con los gastos D. casa. Es muy cariñosa con sus nietos y sigue velando por el bienestar D. sus hijos. Es una cliente muy responsable y muy puntual, el crédito será invertido en la compra D. chocolates "El Ceibo", que son producidos aqui en Bolivia, son muy agradables, y también comprará otras golosinas para el anaquel.

loans.use: INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA CHOCOLATES

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is engaged in vegetable planting and selling business.  She sells her own crops in the public market in their community.  She is 45 years old and still very diligent in making her business productive.  Her business has been her partner in providing the needs of their family and also in supporting the educational needs of her children.

At present, she is seeking for financial assistance from KIVA lenders to avail a loan of PHP15,000.00.  She believes that with their support, she could be able to maintain the needs of her vegetable farm like fertilizers and pesticides for the protection of the quality of their vegetables.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Lumuli A Jane Namuyiga Group

texts.en: Jane N. is forty-two years of age, a widow with three children schooling and she is also looking after one sibling schooling too. She is operating two business activities that is out-side catering and brick making for constructions. She has stayed in these businesses so far for seven years. She is using the loan to purchase necessary items to support her businesses that is serving utensils like plates, cups, flasks, sauce pans, etc for out side catering and more so paying the people helping her in brick making. She is a hardworking business woman whose hope is to prosper and become rich in life.

loans.use: To purchase necessary items to support her businesses that is serving utensils like plates, cups, flasks, sauce pans, etc for out side catering and more so paying the people helping her in brick making.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery es una socia dinámica y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 32 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, Nery se dedica a la venta de frutas de esta región en el mercado de Bellavista,  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la compra y venta de cacao. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Victoriosas” desde hace un año y seis meses, el primer préstamo que recibió de este banco fue de 300 soles, que fue utilizado en la compra de limones y naranjas.  Ahora Nery necesita un crédito de 1200 que será utilizado en la compra de diferentes frutas regionales. La meta de Nery es llegar a tener una tienda de abarrotes y seguir apoyando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Nery is a dynamic and optimistic member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 32 and has two minor children. Nery sells regional fruit in the Bellavista market. She has the support of her husband who buys and sells cacao. She has been part of the Las Victoriosas Communal bank for one year and six months. The first loan that she received from this bank was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy lemons and oranges. Now Nery needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy different regional fruit. Nery’s goal is to have a grocery store and to keep helping her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different regional fruit

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali has had his own business as a builder since 2007 and has five years of experience in this field. Two years after beginning his business, he has become well-known in this market and he is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy a fast car to facilitate his business travel.

loans.use: To buy a fast car for his business travel

loans.name: Jessenia Asuncion

texts.es:
Jessenia Z. es una de las  socias  del Banco Comunal de Jave Jireh en Portoviejo.  Las socias de éste banco son muy cristianas y dedicadas a sus trabajos.  Portoviejo es la capital provincial de Manabí en la costa de Ecuador.  La provincia es conocida por su  gastronomía (mariscos) y la Ruta del Sol con sus  hermosas playas. Este banco se caracteriza por sus socias muy puntuales con los pagos y  por la seriedad y responsabilidad de cada una de ellas.

Jessenia tiene 31 años vive con su padre un comerciante de verduras y su hermano que trabaja como chofer, ella se dedica  a la venta  por catálogo de perfumes, maquillajes y todo lo relacionado con cosméticos de la línea Yanbal  y también trabaja como ayudante de costura donde vende sus productos  a sus compañeras y clientes de su trabajo.

Este es el cuarto crédito al que aplica Jessenia y  lo que más le gusta es los servicios de educación que la Fundación imparte  en  temas de enfermedades como el cáncer que antes no sabía. Con el préstamo obtenido  va a comprar más productos  Yanbal como cremas, perfumes, sombras, labiales, y más cosméticos para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes de Manabí y de su localidad.
texts.en:
Jessenia Z. is one of the members of the community bank 'Jave Jireh' in Portoviejo. The members of this bank are strong Christians and dedicated to their work. Portoviejo is the provincial capital of Manabí on the coast of Ecuador. The province is known for its gastronomy (seafood) and the Ruta del Sol (route of the sun) with its beautiful beaches. This bank is distinguished by its members who are very punctual in their repayments, and the seriousness and responsibility with which they treat their loans. Jessenia is 31 years old and lives with her father, a vegetable vendor, and her brother, who works as a driver. Jessenia sells perfume, make-up and everything realated to cosmetics from the Yanbal range through a catalogue. She also works as a dressmaking assistant where she sells her products to her colleagues and clients. This is the fourth loan that Jessenia is applying for. What she likes most is the educational service that the Foundation provides, with information about topics such as cancer that she did not know about before. With the loan that she obtains she will buy more Yanbal products, including creams, perfumes, eyeshadow, lipsticks and more cosmetics to fulfill the orders of her clients in Manabí and the local area.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase creams, perfumes, eyeshadow, lipsticks and other cosmetics

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco K. is thirty-three years old. He is married to one wife and they have three children. He lives in Kinemba B Local Council One in Masaka Municipality. 

He has a grain and bean business which he has been operating for over four years. He is using his loan to expand the business, and to purchase items like maize, rice, cassava, and beans. In the future, he plans own a wholesale business and construct rental houses for income.

loans.use: To buy items like maize, rice, cassava, and beans

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina, Vive en la casa de su suegra, con su esposo y sus hijos, tiene tres hijos su actividad principal es la venta de abarrote en su puesto, con el credito ella comprara productos de primera necesidad, la Sra. Cristina es muy dinamica y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, La cliente se encuentra agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brinda.
texts.en:
Cristina likes in her mother-in-law's home with her husband and their three children. Her main activity is selling grocery items in her stand. She wants to use this loan to buy basic products to resell. Cristina is very dynamic and responsible with the payment of her installments. She’s very thankful for all the support she received from her field partner.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Jose Pedro

texts.es:
El señor José Pedro L. es padre de familia, tiene un hijo pequeño de edad que actualmente estudia.
Con un crédito anterior de FVP ha construido un cuarto, pero le falta los acabados del interior. Tiene el proyecto de realizarlo de un buen material para que sea más duradero.
El está solicitando un préstamo para esa mejora y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos que obtiene como guardia de seguridad.
Su deseo es que su familia tenga un mejor lugar donde vivir.
texts.en:
José is the father of a family and has one young son who is currently studying.

With the previous loan from FVP he has built a room, but he is missing the interior finishings. He want to do this in a good material so that it will be more durable.

He is requesting a loan for this home improvement and he plans to repay it with the income that he makes as a security guard.

His wish is that his family will have a better place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Interior finishing

loans.name: Cres

texts.en:
Cres D. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Cres is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Cres sells snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Cres has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cres joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cres is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cres from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Doris Maria

texts.es: Doris de 29 años de edad es madre soltera de un niño de 2 añitos de edad, cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá que cuida del niño cuando se va al trabajo, trabaja para la alcaldia del Coral Chontales desde hace un año como asistente del Alcalde, actualmente està estudiando su segundo año en la Universidad URACCAN, ella es una mujer responsable honesta y muy trabajadora,con este prestamo ella pretende repellar y hecharle el piso a una habitaciòn, para tener mejor comodidad en el hogar, el sueño es seguir estudiando y culminar sus estudios para brindarle las condiciones basicas a su hijo y ayudar a su familia en lo que mas pueda ya que son de escasos recursos econòmicos.
texts.en:
Doris is 29 years old and a single mother of a two year old child. She has the support of her mother, who looks after her son while she is at work. Doris is employed by the City of Coral Chontales and has worked as the assistant to the Mayor for the past year. She is currently in her second year as a student at URACCAN (The University of the Autonomous Regions of the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua). Doris is a responsible, honest, and hardworking woman.

With this loan she intends to install and seal a floor for a room in her home so that it will be more comfortable. Her dream is to continue her studies and complete her degree so that she can provide basic living conditions for her child and support her family. Doris tries to make the best that she can of her limited financial resources.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a floor in a room of her house

loans.name: Rebeca Group

texts.es:
The Rebeca Group is formed by three female entrepreneurs, Rebeca Rosalina L. E., María del Carmen S., and Ileana Angelica C..  The coordinator of the group is Señora Rebeca, she began her clothing and shoes sales 10 years ago. Rebeca is a strong woman who has supported her two children. She works fervently for them.  

Lleana sells fruits and pastries Monday through Friday and on the weekends she sells soup, a typical dish with yucca and beef called baho, and more.  María also sells cloths as well as tortillas, fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: Purchase clothes

loans.name: Gulzaran's Group

texts.en:
Gulzaran is 35-yrear old woman, married with five children. She lives in a city named Pakpattan, in Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrines.

Gulzaran is a very hardworking lady and values the hard working people. She packs the salt in salt bags and earns income. She collects the order from retailer who paid her Pak Rs. 5000 per month. Her income allows her to pay the education expenses of her children. Her family members and the people in community respect her a lot.

Her husband name is M. A. who deals with vegetables. He purchased the seasonal vegetables from vegetable markets and sells to the required customers and earns income. They both save a part of their income for their kids’ future. 

This is the third loan Gulzaran has had with Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She will be used to buy vegetables to enhance her husband’s vegetable selling business.

She has three other ladies in her loan group. Zarina wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. Jamila wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell. Rehana baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for selling

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann has a beauty salon where she makes a living selling hair extensions and providing lovely hair styles for her customers. With this business, she hopes to make more profits. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN50,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell.

loans.name: Rohina

texts.en: Rohina is the daughter of M. H.. She lives in the 15th district of Kabul and is married with four children. She wants to repair her house to be able to live comfortably. She has requested an individual loan of 40,000 AFN to buy construction materials. She says that she is confident that she will make all her repayments on time. She wants to thanks all lenders of Kiva and AFS in Afghanistan.

loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Prosperidad 2 Group

texts.en:
Mirelys is the coordinator of her group Prosperidad 2 (Prosperity), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, a large city known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and three children.

Mirelys is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza,  after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling cleaning products by purchasing products like clorox to sell in her community. She will use the profits to save towards continuing to grow her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy cleaning products.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama T. est une femme de 54 ans et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle a une ancienneté de 2 ans dans le Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE-SUD et a eu 4 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle fait un petit commerce de produits divers, elle vend des draps de friperie, de la pâte d'arachide, des produits de vaisselle et fait de l'élevage de poulets de chaire. Son crédit lui servira à mieux s'approvisionner en marchandise et de faire un élevage de 50 poulets. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Mariama T., 54, is the mother of 6 children, all under her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (borrowing group) of MONTAGNE-SUD for two years and has received four consecutive loans. She has a little business selling various items, used sheets, peanut butter, dishes, and raises chickens to sell for meat. Her loan will be used to add to her inventory and raise 50 chickens. She helps her husband support their family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop and expand her little income-generating businesses

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda E. is from the village of Marabulig 1. She is 45 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a specialized store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling beverages such as soft drinks and juices in the local community. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Luzviminda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the product range. This will be the fourth loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the product range

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el distrito de Zaña, un distrito conocido por sus danzas y tradiciones de raíces afroperuanas, se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella y su esposo cuentan con una mototaxi (motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transporte) con la cual brindan servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros desde hace mas de diez años. El encargado de manejar el vehículo es su esposo y diariamente recorre rutas en el pueblo de Zaña, el cercano distrito de Cayaltí y los anexos de la zona. Esta actividad es la unica fuente de ingresos con la que cuentan, por lo que siempre tratan de trabajar el mayor tiempo posible.

Precisamente, debido al continuo uso y al estado accidentado de los caminos de la zona, el vehículo ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, es por ello que Amelia ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de la unidad móvil, así como en la compra de diversos accesorios para equiparla.

Amelia es conocida en su vecindario por ser una persona tranquila y de confianza. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Amelia is 50 years old, married and lives with her husband and their three children in the Zaña district. This district is known for its Afro-Peruvian dances and traditions, and is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She and her husband have a mototaxi (a motorcycle with a transportation cabin attached) and have been offering a freight and passenger transport service for more than ten years. Her husband drives the vehicle and everyday he travels around the town of Zaña, the nearby district of Cayaltí and other neighbouring areas. This work is their only source of income, so they always try to work the longest possible hours. Therefore, due to the poor condition of the area's roads and the continuous use of the vehicle, it has begun to suffer a few mechanical faults which require urgent repair in order for it to run properly. This is why Amelia has requested a loan of $725 (2000 'nuevos soles') from Edpyme Alternativa, which she hopes to spend on the repair and maintenance of the mobile unit, as well as the purchase of various accessories for it. Amelia is known by her neighbours to be a quiet and trustworthy person. She has worked with our institution in the past and has shown that she is punctual and responsible when it comes to making payments.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs involved in repairing, maintaining and equipping a mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her farm and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia C. is from the village of Olango. She is 57 years old. Anatalia is widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Anatalia owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Anatalia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anatalia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anatalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Anatalia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Anatalia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Savali

texts.en:
Savali T. is 40 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Savali has 4 years of experience in this business.  Savali needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 700 talas or US $292 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Savali joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Savali's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Olivier

texts.en:
Olivier is 24 years old and he is still single.  Olivier owns a shop where he sells a variety of goods and this is his 3rd year in this business.  His shop is open from 6 am to 9 pm every day.

Although Olivier has owned a shop for about 3 years, his capital is still too low to expand meaningfully.  To remedy this, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, Olivier will expand his shop through adding a large quantity of foodstuffs mainly Irish potatoes, beans, rice, cooking oil, etc.  If successful, Olivier will hopefully increase his sales as well as profits which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business for a better financial stability.

loans.use: a variety of goods including foodstuffs

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PERLAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  Pelagia; tiene  50 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos  trabaja como comerciante minorista, ella compra al por mayor pollos para la venta, la socia necesita un capital de trabajo que le permita adquirir mayor números de pollos para incrementar su economía y ella solicita el préstamo para mejorar sus ganancias con la compra de mayor numero de pollos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de pollos. 

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Pelagia is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Perlas” (The Pearls), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 50 years old, married, and has three children. Pelagia works as an informal merchant, buying chickens in bulk for resale. She needs operating capital in order to acquire several chickens so that she can improve her finances. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy chickens.

Pelagia appreciates the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia Gracia R. es una mujer joven dedicada a la confección de blusas, ella ha trabajado en este oficio desde hace mucho tiempo, cuando en un principio solo contaba con  una máquina sencilla, mucho esfuerzo y el apoyo de su familia. Gradualmente logró adquirir su maquina plana y su fileteadora y así ha ido creciendo hasta lograr tener una infraestructura de taller que le genere utilidades, con la cual adquirir todo lo necesario para el sustento de sus 3 hijos de 4 meses, 7 y 9 años, por eso su sueño está en conseguir el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su taller para tener un futuro con mayor bienestar familiar y mejores oportunidades.

Con su credikiva que es el primero, comprará una  máquina collarín y una fileteadora, con ellas logrará mejorar la calidad, y los tiempos de producción además de disminuir los costos del proceso pues alquila estos servicios y debe pagar transporte para obtenerlos. En la actualidad su mayor desafío es responder a la producción que cada dia crece ,pues no tiene las maquinarias que ello le amerita y también el tiempo necesario para dedicarle a sus pequeños hijos, pero ella sabe que esta construyendo su futuro familiar  y justamente por eso trabaja fuertemente.
texts.en:
Alicia Gracia R. is a young woman whose work is making blouses. She has worked in this business for a long time. At the beginning she had only a simple sewing machine, a lot of energy, and the support of her family. Gradually she managed to acquire her flat-bed sewing machine and her serger, and thus she has continued growing her business until she had a workshop infrastructure that produced profits, with which she can acquire everything necessary to support her three children, of ages 4 months, 7, and 9. For this reason, her dream is to grow and strengthen her workshop in order to have a future with better well-being and more opportunities for her family. With her Kiva loan, which is her first, she will buy a collar machine and a serger. With them she will be able to improve the quality and time in production, in addition to decreasing the cost of production, since she hires these services and has to pay transportation to obtain them. Now her greatest challenge is keeping up with production, which grows every day, since she does not have the machines that her work requires or the time that she needs to dedicate to her little children. But she knows that she is building the family future, and this is precisely why she works hard.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a collar machine and a serger

loans.name: Santos Evelio

texts.es:
Santos Evelio de 35 años de edad, junto a su compañera de vida: Maria de los Angeles Zeledon, ama de casa,  tienen una niña de 8 añitos  de edad El Sr. S. O. labora para el CETA INATEC desde hace 2 años desempeñandose como Sub- Director, esto le ha permitido salir adelante.   
  
Este crédito lo requiere para reparar dos paredes de su casa ya que se encuentran sin repellar y comprar una puerta que se encuentra en malas condiciones.  

Su  mayor sueño en la vida es tener estabilidad laboral  ya que solamente es el sosten de la familia, que su hija estudie y poco a poco ir mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda con los crédito obtenidos por AFODENIC y KIVA.
texts.en:
Santos Evelio, age 35, along wiht his life companion: Maria de los Angeles Zeledon, housewife,  have a daughter 8 years of age.  Señor S. O. has worked for CETA INATEC as a sub-director for 2 years.  This has permitted him to do well.    
  
He requires this loan to repair two walls of his house which are without plaster and to buy a door to replace one that is in bad condition. 

His greatest dreams in life are to have stable work, since he is the only wage-earner in the family, to see his daughter go to school and little-by-little to improve the infrastructure of his dwelling with the loan obtained from AFODENIC and KIVA.

loans.use: To repair the walls in his house and buy a door

loans.name: Milka Jemutai

texts.en:
Milka Jemutai K. is a 39-year-old lady who is married to Elias Kiptoo Kimutai, a farmer. They are blessed with three children, aged 18 years, 13 years and 7 years respectively. They live in the rift areas of Kenya called Eldoret. 

Milka owns an open-air stall where she sells assorted household goods and utensils at a profit. She has been in this business for the past 13 years with an income of 3,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs.) per month.

Milka was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and she is applying for her fourth loan of Kshs. 60,000 with KADET LTD, after paying her previous loans successfully. With this loan, she plans to buy more utensils of different kinds.

She hopes to operate a wholesale version of the same business and in the future, to extend the same services to the city center.

loans.use: To buy more utensils

loans.name: Haethon's Group

texts.en:
Haethon R. is the leader of the group that carries her name. She is 41, married and has 2 children. Both of them attend school. The family produces income in different ways: the head of the family works at a mill and with the help of all family members runs a cattle breeding business. Haethon raises money by sewing national wares. Out of total earnings they have managed to make house repairs and also to arrange a daughter’s marriage. In order to increase cattle stock, the family is planning to purchase calves. They hope to get a loan for this purpose. In future their plans include developing the business and then bath-house building.

Haethon’s partners:

Manzurahon K., 49, married.  Her family has 3 children. Manzurahon earns her living by working as a nurse in the local hospital. In addition, her daughter supports the family financially by sewing women's clothes. The loan purpose is to purchase material for sewing clothes and curtains. 

Bakiyahon A., 49, married. Her family has 6 children. The family makes their living by growing cotton. In addition they breed cattle. The loan purpose is to purchase fodder for animals.  

Zuhrahon H. is the treasurer of the group. She is 52, married. The family is starting their own business. They just opened a shop and in order to purchase goods they need to get a loan. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Nancy Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Nancy B. es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto, vive en la comunidad de Cashapata que  pertenece a la parroquia de Zhidmad, en esta parroquia se puede encontrar la paz de la naturaleza debido a que se encuentra rodeada de vegetación natural, su gente en su mayoría se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos  de 12, 9, 7 y 6 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad. su esposo es de profesión albañil.

Doña Nancy se dedica a la venta de animales como son cerdos, cuyes y gallinas a  los que los vende en su propia comunidad, esta labor la realiza hace varios años y le ha permito ayudar a la economía de su hogar, pero tiene mucha dificultad en la compra del alimento para sus animales debido que es muy caro.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 5 años y fue su mamá quien la invito a formar parte de este grupo. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus animales y también va a comprar más cuyes. Su meta es poner una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Nancy B. is a member of the Banco Comunal 14 de Agosto (14th August Communal Bank). She lives in the community of Cashapata, located in the parish of Zhidmad. In this parish one feels in peace with nature, thanks to the natural vegetation that surrounds it, and its inhabitants engage mainly in breeding animals and in agriculture.

She is 28 years old, she is married and has 4 children aged 12, 9, and 6. All of her children attend a school in the community; her husband is a mason.
Nancy engages in selling animals such as pigs, “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig), and chickens, and she sells them in her own community.

She has been engaging in this activity for various years, and this has allowed her to help supporting the economy of her family, buy she finds it difficult to buy food for her animals because it is very expensive.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 5 years, and it was her mother who invited her to become a member of this group. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy food for her animals as well as more cuyes. Her goal is to establish a shop in her house.

loans.use: To buy cueys (Guinea pigs) and food for her animals.

loans.name: Sonak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sonak S. (in the photo with her loom) is a weaver. Her husband, Mr. Phoun Choun is also a weaver. The couple have been married since 2001 and have three children. Two of the children are in school and one is still too young to attend school. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

The weaving business is a traditional profession and Sonak wants to continue in this tradition. So Sonak is asking for her third loan of $100 to purchase weaving materials in order to continue her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Rinalyn

texts.en:
Rinalyn G. is from the village of Benhaan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Rinalyn is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Rinalyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and raising pigs for sale. Rinalyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rinalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rinalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise & sell in future. Rinalyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase pigfeed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rinalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase pigfeed & other supplies

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a farmer in Kisii town in western Kenya where he has been farming for the last twenty years. His mixed farm produces coffee, maize, beans and milk which are all sold locally. He also depends on his pension pay to meet the needs of his family.

He has requested this loan of 70,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help pay school fees for his children and improve the livelihood of his family. In five years' time, he hopes to have a cooling plant and to improve his milk production.

Stephen is 65 years old and married with five children who are all adults. One of his children is still attending school.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Mrs. Pol L. is a villager in Snuol Khpos village in Takeo province.  She is a 40-year-old widow with two children – one is attending a local public school and the younger one is 4 years old. 

Mrs. Pol L. is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family.   She is also a weaver. Since her weaving business is going well, she needs to expand.  To achieve this purpose, Mrs. Pol L. is requesting a loan to buy more silk.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Morelos Cristal Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en casa de la señora Reina V., un integrante del grupo Morelos Cristal, que esta ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz, en México, se ve al grupo de señoras alrededor del anafre de la señora Reina en la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta de tacos que inicio hace 7 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar un quemador e insumos para su negocio de antojitos. Sus comparñeros y clientes la conocen como una persona responsable y trabajadora. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente muy satisfecha ya que por medio de este préstamo podra incrementar sus ventas y clientes. Tiene 46 años, estudió hasta segundo de primaria, es madre soltera y tiene en 2 hijas. También espera que con este prestamo tenga más clientes y ser la mejor en su zona, y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This photo was taken in Reina V.'s house.  She is a member of the Morelos Cristal group, which is located in the state of Veracruz, in Mexico.  The group of women are around Reina's stove in the photo.  She has sold tacos for 7 years.  She is asking for a loan to buy a burner and supplies for her business selling snacks.  Her fellow members and her customers know her to be a responsible and hardworking person.  When she asked for this loan, she felt very satisfied, since through it she will increase her sales and customers.  She is 46 years old and went to school through the second grade.  She is a single mother and has two daughters.  She also hopes that with this loan, she will have more customers and will be the best in her area, and in this way will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a burner and supplies for her business selling snacks

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim A. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house in Kompong Tom province. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she grows rice crops from her own farmland. Her family has five children:  one of whom is already married and lives at home, while the other four are single. 

Yim A. will be using her loA. to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee. The loA. will provide her with A. additional new asset.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Besta

texts.en: Besta is currently in the business of selling simsim, fish and onions. She is 24 years old, married, and has 3 children, none of whom goes to school.  Besta asked for a loan to stock more simsim, fish and onions. She hopes to build a big house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more simsim (sesame seed), fish and onions.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a 40-year-old widow who supports her family by fishing and fish vending. She lives in Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,600. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase fishing net and more fish to sell. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Evelyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and more fish to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma M. is from the village of Mabuhay, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old, single and has 1 school-aged child. Alma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, buying and selling canned goods, junk food, breads,  shampoo, soap and candies in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk food and beverages. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Alma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, junk food and beverages

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El padre de Juan Carlos trabaja la agricultura en la producción de palos de aguacate para la comercialización, Juan Carlos desde hace 3 años comenzó aprender esta labor y su padre le cedió un espacio en el invernadero para que el inicie su propio negocio; es por esto que él quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para iniciar su negocio y así podrá construir un mejor futuro para él y su familia.
texts.en: Juan Carlos' father works in agriculture, producing avocados for market. Three years ago, Juan Carlos started to learn the trade and his father gave him some greenhouse space so he could start his own business. That is why he wants to buy the necessary materials to start his own business and thus build a better future for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marianita is 48 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Marianita has a food production business in the Philippines. Marianita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food production business.

Marianita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marianita would like to save enough money so she can build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old and married with one school-aged child. To make a living, Juvy owns a business making and selling honey from beehives extracted in her local community. Juvy has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Juvy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like sugar and honey. This will be the second loan taken out by Juvy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI an of accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like sugar and honey

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is aged 66 and a widowed mother of four adult children. She is a farmer from the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya, where she has been farming for over 30 years.
