She employs one farmhand and sells her produce of milk, coffee, tea, potatoes and maize to the local market. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to cater to the needs of her family.

Julia has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She believes that the extra income from this loan will improve her family's livelihood. She faces the challenges of diseases and low market prices for her products. She plans to expand her dairy farming in the future and also to venture into pig farming.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNITA DE BELEN CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cereales, venta de ovejas y crianza de cuyes, la socia vende los cereales en el mercado de Huancaro desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m y las ovejas y cuyes lo vende en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Ccorao,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de cereales y también ayuda a su esposo en el trabajo como minero. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para el trabajo de su esposo. 
                                                          
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the "Reynita de Belen Ccorao" community bank which is located in Ccorao district, in Cusco province and department.

Hilda is 30 years old, married, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her businesses selling cereals, selling sheep and raising guinea pigs.  Hilda sells her cereals in Huancaro market form 7.00am to 8.00pm and she sells her sheep and guinea pigs in the different street markets that take place in Ccorao district.  She would like to expand and improve her cereals business and also help her husband in his work as a miner.  She is requesting this loan to buy tools for her husband's work.

Hilda is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tools for her husband's work

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: La señora Georgina es propietaria de la tienda "El Baraton" ubicada en el corregimiento de Juan Mina. Con su  negocio que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia con la ayuda de su esposo, quien durante muchos años fue empleado de varias tiendas, pero siempre con la intención de tener algún dia el suyo propio y lo logró despues de unirse con la señora Georgina, cuando incrementó el deseo de independencia y  hace 4 años adquirieron con sus ahorros una pequeña tienda en el municipio de Galapa, en la cual les fue muy bien, pero como  sus planes eran lograr un punto de mayor venta, trasladandose se trasladaron al corregimiento de Juan Mina donde adquierieron la tienda que hoy tienen, compraron la vivienda a crédito pactando un plazo de 5 años para su cancelación total y hasta la fecha solo adeudan los 2 ultimos años. Los estados financieros de su tienda  muestran un margen de utilidad que le permite cubrir todos sus costos y gastos en forma amplia lo que le permite estar reinvirtiendo en el negocio en forma permanente. Sus  inventarios son adecuados para este tipo de negocio y su cartera la maneja con mucha precaución, por eso rota en forma ágil;  Su margen de rentabilidad le permite tener una buena capacidad de pago.  La microempresaria está aplicando a su primer credikiva con el cual  desea en general y tambiem aprovechar las capacitaciones y asesorias que otorga la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.
texts.en: Georgina owns the store “El Baraton” located in the parish of Juan Mina.  With her business, she has managed to get her family ahead. This is also  with the help of her husband, who for many years was employed at various stores, but always with the intention of one day having his own. He achieved it after uniting with Georgina, when his desire for independence increased. Four years ago they used their savings to acquire a small store in the municipality of Galapa, which went well for them. However, since their plans were to achieve a bigger sales point, they moved to the parish of Juan Mina, where they acquired the store that they have today.  They bought the house on credit, agreeing to a term of 5 years to make the complete payment. To date, they only owe the last two years.  The financial state of the store shows the profit margin that allows them to easily cover their costs and expenses, which allows them to permanently reinvest in their business. Her inventory is adequate for this type of business and since she manages her cash flow with caution, her product turnover runs smoothly. Her profit margin allows her to have a good capacity to pay. The micro-entrepreneur is requesting her first loan, which she wants in general, and also to take advantage of the trainings and support that the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation provides.

loans.use: to buy in greater bulk and of a certain variety, including food stuffs.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is a 28-year old married man with two children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years. Nickson has applied for his second loan with KADET Ltd., which he will use to buy farm supplies (wheat seeds and items for land preparation).

Nickson plans to use the profits generated from this loan to pay his children's school fees. He dreams of becoming a prominent farmer. Nickson is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more, notwithstanding his limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Las Delicias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS DELICIAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Delicia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de abarrotes, venta de comida, chofer, compra y venta de artefactos, venta de ropa interior.

La señora Delicia  indica que hace seis años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando a la  institución por intermedio de vecinas y amigas de su barrio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda que viene trabajando hace 18 años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de fideo, arroz, azúcar y aceite), las que comprarán de la ceja de El Alto y lo comercializará en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The lending group "Las Delicias" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Santiago II. The group is made up of 8 members and is directed by a board whose head is Delicia. The association members' businesses are varied and include: grocery store, food sales, driver, buying and selling artifacts, underwear sales.

Delicia has worked with Pro Mujer for 6 years, becoming involved with the institution through her neighbors and friends. Currently she has a store where she has been working for 18 years.

The loan that she will take out is to increase her capital by purchasing noodles, rice, sugar and oil, which she will buy in La Ceja, El Alto and will sell in her store. This work allows her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she enjoys the trainings.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a farmer in Eldoret, South Rift, Kenya. She has been in mixed farming for two years, producing milk and bananas and selling to the local market.  She has employed one farmhand. She is married, with two children aged 13 and 5 years.

Janet has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  Janet says the farming project will assist her in educating her children as well as providing food for the family. She aspires to be the best dairy farmer in her area.

Janet laments the low market prices for farm produce and the high costs of dairy feeds.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ofelia Mabel

texts.es:
Ofelia, se dedica a la venta D. frutas, tiene 3 hijas pero actualmente vive solo con una, la cual está casada y posee dos hijos, el negocio D. las frutas lo tiene desD. hace 10 años, viaja por los pueblos cercanos para ofrecer los productos.
Actualmente su negocio necesita una inversión D. frutas, por eso a través del préstamo obtendrá lo que necesita como manzanas, bananas, fresas, sandia, con esta compra ella podrá mejorar la disponibilidad D. frutas para los clientes y continuar vendiendo.
El propósito con el préstamo es abrir las puertas D. la institución para continuar recibiendo el apoyo financiero, además D. mejorar también su condición D. comerciante.
texts.en:
Ofelia sells fruit for a living. She has three daughters, but only one of them lives with her at the moment. The daughter who lives with her is married and has two children. Ofelia has been in the business of selling fruit for 10 years. She travels to nearby towns to offer her products.

Ofelia currently needs to invest in fruit for her business. For this reason, the loan she will obtain will enable her to buy what she needs such as apples, bananas, strawberries, and watermelons. With this purchase, she will improve her inventory of fruit for her customers and continue selling.

One reason for requesting this loan is to open doors with PADECOMSM so that she can continue receiving financial support. She will also improve her status as a merchant.

loans.use: to buy applies, bananas, strawberries, and watermelons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.es:
Martha María tiene 46 años de edad es soltera vive con los tres hijos  de veinte y dos dieciocho, y diecisiete años de edad en el Cantón de Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto la Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

Martha María se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprarse una casa y un carro.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con los hijos.
texts.en:
Martha María is 46 years old, single, and lives with her three children aged 22, 18 and 17, in Ventanas canton, in los Ríos province.

The 'Vencedores Unidos' community bank is located in Anchoveta, on the road to La Templanza, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Martha María is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys and sells her products in Comercial Peña.

Martha María is requesting this loan to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers and manure for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as pests and plant diseases.  Her dream is to buy a house and a car.

In her free time, Martha María enjoys going out for walks with her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is a father who has worked hard to give his four children a better life and an improved standard of living. As the fruit of his patience and sacrifices, most of their children have finished their studies and found good jobs. Now 49 years old, Arturo and his family live happily in a rural community, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been in this business for almost 33 years and usually earns a profit of P30,000 every harvest season.

At present, Arturo aims to increase their yields and income to satisfy their needs and save for future emergencies. He is requesting a loan of P30,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for an improved upcoming harvest, and to pay the labor costs involved in planting rice. Arturo hopes that in the future, he will improve the business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and to pay labor costs involved in planting rice.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo  y dos hijos de 14 y 15 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender ropa: short, faldas, pantalones, blusas, para damas, caballeros y niños, todos los días vende en el mercado, desde hace 8 años se dedica a este oficio.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para surtir su negocio y comprar más ropa: pantalones, camisas, blusas y de esa forma incrementara sus ganancias porque tendrá más variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
El sueño de Ana es, tener una mejor calidad de vida y vender más, ya que su familia depende de ella y darles lo necesario para que vivan bien.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and 2 children, ages 14 and 15. She has sold clothing: shorts, skirts, pants, and blouses for ladies, gentlemen and children in the public market every day for the last 8 years.

She needs this loan to buy more merchandise for her business, mainly additional clothes: pants, shirts and blouses. In this way, Ana hopes to increase her earnings by having more variety to offer her customers.

Ana's dream is to have a better quality of life and to sell more, since her family depends on her to provide their necessities so they can live well.

loans.use: to buy clothing: pants, shirts, and blouses to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is single. He has been selling charcoal for the last year. James would like a loan to add volume to the amount of charcoal he sells. This business has helped him solve several problems that he has encountered in his life. He will use the profits to reinvest in his business. In the future he would like to be able to solve all problems in a simple way.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Umut's Group

texts.en:
Umut is the leader of this group. She is 55 and married to a retiree. Together with her husband she has raised two sons and two daughters. All the children are married and live with their families. Umut works as a cleaner in the local school. Three years ago with an initial investment of 6000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS), Umur, with the help of her husband, started to breed livestock. By reselling livestock after fattening, the family earns an additional 1000 KGS per month.  With money received from the loan, Umut wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening, and further reselling. In the future she wishes to purchase a piece of land to start building a house for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly de 20 años, Viven con Eleazar de 23 años, con quien tiene un  hermoso hijo. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Sivia. Nelly es una joven llena de objetivos y metas por delante, con la finalidad de mostrarle al mundo de que a pesar de todas las adversidades que tuvo puede salir adelante. Es por ello que Nelly  se sacrifica vendiendo productos de belleza, se levanta muy temprano para preparar el alimento a su familia, para luego enrumbarse a sus labores. Su esposo trabaja como obrero de construcción, mientras que ella agarra su catálogo de productos de belleza y recorre ofreciendo por las calles de su distrito a amigos y conocidos quienes son sus clientes potenciales. Ella está feliz con la labor que realiza, porque gracias a ello percibe una rentabilidad y algunos incentivos. En un futuro próximo desea abrir un salón de belleza. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprara  más productos de belleza.
texts.en:
20-year-old Nelly lives with 23-year-old Eleazar and the couple have a beautiful daughter.  They live together in their own home which is located in Sivia district.  Nelly is a young woman who is full of goals and objectives.  Her aim is to show the world that, in spite of all the difficulties that she faced, she was able to get ahead in life.  For this reason, Nelly works hard selling beauty products.  She gets up very early in the morning to prepare food for her family and then heads off to carry out her work.  Her husband works as a construction worker while she grabs her catalog of beauty products and goes through the streets of her district, offering her goods for sale to friends and acquaintances who are her potential customers.  Nelly is happy with the work that she does because, thanks to her work, she makes profits and some bonuses.  In the near future, she would like to open a beauty salon.

This will be Nelly's first loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She will use the loan she has requested to buy more beauty products.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products

loans.name: Yolima

texts.es: Yolima  de 25 años de edad vive en un barrio muy tradicional en la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 5 años. Allí en el patio de su casa se dedica a la fabricación de camas de madera, negocio que desde hace 2 años es de su propiedad pues lo compró a su madre, quien no disponía de capital y Yolima como tenía sus propios ahorros logró adquirirlo, sus principales clientes son los almacenes ubicados en el centro  de la ciudad, quienes le compran mediante el sistema de créditos y por encargos. Su meta más adelante es lograr organizarlo, generar empleos mediante su crecimiento. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará madera variada, triplex, pintura e insumos para fabricar nuevos diseños que se encuentran encargados, para la época de gran movimiento comercial en el país: el mes de Diciembre. Su inversión planea será exitosa, porque la hace sobre encargos y especialmente porque hay  mucho efectivo disponible en el ambiente comercial, porque los trabajadores tienen en sus manos las primas, bonificaciones, con las que pueden hacer las compras, que usualmente durante otra época no es muy probable lograrlas.
texts.en:
Yolima, 25, lives in a very traditional neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla with her spouse and two children who are 2 and 5 years old.  She manufactures wood beds there in her yard, a business she’s had for two years having purchased it from her mother who needed capital.  Yolima had some savings so she acquired it.  Her main customers are stores located downtown who buy from her on credit and on order.  Her goal for later on is to organize it and generate employment through growth.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan as well as her first Fundación Mario Santo Domingo financing that she’ll use to buy assorted lumber, plywood, paint and supplies to manufacture new designs she has on order for the season of great commercial activity in the country: the month of December.  

Her investment looks to be successful because she works based on prior orders and because there is quite a bit of cash flowing in the commercial environment because employees have available their bonuses and allowances that they can use to make purchases which during other times of the year wouldn’t be probable.

loans.use: to buy assorted lumber, plywood, paint and supplies.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона не замужем, ей 21 года. Она умная и целеустремленная девушка. Она желает всем добра и хочет, чтоб все женщины были счастливыми. Четыре года назад Фарзона начала свой бизнес. У нее свой салон красоты. Постепенно она стала предоставлять услуги по макияжу невест к свадебным мероприятиям, прокат свадебных нарядов, а также оформление машин для свадьбы. Фарзона хотела бы получить займ в размере 3500 Сомони для покупки свадебных платьев.
texts.en: Farzona is 21 years old and not married.  She is a smart and goal-oriented young woman.  She wishes everyone well and wants all women to be happy.  Farzona started her business four years ago.  She owns a beauty salon.  Gradually, she started to offer makeup services to brides for wedding events, wedding dress rentals and coordinating cars for weddings.  Farzona wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 3500 Somoni to purchase wedding dresses.

loans.use: to purchase wedding dresses

loans.name: Jose Eliseo

texts.es: José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de tres terneros, abono y herbicidas, para continuar en su trabajo como agricultor y ganadero, estos préstamos representan para José una oportunidad de crecimiento y desarrollo, que lleva junto a él su familia, pues este beneficio no solamente es para uno sino para todos los que viven a su alrededor.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan to buy three calves, fertilizer, and herbicides.  He will do this in order to continue his work as a farmer and cattleman.

To José these loans represent the opportunity for growth and development that brings his family together.  This benefit is not only for one person, it is for everyone who lives in his region.

loans.use: to buy three calves, fertilizer, and herbicides.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 29 years old. She has 2 children, 4 and 8 years old. Vestine has sold foodstuffs for more than one year. She is requesting the loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She expects to use the profits to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags and clothing such as blouses, skirts and pants.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 24-year-old single woman. She is a Lebanese girl who is living with her family in Jordan.
Sarah has registered at one of the Jordanian colleges to get her diploma degree in accounting information systems. She is now in her last year. She has applied for a loan to pay her semester fees. She then wants to register for another two years to get a bachelors degree.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is looking forward to owning his own motorcycle to support his business and make trips to the city. He also looks forward to supporting the Community Health Workers (CHWs) in Ongata Rongai community, where he lives with his family. The community will benefit from transportation support, as some homesteads are far away from the town. George aims top grow his business and support more community health workers targeting the youth and children.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for community health work and taxi business

loans.name: Ste Marie Group

texts.fr: Le groupe STE MARIE est composé de trois personnes qui sont de la même famille. La représentante du groupe, nommée Nafissatou (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 53 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Nafissatou est mariée a un menuisier du nom de Odon. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous a leur charge. Nafissatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Nafissatou vend du gari (farine de manioc) et du maïs comme depuis quinze ans à son domicile et par la technique de distribution. Nafissatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Nafissatou ensemble avec les membres du groupe STE MARIE sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du gari et du maïs.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Doña Rita es una mujer muy trabajadora, que busca siempre ayudar a su familia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Su trayectoria con la Fundación es de más de 21 años, caracterizada por su excelente moral de pago, fidelidad a la organización y la buena gestión realizada de los créditos recibidos.
Ella ha logrado consolidar su negocio y mantener una clientela estable; Inició su actividad productiva con los créditos recibidos, actualmente cuenta con equipo y materia prima, también vende productos por catálogo. 
En este momento necesita realizarse nuevamente una serie de exámenes de rutina y continuar su tratamiento odontológico, para no tomar de sus ganancias solicita un crédito express. Para la clienta es muy importante cuidar su salud, sentirse bien y seguir produciendo, ya que eso le permite mantener su calidad de vida. Acude una vez más a Fundación Mujer ya que anteriormente se la financiado en temas de salud, además de apoyar sus ideas productivas.
texts.en:
Rita is a hard-working woman, who is always found helping her family and improving their life conditions. Her path with the Fundación has lasted more than 21 years, and it has been characterized by her excellent repayment record, loyalty to the organization, and good management of the loans she has received. 

She has succeeded in consolidating her business and maintaining a stable clientele. She started her work with the loan she received. At present, she has equipment and raw materials, and she also sells product by catalog. 

At this time, she needs another series of routine medical tests and more dental treatment. She is requesting a loan so that she doesn’t have to take the money from her earnings. For Rita, it is very important to take care of her health, to feel well, and continue being productive, since this allows her to maintain her quality of life. She turns again to Fundación Mujer, since previously the organization had helped her finance health-related matters and since it supports her business ideas.

loans.use: to invest in medical exams, including a mammogram, pap smear, dental consult, and general check-up.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 30 years old married to Patrick and blessed with three children aged between 14 and 4 years old.

She has been into fruits and vegetable selling business for five years and earns a monthly income of Kshs.14,000.

This being her second loan with VisionFund Kenya,she intends to buy more vegetables and fruits for resale in the village as.

With the anticipated profits, she will help her husband in paying school fees for their children.

Her dream is to grow her business to greater heights.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits for resale in the village

loans.name: Mehmed

texts.en: Mehmed A. is 54 years old. He lives with his family in the village of Jasenetz, Razgrad region. Mehmed has won business for over 10 years. First he kept a grocery store in the village and had it for 7 years. But three years ago he closed the store and made it a workshop for primary treatment of walnuts. He buys up walnuts, shells them and imports kernels. Now Mehmed A. wants to buy a cracking machine and needs $ 1200 loan.

loans.use: To buy a cracking machine

loans.name: Fazil

texts.en: This 27-year-old man began his own business 5 years ago.Having borrowed a loan of $400 he bought 2 calves. Now he needs a loan of $900 to buy 4 calves. Fazil is a single, lives in Salyan region Yenikand village.

loans.use: To buy 4 calves

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita opened “Bazar Heidy” three years ago and sold cosmetic goods door-to-door. A year ago, she opened a shop out of her home and has been selling the products successfully. She mainly markets bazaar items, stationary, and cosmetics. Every day from 8am until 11pm, she works hard to support her family and is intent on expanding her business to provide them with opportunities that she never had.

She has already borrowed from our organization before. She used the capital to purchase toys, clothes, and seasonal products. Margarita’s first loan was a great success. She invested in items that allowed her to establish a great relationship with the distributors. Now, she has a great source of wholesale products. Her profits allowed her to improve her home, especially the part where her business is located. She hopes to use the second loan to invest in cosmetics and perfume.

Margarita is a single mother of four. Although her children are all adults now, two of them still live with her. Her wish is take out this loan in order to have additional sources of income in her business.

loans.use: to invest in perfumes and cosmetic items

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia R., the head of the Flor de la Canela association, has been a member of Pro Mujer for approximately 10 years; she’s married, with 5 grown children, and works at making all kinds of clothing.

Julia has worked at clothes-making since 1977; along with her husband, she was able to establish this business by introducing her products at the main street markets in the city.

Julia now needs capital to be able to buy a fusionadora (a machine for clothes-making) that will allow her to increase the variety of clothes that she makes. She has also started the process of legalizing her small business and completing the necessary requirements for registering it, with all the social obligations and taxes that entails, but all the benefits, too.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia Rodríguez, es jefa de grupo de la asociación Flor de la Canela, aproximadamente 10 años que permanece en Pro Mujer, es casada, con 5 hijos mayores, se dedica a la confección de de todo tipo de prendas de vestir.

Desde el año 1977, Julia se dedica a la confección, al lado de su marido pudo establecer este negocio, introduciendo sus productos en las principales ferias de esta ciudad.

Actualmente Julia precisa de capital para poder comprar una máquina fusionadora que le permita incrementar la variedad de piezas y confecciones. Del mismo modo ha iniciado el proceso de legalización de su pequeña empresa y cumpliendo los requisitos necesarios para poder registrarse con todas las obligaciones sociales e impositivas y del mismo modo recibir los beneficios que esto conlleva.

loans.use: Julia needs capital to be able to buy a fusionadora (a machine for clothes-making) that will allow her to increase the variety of clothes that she makes.

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es:
Gaby is dedicated to making women's pants. She started this activity two ago after her previous job as a cell phone operator ended when new laws and rates set in. So she entered the dressmaking business and thanks to her sister-in-law, who taught her the craft. Currently she has a post at the fairgrounds in El Alto, which was given to her by her sister-in-law as well, and she uses that as her operational base to get contracts and orders. Gaby needs capital to be able to purchase more materials, namely fabrics, which will allow her to produce a larger quantity of merchandise so she'll be ready for the Christmas season. Only then will she be able to earn the necessary resources to move her family (husband and three children) ahead, keeping in mind her eldest daughter will soon give birth.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Gaby P., se dedica a la confección de pantalones de tela para damas. Hace dos años que se dedica a esta actividad, ya que antes se dedicaba a ser punto de llamadas de celular (chalequero), pero a raíz de las nuevas leyes y disposiciones del gobierno respecto a la tarifación de las llamadas de telefonía movil, tuvo que cambiar de rubro. Es así que Gabi ingresa al mundo de la confección y gracias a la ayuda de su cuñada, quien le enseñó el oficio. Actualmente ella posee un puesto de venta en la Feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto, puesto que también fue cedido por su cuñada, y donde ha instalado su base de operaciones para contactar contratos y pedidos. Gaby precisa de capital para poder comprar mayor cantidad de materiales, principalmente telas que le permitirán producir mayor cantidad de mercadería que será puesta a la venta para la temporada navideña. Solo así podrá generar los recursos necesarios para salir adelante con su esposo y sus tres hijos, tomando en cuenta que su hija menor apenas cuenta con días de recién nacida.

loans.use: Gaby needs capital to be able to purchase more materials, namely fabrics, which will allow her to produce a larger quantity of merchandise so she'll be ready for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Elizabeth Bih

texts.en: Elizabeth Bih is 63 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She could not afford to give most of her children a secondary-school education, so her greatest desire is to help them learn a trade or how to run a business. She helps support her family by raising pigs, and has applied for a loan to buy more piglets to raise, feed for them to eat, and seeds that she can use to grow crops to sell. She will use the additional income to pay for vocational training for her children.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds, piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Mrs. Ruth is member of the communal bank, Mujeres Al Desarrollo de Pariahuanca (Women for the Development of Pariahuanca). She works selling grains wholesale, such as wheat, different varieties of corn, wheat bran, and corn bran. Her business is located at the fair in the Huaraz province, Ancash department. She sells on Mondays and Thursdays.

With this loan for S/.1,800.00, which will be paid in 6 parts, she will buy 4 sacks of Cuzco corn and 4 sacks of wheat to make the corn and wheat bran; she will also buy 5 sacks of corn to make dried popcorn.

Mrs. Ruth is 22 years old, living in common-law marriage, and has a child. Her husband works in transportation, offering a service of mass transport for the professors in the area. He helps his wife making the brans and transporting the products to the fair.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Al Desarrollo de Pariahuanca”, se dedica a la venta de granos, trigo, maíz de diferentes variedades y pelado de trigo y de maíz al por mayor, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la feria de la provincia de Huaraz, Departamento de Ancash, vende los días lunes y jueves.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará 4 sacos de maíz cuzqueño y 4 sacos de trigo para hacer pelado de maíz y trigo, también comprará 5 sacos de maíz para cancha.

Ella tiene 22 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo, su esposo es transportista y hace servicio de colectivos para los profesores de la zona, apoya a su esposa haciendo el pelado de los granos y el traslado de sus productos a la feria.

loans.use: Buying grains wholesale (Compra de granos al por mayor.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Nazar

texts.en:
N. Nazar is 48 years old and he is married and has 5 children. Mr. N. is a very diligent and responsible father who works hard to ensure a good future for his children.

He is engaged in the family business that his parents started. Mr. N. raises and sells livestock, and his wife helps him by making the sour-milk products. Mr. N. is requesting a loan of $625 to open a butcher shop.

loans.use: To open a butcher shop

loans.name: Marisol's Group

texts.es:
Maria, Isabel and Marisol are members of the "CCori Ayllu Community Bank" since 2, 1, and 3 years, respectively. CCori Ayllu means “golden family” in quechua. The community bank has taught them to be responsible, punctual and to save.

Maria is 31 years old; she is married and has 2 children. She travels to the regional fairs once a week, to buy hens, cheese, pork meat and cereals. She then breeds the hens, which she sells to her neighbors and she sells the other products at the Playa Grau market.

Isabel is 46 years old; she is married and has 3 children. She sells on credit different types of products depending on her client’s demands as clothes, shoes, crockery, etc. Moreover, Isabel and her children have a kiosk at the city’s observation deck where they sell food and liquor.

Marisol is 33 years old; she is married and has 3 children. Marisol, together with other women, has a textile handicraft’s association. They make embroideries and weavings which they sell at local and national markets.

Maria, Isabel and Marisol ask for loans of 600, 800 and 600 soles each. They will use them to buy cheese, uniforms, school supplies, cloth and wool.

Maria, Isabel and Marisol dream about succeeding in their business so that their children will study and enter a profession. They would also like to have better shops, stable enterprises and a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria, Isabel y Marisol pertenecen al Banco Comunal CCori Ayllu que significa “Familia D. Oro” en quechua hace 2, 1, 3 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser responsables, puntuales y a ahorrar.

Maria es casada, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Maria viaja a las ferias una vez por semana donD. compra quesos, cerdo, gallina, los cereales lo venD. el mercado Playa Grau, los animales lo beneficia y lo venD. a sus vecinas.

Por otro lado Isabel es casada, tiene 46 años y 3 hijos, Isabel venD. diversos productos D. acuerdo al pedido D. sus clientes, como ropa, zapatos, locería, productos que venD. al crédito. Además Isabel junto a sus hijos tiene un Kiosco en el mirador D. la ciudad donD. venD. comida y licores.

Mientras que Marisol es casada, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Marisol junto a otras mujeres tienen una asociación D. artesanía Textil, los trabajos que realizan son bordados, tejidos, sus productos lo venden en el mercado local y nacional.

Maria, Isabel y Marisol necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 800 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. queso, uniformes, útiles escolares, tela y lana.

Los sueños D. Maria, Isabel y Marisol son salir adelante con sus negocios, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales, iniciar un nuevo negocio, tener una empresa sólida y tener una mejor calidad D. vida.

loans.use: Maria, Isabel and Marisol ask for loans of 600, 800 and 600 soles each. They will use them to buy cheese, uniforms, school supplies, cloth and wool.

loans.name: Mwajuma's Mwamko Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 37 years old and is divorced with 2 children, aged 10 and 3. She also takes care of 2 other children. Mwajuma sells fish, a business which she started in 2002. She works every day from 6 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwanajumaa and Neema, who have businesses dealing in vegetable sales and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis M. is a 52-year-old man who lives on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo in the Dominican Republic. He has a small business selling used and new clothes, but in the past year he has experienced a significant increase in demand and has began to do very well—his biggest challenge right now is that he simply does not have the capital available to buy enough merchandise to adequately keep up with demand from his community members.

Luis plans to use his loan to go to the large market place in the heart of the capital, called La Duarte. There, he will be able to buy his clothes in bulk and, with the help of the loan, he will not only be able to buy the amount he actually needs, but he will also be able to save money on the discounted wholesale price he receives.

His dream is to help his children be able to go back to one of the local universities in the area so that they can become professionals, and he also hopes to build and buy his own home one day in the near future.

On behalf of Luis and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for supporting his dreams and goals!

loans.use: To increase the quantity of clothes and merchandise he is able to buy and sell to his community members.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice M. is 52 years old, divorced, and the mother of four children who are currently in school. She is a petty trader who sells items like rice, tin tomatoes, sugar, beans, canned foods, evaporated milk, soaps etc. on a table in her neighborhood. She is a very resourceful woman and by dint of hard work, she has managed to support two children to finish teacher training college. She wants to use the loan to increase her stock of rice, sugar, beans, evaporated milk, soap and to also include the sale of charcoal. Beatrice believes this will help raise enough income to finance her children's educations. She is a member of the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other, serving as social collateral to access loans and to apply some peer pressure to encourage loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy additional rice, sugar, beans, evaporated milk, soaps and also charcoal.

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarollo: Group 1

texts.en: Eudocia R. Zapota, 23, is in her second loan cycle with Esperanza and is the president of her Bank of Hope, "Mujeres en Desarollo" ("developing women").  She takes the job seriously, making sure that her fellow associates pay attention to their loan officer, Felix, but she can also be seen laughing and joking during the collection meetings.  She lives with her large family of 3 brothers, 2 sisters, and one-year-old daughter, Denelis.  With her future loans, she hopes to one day acquire a bigger, more spacious shop for her salon, and to purchase her own home for her and Denelis.  Most importantly, she wishes to keep working at the job she loves so that her daughter "will never lack anything."

loans.use: Salon de Eudocia

loans.name: Yasinta

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is forty-eight-year-old Yasinta from Dar es Salaam. She is divorced with four children under the age of eighteen. She also takes care of a fourteen-year-old relative who is an orphan because his parents passed away from HIV AIDS.

Yasinta owns a small "duka" or neighborhood shop in the city where she sells common household and grocery items. She established the store in 1996 and currently runs it with the help of her children to earn monthly profits of US$ 71. She is requesting a loan of US$ 875 in order to obtain capital to expand the range and quantity of products available at her store.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client.

The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies in bulk for her store

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en: Bashir R. is 25 years old, single, and lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. Bashir owns a small store where he sells various perfumes, gifts, and accessories. Bashir is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase more products for his store in order to keep pleasing his customers. This is the third time Bashir has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To help expand and diversify his product offerings

loans.name: Yai

texts.en:
Mrs. Yai K., 41 years old, is a widow with three children - two sons and one daughter. Her first daughter studies at the University in Phnom Penh and the other two children study in a local school. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Yai has been selling vegetables, meat, rice, and noodle for the past ten years. She bought them from a market in Phnom Penh to sell along the local roads in front of her house. Her business revenue has helped send her eldest daughter to study at the University. She hopes that she will be able to send her other two children to study at the University as well. Currently, her business is running very well because many customers come to her shop very day.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more vegetables, meat, tables, and chairs for expanding her business.

loans.use: To expand her business of selling vegetables, rice, and Chinese noodles.

loans.name: Balimaya (Convivialité) Group

texts.fr:
Unies par des liens de parenté et de voisinage, les membres  du groupe se  sont spécialisés dans le petit commerce de pagnes wax, de Bazin (tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest), de chaussures, d’e fruits et de matériels en aluminium. Elles sont au nombre de neuf (7 mariées et  2 célibataires avec une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et de 2 enfants) et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Mancourani I, un des quartiers du centre ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali).
Ce groupe, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter a décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso à travers une association de femmes de leur quartier (Laïdou c’est à dire la promesse). Il est à son premier prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe).
Avec ce premier prêt, elles comptent acheter 14 pièces de pagne Wax, 120 métres  de bazins moins riche, 143 paires de chaussure, 10 sacs d’orange, 15 sacs de patates, un important stock de condiments alimentaires (gombos, oignons, aubergines, aromes, concentré tomate, etc.) et  des materièls en aluminium. Les  matériels en aluminium sont amenés à la forge pour en faire des marmites avant de les revendre. Elles s’approvisionnent dans la ville de Sikasso, dans les villages environnants ainsi qu’à Bamako ( capitale de la république du Mali).
Les produits sont vendus en gros et en  détail,  au comptant et à crédit dans le marché de Sikasso et  dans les foires des villages environnants et quelque fois à Koutiala. Au retour, elles achètent des savons et de beurre de karité qui seront vendus au marché de Sikasso à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes surtout des foraines et quelques hommes.           
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune avec ce premier prêt un bénéfice moyen de 30.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir  aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités respectives.
texts.en:
United by bonds of family and neighborhood, the members of this group have specialized in re-selling “wax”-type pagnes (lengths of brightly colored African cloth), “Bazin” (a sort of damask that is often locally dyed and much prized in West Africa), shoes, fruit, and objects made out of aluminum.

There are 9 women in the group: 7 married and two single with an average age of 27 and, on average, 2 children. They live in big traditional families in Mancourani I, a neighborhood of downtown Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali).

In an attempt to satisfy the needs of their ever-expanding clientele, this group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso through an association of women from their neighborhood (Laïdou, i.e. promise). They are on their first solidarity loan (group loan). With this first loan, they intend to buy 14 lengths of the cloth known as “Wax pagne”, 120 meters of medium-quality basin, 143 pairs of shoes, 10 sacks of oranges, 15 sacks of sweet potatoes, a large amount of condiments (okra, onions, eggplants, flavoring, tomato paste, etc.) and some aluminum. The aluminum is taken to the blacksmith to have it made into pots before re-selling it.

They stock up in the town of Sikasso and in nearby villages as well as in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). The products are sold wholesale and retail, for cash or credit in the Sikasso marketplace to a clientele composed generally of women, especially those who come to buy and sell at the weekly markets, and a few men.

They each hope to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA from this first loan. The profit will be used to make payments on the loan and to help support their families, with any remainder being invested back into their respective businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Mariana Patricia

texts.es:
Mariana es comerciante, se dedica a la compra y venta de perfumes, los acomoda en las oficinas. 
Vive en la zona de obrajes sector sur de la ciudad de La Paz, en la casa de sus padres.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito, ya que no cuenta con mucho capital y le será de gran ayuda ya que por el mes de diciembre sube la demanda de clientes.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería (perfumes, cosméticos, y cremas)
texts.en:
Mariana is a merchant who makes a living buying and selling perfumes, selling them office to office. She lives with her parents in the Obrajes neighborhood of south Lima. This is the first time that she's applied for a loan. She doesn't have much money for the business and the loan will greatly help her because demand for her products rises in December. She will use the loan to buy products (perfumes, cosmetics, creams, etc.) for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 57 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 17 años. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde muy joven trabajó vendiendo comida, pero el costo de alquiler de su local la llevaron a la quiebra, entonces tuvo que buscar otros medios para ganarse la vida y comenzó a trabajar en la limpieza de un colegio, ahí logró captar clientes, a quienes les ofrecía prepararles la comida, y así desde hace 2 años viene repartiendo comida a los docentes del colegio y para algunos alumnos, negocio que es muy rentable, ya que la preparación de estos alimentos lo realiza en su domicilio para luego distribuirlos y evita de pagar el alquiler de locales, aunque lo difícil es trasladar la comida por el peso que tiene. Esther está en su 2do crédito y va muy bien en sus pagos, está muy comprometida con su grupo de socias y con la institución. Con el dinero solicitado adquirirá utensilios para la implementación de su cocina con todo lo necesario para la preparación de la comida.
texts.en:
Esther is 57 years old, she lives with her husband and her 17 year-old son. She is a very hardworking woman. She has been selling food since she was very young, but the cost of rent at her restaurant drove her to bankruptcy. She had to find other ways to earn a living, so she began doing cleaning at a high school where she began to get clients for whom she prepared foods. For the past 2 years she has been bringing food to the teachers at the school and some of the students. This is a very profitable business, since she makes the foods at home and therefore avoids having to pay rent for a restaurant location. The hard part is carrying the food to the customers because it is heavy. Esther is in her second loan and is doing very well with her payments. She is very responsible towards others in her loan group and also with the institution. With the requested loan she will buy utensils for her kitchen so she will have everything she needs for the preparation of her foods.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food ingredients and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a married woman with one 12-year-old daughter. She sells various men's and women's clothing. By doing so, her gross monthly income is approximately 3,000 UAH.

Svetlana only recently (less than one year ago) started her business with the help of one of her friends. Svetlana's goal is to expand her business in order to make it a stable source of income for the benefit of her family.

Svetlana is now seeking a loan in the amount of 4,000 UAH over a term of 8 months. She plans on increasing her inventory of clothes to attract more clients and to thereby generate an increase in sales.

loans.use: To expand her business and to attract more customers by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil V. is 44-year-old barber who has his own barber shop in Imishli city. He started his business four years ago and during this short amount of time he became a very famous barber in his city. Kamil is married and has three children who are in school. Kamil`s business brings stable income to his family, but it is their only source of income, and he is requesting a loan to improve his shop and buy new barber tools. Kamil believes these improvements will help him attract more clients.

loans.use: To purchase new barber tools

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en:
This young man is applying to Kiva for his second loan. The first time, in January 2007, he applied for a loan of  $1000.  With that loan, he was able to improve his business and increase the number of his clients. He successfully repaid that loan.

Etibar  is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, Kilindjli village. He temporary lives with his family in the Khirdalan settlement. 

This man sells building materials. Now he is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to increase the variety of building materials that he sells. He has a lot of clients, and he does not want to loose them.  

“I am very thankfull to Kiva that they increased the loan size from $1200 to $3000. For a long time I was waiting for the day when Kiva would increase the loan size. It is the best news for me."

loans.use: To increase his supply of building materials

loans.name: Ndyeye Fatou

texts.fr: Ndeye Fatou K. est une marchande de produits cosmétiques.  Elle exercice ce commerce depuis trois ans.  Elle est célibataire.  Avec ce commerce, elle nourrit sa mère veuve.  C’est le premier crédit qu’elle a sollicité auprès de l’IMCEC, et il va lui permettre d’acheter une toiture pour leur maison et elle compte rembourser avec son commerce.
texts.en:
Ndeye Fatou K. is single and has been selling cosmetics for three years. With her business, she provides for her mother who is a widow. This is the first loan she's seeking from Kiva's partner IMCEC, and she intends to use it to buy a new roof for their home. She will repay the loan with the profits of her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new roof

loans.name: Navigator Group

texts.en:
Juma K., 38, is married with a six-year-old daughter. He has a business in tie and dye, and printing on T-shirts since 1998. He is able to earn a monthly profit of about $223.

This will be Juma’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants to raise capital so that he can improve the business by buying good equipment for the printing business.

Juma will share this loan with subgroup c of the Navigator group. The subgroup has 7 members, who run cafes, sell food and sell goods in shops. These members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Juma is 2nd from right in the blue shirt.

loans.use: Buy better equipment for his T-shirt printing business.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita B. lives peacefully in the village of San Jose Noret I, Mallig, Isabela. She is blessed with three children and they all have their stable jobs and their own families. Estrelita has managed a rice retailing business for many years. It is this business that has been her source of income, and is why she was able to send her children to school to finish their studies. 

Estrelita wants to have another source of income, rather than rice retailing. She wants to maintain a hog raising business in order to increase her income, because she plans to renovate her old house. In this regard, she is requesting a loan of PHP20,000.00 for additional capital for her small piggery business. She wants to buy more piglets to raise and feed supply for her pigs to keep them healthy. She dreams of earning more profits in order to repair her old house and be able to have a comfortable life. She believes that through her sacrifices and strong faith in God, she will be able to attain her goals in life.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and feed.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
"I learn now how to manage and market my product well to people to sustain my business. I am a homemaker but I am not content to just sit in the house and take care of our seven children. I buy old, not functional pumpboat engines. What I do is repair them and sell them to fishermen. I really want to help my husband earn a living to buy our needs," says Estrella L. , a 43-year-old from Talibon, Bohol.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 11,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her business. The loan will really help a lot to grow her business even more.

CEVI provides credit assistance to support small businesses. It also provides training and insurance coverage services to all clients to help their small business to grow.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her business

loans.name: Edith Yesenia

texts.es:
Edith Yesenia Ramírez es una mujer que siempre ha estado al pendiente de su mamá aunque Yesenia es casada su esposo no le impide que la siga apoyando mientras la señora viva. La señora es apoyada también por un hijo que no se encuentra en la ciudad pero siempre le manda dinero para que se mantenga. Yesenia quiere darle una mejor comodidad a su madre ya que es quien la cuido desde pequeña.
La casa donde ellos viven es de interés social lo cual es muy pequeña y por ello recurren a nosotros para adquirir un préstamo para construcción y así ampliarla para que la mamá de Yesenia se sienta a gusto y cómoda.
texts.en:
Edith Yesenia R. is a woman that has always taken care of her mom. Yesenia is married, her husband doesn’t keep her from helping out her mom. Yesenia’s mom is also taken care of by a son that is not in the city but that always helps out by sending money. Yesenia wants to provide more comfort to her mom, the woman who took care of her as a little girl. The house that they live in is part of a social program and is very small, this is why they come to us to request a housing loan and expand the house so that Yesenia’s mom feels good and comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Angelica Ysolina

texts.es:
La señora Angélica Ysolina V. P. tiene 51 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Superior Completa, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Angélica se dedica a la confección y venta de vestidos de baile (marinera), también vende comida rápida como salchipollo en las noches.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Mujeres al Progreso, lo invirtió en la compra de telas, blondas y cintas para elaborar los vestidos de marinera.
El crédito de 1200 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de un carrito sanguchero usado, una vitrina  y sillas para su negocio.
Angélica  tiene como sueño tener su fuente de soda y una tienda donde venda los vestidos de marinera  y crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Angélica Ysolina V. P., 51, lives in the Porvenir district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She has a high school degree. She has two dependent children. She makes and sells dance dresses (Andean folk dance). She also sells fast food like “salchipollo” (a typical Peruvian dish) at night. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which she received from her Mujeres al Progreso Community Bank, she bought fabric, silk lace, and ribbons to make the folk dance dresses. She will use the loan of 1,200 PEN to buy a used sandwich cart, a display case, and chairs for her business. Angélica’s dreams are to have a soda fountain and a store where she sells her folk dance dresses and to grow as a small businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a used sandwich cart, a display case, and chairs for her business

loans.name: Ctr 70 Mulago Group

texts.en:
Victo is a leader of a four-member group. She is 40 and married with five children between the ages of 15 and 23. All of her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she resides with three people. Victo doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. 

She resides and works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. Victo sells motorcycle oil in Mulago triangle, one of Kampala's suburbs. She uses public transport to and from shops in Kampala city and goes for shopping once a week. She sells to an average of 20 people per day, mainly men. She works seven days a week and sells mainly on a retail basis. 

Victo's major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for both her home and business. She has been in this business for the last six years. Victo has been with MCDT for more than seven years and is servicing her 14th loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of motorcycle oil. Victo aspires to see her business grow bigger

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of motorcycle oil

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel A. is 56 years old and married with two children. He sells and repairs fridges and air conditioners. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase a generator as an alternative power supply for working. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a generator

loans.name: Tsend

texts.en: Tsend is a 55 years old, retiree, who lives with her two adult sons in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. From an early age her sons took much interest in automobiles. They both learned how do drive and became skilled in auto repair. In 2007, taking advantage of her sons' skills, Tsend opened a tire repair service shop with them. Currently, the boys operate the tire repair shop during the day and drive taxis in the evenings.  Over the last two years, business has become very stable. They have developed a good reputation in their community and have many regular customers. Tsend started the business with capital of  100,000 tugrugs (approx. 70 USD). Today their business capital exceeds 900,000 tugrugs (approx. 620 USD).  Tsend is a very open-minded person and says, "I would like to improve and expand my business. Also, I want to see my sons get married." She is requesting a 1,300,000 tugrugs (approx. $898 USD) to purchase more supplies for her repair shop.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for her auto repair shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace N. is married and has five dependents. She has received a junior high school education.  Grace sells boiled rice. She buys raw rice from the market and cooks it to sell at Abrodzirum near shama-kedzi, which she has been doing since 1991. Her husband is a farmer.  Grace uses her income to support her husband and for the welfare of the children.  Grace will use the loan to purchase raw rice in  larger quantities to cook for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to  save profit and invest in her child’s education.

loans.use: To purchase raw rice in larger quantities to cook for resale.

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Rong Bun Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group, which consists of ten people, is located in Tboung Damrei village in Takeo province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Koem Rong B. is the village bank president. She is a housewife. Her husband, Mr. Tob Nim, is a farmer who owns a plot of land which he uses to cultivate rice. For this plantation, Mrs. Koem Rong B. is applying a loan to buy fertilizer and she would use the rest of the money to buy two piglets to raise. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. She is 36 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school.

Eight members in this group loan have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and two piglets

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en: Rahma J. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more rice, beans, etc. to sell. Rahma is 30 years old and is married to a teacher. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Rahma hopes to be able to build a house for rental purposes. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more beans and rice in her restaurant

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor tiene 33 años, vive con su esposa (Doris), de la misma edad, y con sus 4 hijos: Juan Carlos de 13,  Darlin de 10, Ani de 2 años y la pequeña Saira de 1 mes de nacida, todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Hace tres años, él y su esposa, poseían una tienda de comestibles la cual, por diversos motivos, tuvieron que cerrar, pues no podían mantener el negocio. Felizmente con todos los esfuerzos que han estado haciendo podrán reabrirla, es por ello que están muy contentos y con todas las ganas de hacerlo pronto, ya que es un proceso largo, pues deben refaccionar el local, comprar algunos mostradores, los comestibles, etc. Héctor actualmente trabaja en una fábrica de ladrillos, él se mantendrá trabajando ahí mientras que su esposa atenderá la tienda, ya que con su pequeña bebé debe permanecer en casa y pendiente de sus necesidades.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, él siempre ha sido un hombre muy responsable en todos sus pagos y lo hará así con este crédito. Con el dinero que solicita hará realidad la meta de reabrir su tienda para poder brindarle un negocio más tranquilo a su esposa, quien debe atender a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Héctor is 33 years old and lives in his own home. He and his wife Doris (who is the same age) have 4 children: Juan Carlos (age 13), Darlin (age 10), Ani (age 2) and little Saira (age 1 month). Three years ago, Héctor and his wife owned a grocery store that they were forced to close because they were not able to stay in business. Happily they have invested a lot of effort into reopening the business and are looking forward to making it happen. However, the process is taking some time because they must renovate the space, install shelving, acquire merchandise, etc. Hector currently works at a brick factory and will continue to do while his wife attends to the store and watches their little baby at the same time.

This is Héctor’s third loan with MFP. He has been very responsible with all of his payments and will do the same with this loan. With the money he requested, he will fulfill his goal of reopening his store and providing a quieter business that his wife can manage while taking care of their young daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reopen his grocery store

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 35-year-old divorcee with two children aged 8 and 16. Both her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she lives with two other people. Juliet takes care of additional family members.The family has access to electricity, but no piped water, and they get three meals a day. She incurs additional expenses for transportation to and from Kampala City for shopping.

She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a ladies' salon in Nakulabye Kiyaye Zone. She sells cosmetics and hair extensions, both at retail and wholesale, and sells to all classes women. Juliet works seven days a week. She receives an average of 20 customers a day. Her major business challenges include defaulters and the ever-increasing prices of creams and hair extensions.

Her home serves as her business premises. She has been in this business for over fifteen years and with MCDT for five years. She is servicing her thirteenth loan, working with the same group-mates. Juliet joined MCDT because it was near her home and was giving loans to poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more creams and hair extensions. She is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and start a beauty shop.

loans.use: To buy more creams and hair extensions

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el  distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 8 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Ccotos, estudio educación primaria incompleta.

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 5 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de sacos de polietileno.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1700.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar sacos de polietileno, los cuales los utiliza para embolsar el yeso que la socia elabora, también se ayuda con la elaboración de artesanías.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para generar sus propios ingresos.
A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the communal bank "Juchuy Niño" (Juchuy Boy) located in the Capachica district of Puno Province, in the Department of Puno. Isabel is 49 years-old, married, and has 8 children. She lives in the community of Ccotos. She did not complete her primary education. Isabel has been working with the Movimiento Manuela R. for 5 years. Her initial loan was 300 Nuevos Soles, which she used as capital for her business selling polythene plastic bags. Currently Isabel needs a new loan of 1700 Nuevos Soles, which would allow her to purchase more polythene plastic bags, which she uses to package the plaster that she also produces. The plastic bags are also useful in the manufacture of craft products. Isabel's greatest wish is to continue working to earn her own income. She likes the meetings of the communal bank and the convenience the loans provide.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of polythene (plastic) bags for retail sale.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El socio JOSE LUIS pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

El socio tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y  tiene tres hijas. La mayor estudia en la Universidad y las hijas menores una en el Instituto y la otra preparándose para la universidad en una academia. Ellos viven en la provincia del Cusco. El socio es administrador de dos restaurantes turísticos en las ciudades del Cusco y Urubamba. Ya son varios años que trabaja en los restaurantes y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es trabajador y emprendedor que quiere sacar adelante a su familia y darles a sus hijas una mejor educación. El socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un carro para que haga servicio de trasporte en la ciudad del Cusco.
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jose Luis belongs to the Virgen de Chapi community bank. He is 49 years old, is married and has three children. The eldest studies at university and of the younger daughters, one is at the Institue and the other is preparing for university at an academy. They live in the province of Cusco. The member is a manager of two tourist restaurants in the cities of Cusco and Urubamba. He already has various years experience working in these restaurants and it has gone well thanks to the hard work he's put forth. Our member is hard-working and entrepreneurial and he wishes to get his family ahead and give his daughters a better education. He requires the loan to invest in the purchase of a car so he can provide transportation services in Cusco. Jose is thankful for the opportunity provided to him in this manner and also promises to make payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He requires the loan to invest in the purchase of a car so he can provide transportation services in Cusco.

loans.name: Aura

texts.en:
Aura G. is from the city of San Luis, Tarlac. She is 47 years old. Aura is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Aura runs a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Aura has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately $150 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Aura joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Aura is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Mrs. Eang S., 29, has established her own small family with three other members. Her husband’s name is Makara, age 28, a motor taxi driver. He is also hired by his nearby neighbors to cook foods for their wedding parties. The family has two school-aged kids, who depend on their parent’s income.

To seek a daily income, Eang S. sews clothes for the garment industry and is able to earn a salary over $70 a month to help control the financial crisis of her family. Eang S. also owns farmland that she inherited from her grandmother. On her land she wants to plant crops but she lacks money to invest. Thus she would like to request a loan to purchase fertilizers and crop seeds.

Eang S. was busy working when the photo was taken so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and crop seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.fr: Née en 1966 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, G. Epiphanie est mariée à FASSINOU Rigobert. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et dont trois sont à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble au quartier Houinmè à Porto-Novo, depuis 5 ans environs. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Epiphanie a très peu fréquenté. Depuis près de 8 ans, Epiphanie mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (liqueurs, amuses gueule, eau minérale, savons de toilette et de lessive, etc.) dans sa boutique size à Catchi à Porto-Novo. Parallèlement à cette activité et de façon secondaire, Epiphanie vend des tissus, ce qui lui permet d'avoir plusieurs sources de revenus. C'est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Epiphanie s'approvisionne. Epiphanie a bénéficié une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Epiphanie ambitionne augmenter son fonds de roulement et élever davantage le niveau de son activité, pour mieux satisfaire ses clients. Mais actuellement Epiphanie éprouve de difficultés dans l’approvisionnement de ses produits. C'est la raison pour laquelle Epiphanie sollicite un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1966 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin, Epiphanie G. is married to Rigobert FASSINOU. The couple has four children who are all at school; three of them are in their care. The family has been living together in the Houinmè district of Porto-Novo for about five years. The couple cover the household expenses between them. Epiphanie went to school very little. For almost eight years she has been carrying out a business selling various products (liqueurs, appetizers, mineral water, soaps and washing powder, etc.) in her shop in Catchi in Porto-Novo. At the same time Epiphanie has a secondary activity which is the sale of fabric; this allows her to have several sources of income. She stocks up at Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin.
