Epiphanie has had one loan from ALIDé, which she repaid without incident. Her ambition is to increase her working capital and raise her activity level in order to satisfy her customers better. But currently Epiphanie has difficulties getting supplies. This is the main reason she is applying for a second loan.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of diverse products (soaps, mineral water, appetizers, sugar)

loans.name: Wilberto Antonio

texts.es: El joven Wilberto de 30 años de edad es soltero, vive en el municipio del Coral Chontales,  trabaja como Responsable  de Unidad Ambiental desde hace un año, a pesar que este cliente no tiene hijos ayuda a su madre y a su abuelita con los gastos del hogar ya que son de escasos recursos económicos,  está solicitando financiamiento de su primer  credito con el cual pretende pintar la casa donde el vive, el se caracteriza por ser un joven muy responsable, honesto y trabajador este cliente   desde  niño a aprendido a trabajar y a valorar lo que mas ama su familia,  actualmente esta estudiando una licenciatura en la Universidad  Martin Lutero,  su sueño es  llegar a ser un profesional que ayude a que nuestro pais salga de la pobreza y  tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia ya que son humildes.
texts.en:
Wilberto is 30 years old and single. He lives in the town of Coral Chontales. For the past year, Wilberto has worked as Head of Environmental Health. Even though he has no children, Wilberto helps his mother and grandmother with household expenses as the family has few economic means. This is Wilberto’s first loan, which he will use to paint his house. He is responsible, honest and industrious, and since childhood has learnt to work and hold family values in high regard. Wilberto is currently studying a degree at the Martin Lutero University. His dream is to become a professional, help his country to escape poverty, and have job security to maintain his family who are of scarce economic means.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To paint his house

loans.name: Enjeru Group 2, Kyenjojo

texts.en: Simon Peter is the leader of his lending group in Kyenjojo. He is a hard working married man who sends his children to school while he takes care of other family members. Simon is a hard working and friendly man with a produce business in Enjeru trading center, and he is grateful that his efforts are yielding fruits. His goal is to ensure that his business grows in stock and customer base so that he could continue feeding his family and as well educate his children. He needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for resale, and this will enable him bring in an extra income.

loans.use: Buying more produce like beans, maize and irish for resale.

loans.name: El Rincon De Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El comité El Rincón de las Amigas es un comité formada  mediante el espíritu emprendedoras de las 15 señoras que la conforman. Cada una tienen un trabaja independiente de  acuerdo a las facilidades con que cuentan y realizan sus labores con mucho entusiasmo.  
Todas con la ayuda de las asesoras  practican buenas costumbres como hacer presupuesto familiar, ahorro entre otras actividades que pueden mejorar  la vida de sus familias, así ellas se sienten muy satisfechas y agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Una de ellas es la señora  María Rossana L. se dedica a la venta de mercaderías  varias como rapas , calzados, artículos de limpieza, útiles escolares y otras mercaderías, ella vende sus productos en su domicilio toda la familia colabora en la atención del negocio y los ingresos obtenidos ayuda mucho con los gastos de la casa comenta la señora Maria.
texts.en:
The El Rincón de las Amigas (The Girlfriends' Nook) is a committee that came about thanks to the enterprising spirit of the 15 women that compose it. Each works independently and with much enthusiasm according to her means. With help from their advisors, they follow good habits, like: making a family budget and setting aside savings, among others, that help them to improve family life. They are happy with and grateful to Fundación Paraguaya. One of the members is María Rossana L.. She sells general merchandise, like: clothing, shoes, cleaning supplies, school supplies, and others. She works from home and all of the family helps to tend to the business. Income obtained from it is a great help for her to meet household expenses, María tells us.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise, like: clothing, school supplies, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Anastacia Manuela

texts.es: Anastasia es de 38 años de edad, casada con 4 hijos dos varones y dos mujeres, se dedica a tejer cortes típicos, los cuales los vende en el mercado de la localidad, en ASDIR es el segundo crédito que solicita, en el primero demostró puntualidad y responsabilidad, el financiamiento lo necesita para ampliar su capital de trabajo, específicamente para comprar más hilo que le servirá en la tejeduría, con la ayuda del esposo pagaran el crédito.
texts.en:
Anastasia, 38, is married and has four children: two boys and two girls. She weaves traditional clothes that she sells in the local market. This is her second loan with ASDIR; she was responsible and punctual with repaying her first loan. She needs this funding to increase working capital, specifically to buy more thread for her weaving. Her husband will help her repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread.

loans.name: Osana

texts.en: Osana, 27 years old and married with one child, lives in Benin where she makes and sells female hats and beads at her store and also bakes cakes for marriages, birthday ceremonies and more.  Both businesses enable her to support her family's basic needs. With the loan of NGN 70,000, she plans to expand her hat and beads business, which is booming. She hopes to increase her earnings in this enterprise in the long run and be able to better provide for her child 's education.  Osana says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make more hats and beads to sell.

loans.name: Taualupe

texts.en:
Taualupe F. is 48 and married with 6 children (ages 3 - 12).  She owns a business venture, providing men's tailoring services to local community members.  Taualupe has 4 years of experience in this business.  Taualupe needs a loan of WST $1450 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Taualupe joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Taualupe's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz, de 32 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Richard de 34 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. El trabajo que diariamente realiza Mariluz en sus chacras, ha hecho que sus sembríos sean uno de los mejores cultivados del poblado de Paucarmarca. Todas las mañanas sale muy temprano a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que es muy importante que las tenga bien cuidadas. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la crianza de animales, labor que le es muy rentable, puesto que es una de las pocas personas que se dedica a esto. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene, para tomar sus propias decisiones, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar su ganado hasta la feria ganadera de la ciudad de Tarma. Por lo pronto espera comprar más reses y así incrementar el número de animales que tiene actualmente. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se siente en la obligación de pagar a tiempo sus cuotas, ya que no desea causarle problemas a su grupo comunal, donde es muy querida y siempre es aconsejada por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará un Toro, el cual le costara aproximadamente dos mil nuevos soles, para ellos esta dispuesta aponer la mitad del dinero de sus ahorros personales.
texts.en:
Mariluz is a cheerful and loving mother who is 32 years of age. She lives in her own home with her husband Richard, age 34, and their two darling children for whom she hopes to provide a better future. Mariluz works every day in her fields. Her crops are among the best cultivated in the village of Paucarmarca. Every day she leaves early in order to work her land because she knows the importance of keeping it maintained. In addition, Mariluz raises animals because it is very profitable and she is one of the few people in the area who does this type of work. What she enjoys most about her job is the freedom to make her own decisions. She has been in this business for 15 years and says the most difficult part is transporting her animals to the livestock fair in the city of Tarma. For now, she hopes to buy more cattle to increase her existing herd.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Mariluz feels obligated to complete her payments on time because she does not want to create problems for her Communal Bank. She is greatly admired by the other members and is always receiving advice from them. With the loan of 1000 PEN that she requested, she will buy a bull. The actual cost of the bull is close to 2000 PEN, but she is willing to use her personal savings to cover the remaining cost.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita L. is from the village of Marabulig 1, Cauayan City. She is 46 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling door mats, pillow cases, aprons and bedding supplies to local community members. Anita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Anita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María es una madre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en un sector urbano marginal del distrito de Castilla, un distrito que pertenece a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicado a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de todo tipo de condimentos y de chifles (aperitivo típico de la región Piura, consistente en finas láminas de plátanos fritos en cocinas de leña o de carbón de algarrobo), este negocio lo tiene instalado en su domicilio y consiste en una de la principales fuentes de ingreso para su familia por lo que dia a dia da lo mejor de si para sacarlo adelante.

Ana María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más chifles, ya que este producto tiene bastante demanda por la zona, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo

Ana María es una mujer trabajadora y que lucha diariamente por sacar adelante a su familia y por darles una mejor calidad de vida. Su mayor anhelo es terminar de construir su casa ya que, al igual de la mayoria de las casas de la zona donde vive , está construida de madera contrachapada (triplay)
texts.en:
Ana María is a 42-year-old mother who lives with her husband and three children in a marginal urban area of Castilla district, a district that is part of Piura province, Piura region, located more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For over five years she has sold all kinds of condiments and chifles (a typical snack of the Piura region consisting of thin slices of fried banana cooked in wood-burning or carob wood charcoal stoves). Her business is in her home and it is one of the family’s main sources of income so she daily gives it her best in order to succeed. Ana María would like to expand her business buying more chifles because this product is in high demand in the area; thus her first request from Edpyme Alternativa for an 800 new sol loan to help her reach this objective. Ana María is a hard-working woman who struggles daily to support her family and provide them with a better quality of life. Her greatest wish is to finish building her house because, like most houses in her area, it’s merely built of plywood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chifles (fried banana chips)

loans.name: Grisell Del Rocío

texts.es:
Grisell tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y vive en el distrito de Paiján, una zona de regular movimiento comercial, pertenece a la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en solventar sus gastos personales y en aoyar a su familia en el sostenimiento de su familia.

Grisell desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.

Grisell es una mujer alegre y empeñosa, sus clientes están contentos con su atención, ya que ella siempre trata de asesorarlos al momento de adquirir su producto, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y ayudar a los suyos a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Grisell is single, 31 years old, and lives in the district of Paiján. Paiján is a commercially vibrant area located in the province of Ascope in the La Libertád region. It is two and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She sells beauty products and cosmetics by catalog. She already has built up a group of customers who buy her products regularly; the more orders she fills, the more points she gets from the company that provides the products and the more she earns. For this reason, she is always trying to get more and more clients. She uses the income she earns from this work to pay her personal expenses and to help provide for her family. Grisell would like to have a stable source of money so she can buy more products and have a fixed stock of cosmetics. This will allow her clients to get the products they need quickly without having to wait until the end of the month, when orders are placed. For this reason, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for 100 soles ($375) so she can achieve this goal. Grisell is a hardworking and contented woman. Her clients are happy with her service, since she always gives them advice about what they buy. She hopes to keep growing as a businesswoman and to help her family to keep going.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics to build her catalog sales business

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat L. A. lives in the historic city of Lahore in Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Three of them work while two are getting their education. 
Her husband has a timber selling business. He has a shop in the community area where he sells the timber to his customers and generates income for the family. He has been involved in this business for the last six years. Nusrat shares the financial burden with her husband by selling clothes, a business she has had for the last three years. She purchases the clothes from the famous bazaars of city Lahore named “Ichra” and “AnarkA.” and sells in her community. Nusrat has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy the timber in bulk and expand his business. 
Nusrat is a regular client of Asasah. From her previous two years record she has maintained good credit behavior. Nusrat hopes that this investment will  prove successful for her husband’s business and that it will increase his monthly income as well.

loans.use: To purchase timber to sell

loans.name: Ichinhorloo

texts.en: Ichinhorloo D. is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Hovd province, in western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband works for a gold exploration company, while her youngest child is a student. Ichinhorloo operates a dairy product business in her town. She started her business in 1998. She has made much progress with her business over the last year and has built a strong customer base. With her business earnings, Ichinhorloo has purchased a plot of land where the family lives. For the future, Ichinhorloo hopes to grow her business to a stable operation. Her business is very important to her and she hopes her future earnings will improve her family's quality of life. Ichinhorloo is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products for her business at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Ma. Jovelyn

texts.en: Ma. Jovelyn E. is a 36-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: food vending and farming. She lives in Prk. Maantud, Brgy. Dumalan, Dalaguete, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP). Ma. Jovelyn is now borrowing PHP 10,000 for additional capital. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Jovelyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for business

loans.name: Kenet Francis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PERLAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  Kenet; tiene 27 años de edad y es soltero; El socio trabaja en la beneficencia pública, el también estudia en la universidad ingeniería de sistemas, El socio se auto educa, el requiere el préstamo para poder pagar una mensualidad en su universidad. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en sus estudios (pago de una mensualidad a la universidad).

 El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el pL. estipulado.
texts.en:
Kenet, 27, is single. He works for the Public Welfare department but also is studying Systems Engineering at the university. He is paying for his own education and needs the loan to pay his monthly tuition fees at the university. He needs the loan to invest in his schooling (to pay a monthly fee at the university). He is a member of the “LAS PERLAS” (Pearls) communal bank located in Huanchac, Cusco province, Cusco department. He makes us of this forum to express her gratitude for the loan and to commit to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for school.

loans.name: Virginia Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Virginia es una de muchas mujeres con deseo de lograr un techo digno, siendo su familia de dos hijos y su esposo labora como mecánico.
Hoy en día se dedica al comercio de venta de chatarra, comenzando con poco y con ayuda de su esposo.
Atreves de los préstamo ha hecho mejoras en la compra de madera para mejorar su casa, un cuarto que logro hacer, pero ahora es de urgencia poder votar toda la casa de madera vieja ya que debido a los torrentes de agua en la capital, se ha aflojado toda. 
Lo que atreves de Afodenic espera levantarla de concreto y así poder tener una casa signa y con mayor seguridad.
Comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, laminas de zin, y poder comenzar hacer su nueva casa.
texts.en:
Virginia is one of many women with a desire to achieve a decent home. Her husband works as a mechanic, and they have two children. She now works in the business of selling scrap iron, which she began with very little but with the help of her husband. Through the loans she has been able to buy wood to make improvements in her home. She has succeeded in building one room, but now it is urgent to be able to replace all the old wood in the house, since it has all loosened up due to the rainstorms in the capital. Through Afodenic, she hopes to build it of concrete and thus be able to have a decent house with better security. She will buy stone, sand, cement, iron, and sheets of zinc to begin building her new house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stone, sand, cement, iron, and sheets of zinc to begin building her new house.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn B. is from the village of Sto. Domingo, Echague, Isabela. She is 26 years old. Analyn is married and has one young child. To make a living, Analyn sells personal use products such as perfumes, talc powder, lotions, and make up kits to her local community. She also sells clothes by order. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4000 PHP (Philippine pesos) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Analyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan Analyn has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Fátima María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

Para la señora Fátima el tiempo ha pasado muy rápido en el Banco Comunal, nos dice que parece que fue ayer que inicio aquí y ya son 4 ciclos en los cuales ha crecido en su vida personal  ya que ha aprendido mucho a través de las charlas educativas. Tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 10-8-y 6 años los mismos que estudian en la escuela. Su marido tiene el negocio de transporte a Montecristi en una camioneta.

Es comerciante, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ofrece sus productos a las personas que habitan por su sector, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana en las mañanas ya que en las tardes tiene que ayudar a sus hijos en sus tareas. Los productos los compra en Guayaquil, ciudad a la que viaja una vez al mes y a veces dos veces de acuerdo a lo que venda o pedidos que tenga.

Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de su mamá.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Los Corrales" meets every two weeks in the community of Los Corrales, a few minutes from the city of Montecristi. It is a region where the population has various occupations, including: artisan and general merchant. 

For Fatima time has passed very quickly. She has been a member of her community bank for the past 4 loan cycles and it feels like yesterday when she first joined. She has grown in her personal life and she has learned a great deal through the educational talks. She is 31 years old, she is married and she has 3 children, aged 10, 8, and 6 years old. They are all going to school. Her husband is in the transport business in Montecristi, using a minivan.  

She is a merchant who sells all types of clothing door to door. She offers her products to the members of her community. She completes her sales in cash and credit, collecting weekly payments. She works four days a week in the mornings and in the afternoons she helps her children with their homework. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil. She travels there once or twice per month depending on her sales and the orders she receives. 

This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise. Her dream is to have a house of her own. She lives with her mother.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en:
Enhtsetseg S. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her son and daughter both attend university and her husband is disabled. They all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent.

Enhtsetseg operates a grocery trading business in the local market. She started her grocery trading business in 1997 and has built a stable operation. She purchases a large amount of vegetables at wholesale prices and sells at the grocery market as a retailer. 

After years of successful operation her business earnings have enabled her, not only to provide for her family, but also to pay her children's tuition fees. She is a hardworking and modest woman. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase working capital of grocery business

loans.name: María Agustina

texts.es:
María Agustina tiene 33 años de edad, es separada y reside junto a  sus tres hijos en el sector Froilán Alemana del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, perteneciente a la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida. Ella prepara diariamente diversos platos de comida y los ofrece en venta al publico en general en el mercado del distrito. El negocio es su principal fuente de ingreso y debido al tiempo que lleva en la actividad y a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus alimentos, actualmente cuenta con una clientela estable y fidelizada.

María desea adquirir insumos para poder ampliar su producción y percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles. Ella es una persona luchadora y bastante responsable. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Agustina is 33 years old and separated.  She lives with her three children in the Froilán Alemana sector in the agricultural district of Tambogrande.  This zone is in the Piura province, which belongs to the region of the same name.  It is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She makes and sells food.  She prepares different dishes every day.  She sells to the general public at the district market.  The business is her primary source of income because of the time this activity takes and the good seasoning with which she prepares her food.  She currently has stable and loyal customers.

María wants to get ingredients to be able to increase her production and get greater income from her sales.  That is why she believes it advisable to request a loan for 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

She is a tenacious and very responsible person.  Her great desire is to give her daughters a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to increase her food production and sales
